Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: AllisonTuck
Reviews.Content: Central location within a short walk to all the main sights and action. Very friendly staff with excellent service (complimentary cakes, chocolate and fruit in reception). Comfortable room with all mod cons and well appointed en-suite (fantastic power shower). Amazing beds! huge, luxurious, fantastic sleep quality. The 'train carriage' themed bar is quirky but very welcoming after a full day's treading the Dutch streets. Typically for Amsterdam it's expensive to eat and drink in the hotel but there are excellent bars and restaurants in the area so go and explore. Although it's not cheap it really is good value for money. Only 10 minutes walk from the train station and very easy to find. A hidden gem which I wholeheartedly recommend. Tip - take the train from Schipol airport to Amsterdam. Easy, inexpensive and direct. Tip 2 - buy a tram travel pass opposite the train station. Excellent value for money, easy to use and a great way to see all the sights.

Reviews.Title: “excellent location”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Convent Hotel for two nights. The room was clean but a bit on the small side and the basin in the bathroom looked quite dated. Also, we were not aware of an extra 'city tax' of Â£7.50 per night at the time of booking. On the plus side, the location of the hotel was excellent and the staff very helpful and friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Worth to stay there”
Reviews.Author: kxyno
Reviews.Content: Central location, clean, quiet and spacy rooms. Polite and helpful stuff. Didn't take breakfast, I prefer the street cafe (lots nearby). No safe box in the room.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable stay at extremely comfortable, well located hotel”
Reviews.Author: lovetotravel1704
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 nights (Sunday 15 â€“ Wednesday 18 April 2012) in a double room. We chose the hotel as my husband had stayed there on a previous trip and found the hotel very comfortable and centrally located. The hotel was easy to get to as it was an easy 5 - 10 minute walk from Central Station and located on a main street. There are also tram numbers 1, 2 and 5 that passed the front of the hotel and stopped nearby. Itâ€™s located in a historic building, former monastery, and has been converted into a medium size hotel. When we arrived we were welcomed at reception and our room was already prepared. Our room was towards the rear of the hotel and we had no problems with traffic noise. The room was clean and comfortable and well decorated with a couple of old style Dutch paintings. We were impressed with the room size for a European hotel as it was quite spacious with a double bed, bedside tables, desk and chair, easy chair, wardrobe and cupboard and flat screen television with a choice of English speaking channels. There was an en suite bathroom with shower over bath and nice complementary toiletries. There was no safe in the room but there was a free safe available at reception. The service from the staff was very good throughout our stay and on the last day we were able to leave out luggage at the hotel and collect it later on in the day. We were booked on a room only basis and did not eat at the hotel although there was the option to have breakfast. We were very impressed with the hotelâ€™s facilitates. There was a large and nicely decorated reception/ lounge area and two lifts. There was the Duke of Windsor Bar which we did not use but when we looked inside it was pleasantly decorated. There was free Wi-Fi but again we did not use this service. The hotel is well located as it is a 5 minute walk to Dam Square and is surrounded by shops, bars and restaurants. Itâ€™s central but on the right side of town, just 2 roads away, from the main canals with about 10 â€“ 15 minutesâ€™ walk to Anne Frankâ€™s House. Outside the hotel there are 2 tram routes to the Rijksmuseum so it is extremely easy to get about. We had a very enjoyable stay and found the hotel very comfortable and centrally located and well priced. We would have no hesitation in recommending to others or returning ourselves.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: MrTransit
Reviews.Content: We had two rooms at the Convent for 4 nights while we stayed in Amsterdam. The hotel itself was very nice. Our room (Rm. 127) had a nice king bed with a nice down comforter, a comfortable arm chair, a desk and a dresser/minibar. The bathroom was well-appointed with a large tub, a shower that could also be detached and held, a sink and a toilet. The only complaint would be that this room was very dark; it was so close to the neighboring building that you couldnâ€™t even tell what the weather was like outside. My daughters shared a twin-bed room, which was large and filled with light (Rm. 117). Housekeeping was excellent and made sure that we were well-stocked with towels and soaps every day. The front desk was excellent; they were always willing to make recommendations about restaurants and shopping, though they usually recommended places that were too expensive for us. The rooms were quiet, and the business center had 2 computers with Internet access and a printer. One thing about the Convent is that it is convenient. It is right behind Dam Square and near Centraal Station, so most tram lines in the city come within a few blocks. It was an easy walk to the Jordaan, the canals, etc. We found that its location made it easy to visit the sights and then pop back to the hotel to freshen up before dinner, etc. I would highly recommend the Convent and would stay there again if I have the opportunity to visit Amsterdam again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: kg08953
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in March 2012. The hotel is in an excellent location, about 5 minutes walk to Dam Square and 10 mins from the Central Station. The rooms are a good size and very clean and bright. Comfortable beds and good TVs in rooms. The staff were excellent, very helpful and polite and of course all spoke perfect English. Rates very reasonable for a quality hotel in a city centre. I would definately recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Kaneko1
Reviews.Content: This hotel is amazing. My two daughters and I were travelling Europe.We had a turbulent flight from Rome, then got stuck at the airport due to a road accident. We finally got to the hotel about 9.30pm tired and exhausted. We were shown straight away to our room sank onto the bed which I can only describe as like sinking into heaven, they were the most comfortablest beds I have ever slept in. We all looked at each other and decided room service and an early night. The food was really good. They have an excellent breakfast buffet. We highly recommend this hotel. Was very well situated too.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Katherine W Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: great location, great bar, friendly staff, excellent value would recommend this hotel as met all expectations and more.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location,excellent staff”
Reviews.Author: muchbeer
Reviews.Content: Stayed with my partner and mum for 3 nights. Rooms were spotless and cleaned daily. Staff from reception to house keepers were very helpfull. The hotel is in such a good location and we managed to see everything we wanted except the Anne frank house which you should book on line as it was sold out. The Jewish museum was excellent and do take a trip on canal and too the keucanhoff tulip fields.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, good service, would definitely recommend”
Reviews.Author: Rmlondontx
Reviews.Content: We stayed there (2 adults, 2 kids) and had a good sized room that worked fine. The hotel front desk was helpful with our questions. The hotel is very conveniently located to the train station, the main canals, and good restaurants. Would recommend without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place and good location”
Reviews.Author: moatpeople
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in Feb for long weekend largely on basis of Trip advisor reviews and good package. 5 minutes walk from Central Station so brilliant location. Reception staff very helpful indeed marking our maps and offering ideas for our few days. They even researched train times for trip to the Hague and printed them off for us. Had large room on top floor, though wardrobe space was limited with only bedside drawers available with limited hanging space, so lucky we were not staying very long. It was very quiet and looked out across roof tops, so very pleasant. We didn't have breakfast in the package and it sounded expensive at 25 euros, so we found lovely cafe in the Beguinhof platz.They recommended the Saturday market nearby and we spent a great few hours wandering round the food stalls and then the antiques, so give it a try. Had lovely hour in the bar,when we were too tired to walk any more with very good service and nice relaxing atmosphere, Not the most modern hotel, but their welcoming approach was great , good location and we would use it again. Do try the Italian restaurant almost opposite the hotel, the food and service were excellent and the limoncello superb. And if possible visit the Van Gogh Museum on the Friday evening when they change the foyer into a bar with live music. It really adds to the atmosphere and the museum is stunning.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location”
Reviews.Author: shaz69Aberdeen
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel in ideal location. Fantastic breakfast, delightful bar and happy attentive staff. Very comfortable large bed. Will definately recommend and will try and be back !

Reviews.Title: “so close to everything.”
Reviews.Author: barbaramcmahon
Reviews.Content: this hotel is centrally located and easily accessible from the train station. If you have a lot of luggage, it is too far to walk, so take the tram or a cab. The hotel is very quaint, having been a convent at one time. Our room was located on the top floor, felt kind of like a little garrett of our own. the thing I liked most is the staff-they were always ready and willing to assist with transportation, restaurants,directions, etc. This is extremely important if you are visiting a city for the first time!

Reviews.Title: “Very good location with style”
Reviews.Author: STOPTHEUNACCEPTABLE
Reviews.Content: Was in a room with view on the streets. Superbe shower, the bed is so comfortable ( all beds in this hotel have the MyBed system) The red light district is 7 min walk, the Dam square is 7 min walk as well. tram station is opposite the hotel. Breakfast is expensive but worth to have.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Spring break”
Reviews.Author: Theresa B
Reviews.Content: The Convent was easy to find, only about 10 minutes walk from the Centraal station in Amstrerdam. The check-in staff were helpful and friendly, and gave us a choice of rooms. They aslo gave us a map and in perfect English, were able to direct us to the nearest cashpoint. The room was comfortable and clean, although we did have a bit of trouble getting the TV to work. The breakfasts were superb; so much to choose from and something for everyone. The hotel is ideally placed with a tram stop outside, although is within easy walking distance of lots of attractions, landmarks, shops and pl;aces to eat.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: mumarah
Reviews.Content: This is about the 8th hotel i have stayed in when visiting Amsterdam and I quite enjoyed my stay here. Check-in staff were friendly and very quick which is a bonus when you just want to drop your bags in your room and get out to town. Its very close to Centraal Station and a 5 min walk to Dam Square. Room was a reasonable size and the bed was pretty big too. My only slight issue was that the shower didnt go quite hot enough. WiFi worked okay as well. I cant comment on the restaurant as I didnt go in at all (I really should start trying more hotel restaurants!)

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous hotel, supercomfy beds and great breakfast”
Reviews.Author: JCol75
Reviews.Content: We loved this hotel, the favourite on our European trip. Beds were sooooo comfortable, rooms very quiet, breakfast buffet best I have ever had in Europe, with delicious hot chocolate for the kids. Location really good, tram stop just opposite and the centraal station 4 mins walk away. We got a great 3 nights for 2 including breakfast on the Accor website, was fantastic value, Very very highly recommended

Reviews.Title: “"Niceish"hotel - Location is spot on”
Reviews.Author: Minal
Reviews.Content: The location is the thing that is going for this hotel. Very close to the train station. Tram stop right outside and walkable to most places. We upgraded to a superior room and the room was very charming on the 5th floor with beams on the ceiling. Bathroom a little dated however. Can't comment on the food as I was not going to to pay 23 euros each for breakfast - a right con on my mind. How can a peice of toast and a couple of egss really cost that much. To pay over 40 quid for the 2 of us on breakfast each day - I think not! We had two gripes about the hotel - 1 was the towel we were first left with was dirty. A quick call to reception ensured this was changed and we were given new towels every day for our trip. This was not really necessary as we were happy to reuse the towels again as long as they were clean and used by ourselves only. However a nice gesture. Secondly, and slightly annoying and disspoitingly, the man who comes to check the mini bar was rude. He knocked and let himself into our room without waiting for us to answer. I was not appropriatly dressed and my husband had not even made it to the door to let him in when he barged in. My husband was furious and this man did not even apologise. Very very rude and a let down on the reflection of staff at the hotel. He even had the cheek to blame us for not getting to the door in time (10 seconds by the time it took my hubbie to answer is not long!) and he saw we were charging our mobile phones in the plugs - he said that was not allowed! How on earth can one not be allowed to use the plug sockets for crying out loud. If it wasn't for this man perhaps I would rate the hotel higher. It was something I would not expect from staff at any hotel and leaves a bad taste in our minds. I wonder if anyone from the hotel will read this. Also, tips to note. Walk down about 5 mins to the dam square there is a supermarket where you can buy water/drinks/bread. We made our own breakie each day - we even brought along mini cereal boxes from the uk and bought milk. Save your pennies really! Amsterdam is charming in its own way, however am not in love with the place and didn't feel the magic say Paris or Prague hold. Can't say I will rush back at all.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing historically; otherwise fine”
Reviews.Author: Val47
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for a modern comfortable hotel this may be for you. It is conveniently situated for the train station and most of the tourist attractions. We couldn't fault the staff who allowed us in to our room mid morning and helped out with transport information better than the tourist information staff! However, we spend a long time trying to find a good hotel with history and what was disappointing for us was the history that is promoted on the hotel website is nowhere to be seen in the hotel. The breakfast at â‚¬22 was too much for our tourist pockets but we had a more than adequate pancake breakfast in the city for less than half the price. Unfortunately we have had to rate sleep quality as average as the beds were so very soft which may delight some but both of our backs complained!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Linda J
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 4 nights and the service was great but for a 4 star hotel it was rather tired.The rooms were very dark with not much natural light and the only lighting in the rooms were small lamps.I would recommend it for a comfortable stay as it was it just didn't have that luxury feel of a 4 star.Also I had picked the hotel for the history which wasn't really evident when we got there. The hotel bar though is great! Its modeled like the orient express and the service was imbeccable and the standard was extremley high. The business centre is also good but rooms are also fitted with wifi. The beds are great!! They were so comfortable and perfect for a rest after a hard day walking through the city.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in the hart of the city”
Reviews.Author: ericschlangen
Reviews.Content: I arranged a stay for 8 rooms for a three day meeting in the Netherlands. I got a good deal including a discount, free wifi and breakfast. The rooms are very nice for Amsterdam. Location is fantastic. Atmosphere in this former convent is special. Interior is a bit outdated but in good condition. Service is friendly and correct. Breakfast is nice.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location and very friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: EstebanBelgrado
Reviews.Content: This was my 2nd stay in this hotel after couple of years. Location is absolutely fantastic. Street is easy to approach by taxi and you are very close to everything in a city center. You have shopping streets, bars, restaurants and red light districts in 3-10 minutes walk from the hotel. Staff was great, friendly and very helpful. Since I'm A Club member I received free upgrade with a bottle of sparkling wine and some chocolates. Very nice. There is a free wireless in the room that works very good. Breakfast is also very nice. The only bad thing with this hotel is that it's quite old. Furniture is old, bathroom facilities as well. So it can't look very clean. Even when it's clean. But on the other hand the price for such a location in new hotels would be much higher. I highly recommend this place to all tourists. Also quite OK for business.

Reviews.Title: “ideal location”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Convent hotel last weekend . We arrived early hoping to be able to just leave our bags , but the friendly staff let us book in. The hotel is in an ideal location, a few minutes walk from central station , and close to all attractions. The tram was right outside the hotel , but we walked everywhere . Thoroughly enjoyed my weekend in Amsterdam .

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel.”
Reviews.Author: 4sure86
Reviews.Content: This is a perfectly located hotel near the historic centre and within walking distance to most of the significant sites. Considering that most hotel rooms in Amsterdam are ridiculously small, this hotel room was relatively large, but only by Amsterdam standards. I liked the aesthetics of the building. Service was exceptional. Not cheap but for the quality of the hotel the price was fine. There are broadly two types of tourists in Amsterdam - those here for the marajuana and the more traditional tourists who do not engage in this. This hotel attracts the latter.

Reviews.Title: “Would stay again & recommend”
Reviews.Author: Holly M Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Extremely pleased with this hotel. Very close to the station, shops & restaurants. We walked everywhere from the hotel. The bed was amazing. So comfy. We did have to pay city tax of about Â£20 which we didn't know about but this seems to happen everywhere. Lovely hotel with classic look, everything you need.

Reviews.Title: “Great location For City Trip”
Reviews.Author: Colm M Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Service was good, was given excellent tourist advice on check-in - where to go what to see etc, even gave us maps & discount vouchers for a number of city attractions. Location is excellent, minutes walk form Centraal Station and Dam Square. Tram stop only metres from the front door. Room we got had a view of an adjacent building which was disappointing. Breakfast was excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: andymfb61
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel at the end of Feb. The hotel is approx. 10 mins walk from central station. Check-in was easy. The staff were friendly. The room was a good size and was very clean, a maid came in everyday. There was a good selection at breakfast with efficent staff. The bar is a nice area with a very pleasent barman. The hotel is central to most tourist sites with lots of bars and restaurants within walking distance. We visited the Anne Frank house which isn't too far away and is worth seeing but I would say to book in advance on the internet. We then went to a cafe called Winkle. My wife had the apple pie and she said it was the best she's ever had. After that we walked to the House of Bols. It's good fun and interesting and you get a cocktail and 2 shots at the end. I would recommend the Convent Hotel to anyone. If there's one small thing wrong for me it's that there is no room safe'

Reviews.Title: “One of the best choices in upper-mid range hotels in Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: VittoM
Reviews.Content: Very nice located hotel a few steps away from all Amsterdam sights. The breakfast is excellent and, in my opinions, one of the best in his class. The staff is very friendly and professional. Nice room, well equipped and perfectly cleaned. Only cons is the bed, big but, for me not very comfortable. We have really enjoyed our stay!

Reviews.Title: “Great location & good staff”
Reviews.Author: cc1Uk
Reviews.Content: Stayed her for 5 nights on business and was impressed by the convenient location to the centre of Amsterdam. The staff were friendly and helpful and the bedrooms were well appointed. One small issue is that if you need to work the ligthing in the room is poor.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location & friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: Tello84
Reviews.Content: A 10 minute walk from Central Station and 5 minutes from the shops and bars. There are lots of places to eat on the same road and your spoilt for choice really! The hotel was gorgeous. Check in was quick and easy. Staff were friendly and helpful and allowed us to leave our bags there after we checked out. The rooms were a good size and clean. The beds are AMAZING!! Best nights sleep in a hotel by far. They seem to hug you to sleep! I would definitely stay again when I come back for another visit.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: Antandmike
Reviews.Content: If you are taking the train to central station it's a fairly quick walk just got out the main door and cross the bridge and follow the main street for about 6 blocks (the blue metro cars will take you close to the hotel) its on the left hand side of the street. Check in was very easy and the staff spoke English this made it easy to get direction and ask general questions. When they give you a room make sure it does not end in "29" these rooms are next to the elevator and are extremely noisy. The standard room is small but nice and yes probably needs a good scrub down. Make sure and try the apple pie and coffee in the lobby bar it was excellent..the whole staff was very pleasant and helpful but I agree that if you can spare the extra $$ upgrade to a better room

Reviews.Title: “Precious central hotel”
Reviews.Author: izabellamartins
Reviews.Content: The Convent Hotel is a precious charming hotel very well positioned, just a few steps from many kinds of touristic and interesting places. The Central Station and the Dam Square are in walking distance, and the hotel's street is vibrant and has lots of restaurants and bus and tram's stops. The bedroom was great, with a large and comfortable queen bed and a comfortamble single bed. The decor is great, in fashionable old style.The service is attentive. I would be back certainly!

Reviews.Title: “excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: I found the convent hotel excellent in every way. It was central , clean , comfortable, had free internet and the breakfast was also excellent. I am not able to find anything negative. I look forward to visiting again.

Reviews.Title: “Very happy - amazing room, great location.”
Reviews.Author: GasMan81
Reviews.Content: Stayed there with my wife for a short weekend break. We upgraded to a lux. room which was fantastic - huge comfortable bed, amazing bathroom with massive walk in shower and the toilet was in it's own room next to the bathroom. Perfect location for exploring the city and a short walk from Centraal Station. Tip - don't listen to the door man when checking out. He told us that there had been a fire in one of the train tunnels and we could only get to Schiphol Airport in a taxi which also happened to be waiting outside and would cost 40 euros. This was a lie because there was no fire and the train to Schiphol doesn't go through any tunnels. Be aware of this tactic (hustle) and your stay at the Convent will be perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Value for money.”
Reviews.Author: Schoey_7
Reviews.Content: The hotel is well positioned for getting out and about. Walking distance from Centraal Station and handy for trams. Room was reasonably spacious for a major city and the bed very comfortable. Was there following my favourite football team so a pleasant change from normal inflated prices. In Amsterdam there is not too much reason for hanging around the hotel but the reception, bar and lounge looked pleasant. Don't think you can go far wrong with the Convent!

Reviews.Title: “Graet Location, fantastic bed and errr..”
Reviews.Author: smjak02
Reviews.Content: Another trip to Amsterdam with pals, been many times normally a celebration this time for football. Problems began when I booked what I thought was a breakfast inclusive pre paid rate. The confirmation didnâ€™t have breakfast on it so I raised with Accor shortly after reservation. They said they passed it on to the hotel never heard of again. Didnâ€™t query on arrival. Never had it and wasnâ€™t attracted for 23e. Many places nearby if youd rather. My prepaid booking , backed up by my A Club card seemed to cause more difficulty than necessary. The staff having greeted me in English discussed my reservation in Dutch presumably so I didnâ€™t know Especially as I was the asked to fill in my address when their booking system already had it, a pet hateâ€¦ Was given a map which I was going to request but it is really small typoe wise. Worst bathroom ever. The sink was pitted with cracks which were dirty, never seen the like. Toilet very weak flush. I was up late one night. I had a do not disturb on. I am pretty sure the cleaning staff knocked and then later banged on my door and then followed it up with a phone call. Didnâ€™t answer any of it. A more traditional way to deal with this is to put a note under the door saying you have missed service but let us know. Went out around 2pm was out for 11 hours came back room not cleaned or bed made, even though they were still on my floor when I left . Could even get staff on on the times that suit your customers doubt I am the first person to have a lie in in the hotel A hotel of this standard should have a safe in every room. As I was not asked anything about how my stay was on departure, I didnâ€™t raise these issues although I have filled in a survey on line that was waiting for me on my return. Nice bar, wonderful bed and location the main mitigation. Plenty of choice round here though, doubt I will return. 2 1/2 out of 5 but you cant do itâ€¦

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: msprichj
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for three nights over the new year and found it to be a lovely hotel. The room was spacious and well equipped and the bed was sizeable and very comfortable. The toiletries were plentiful and although the bathroom could do with a bit of a facelift, it was clean and the shower was powerful and refreshing. Despite the hotel's central location, we didn't fail to have a great night's sleep. The staff were helpful and friendly and the hotel bar was actually a lovely quiet retreat, with large, comfortable chairs - ideal for a nightcap or a game of cards! Amsterdam train station is literally only a 10 minute walk away and Dam square is only 10 minutes in the opposite direction: for a central location with access to everything, you couldn't ask for more. All in all, a great place and would highly recommend it if you're visiting Amsterdam and want to be in easy walking distance of all the highlights.

Reviews.Title: “Two nights at the Convent”
Reviews.Author: 1960john
Reviews.Content: The hotel is well appointed although I don't know if it deserves 4 stars. Breakfast was steep at â‚¬23 each especially when one of party was 12. We were in a triple room up a side street on the first floor facing a hostel. It was very noisy all night and I had two of the worst nights sleep ever. I would agree the room could have been cleaner there were bits on the carpet when we arrived,but the beds were clean and bedding lovely. Would we stay here again? Probably not but we wouldn't want to stay at this side of Amsterdam and would probably try the museum side if we were to visit again.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in a great location.”
Reviews.Author: Welltravelled031
Reviews.Content: We have just had a 3 night stay in the Convent Hotel, which is part of the Accor group. We always do our homework before travelling and yet again this proved to be very fruitful. Having arrived in freezing temperatures, it was lovely to walk into this warm hotel. Check-in was good and we were asked whether we'd like a low or high room. I asked for a high one at the rear, as others had said it was quieter there. We were given 515 which again was warm and welcoming. The view over the snowy roof tops was great but also very quiet for sleeping. The radiator was easily adjusted to suit. Bathroom was fine with good quality shower gel etc if you need it. Lovely soft towels, plus a dressing gown and slippers. The best bit was the 6'6'' bed. Very comfortable with gorgeously fluffy pillows! The room was well appointed with plug sockets in the right places, plenty of lamps, kettle and the makings and the tv has BBC1 and 2. We booked through the hotel's website and got a deal of 3 nights for the price of 2, inc breakfast. This was a bonus as they charge 23 euros for it, albeit plentiful and very tasty, inc full cooked or continental. However if you want something cheaper, there is a cafe next door with full breakfast for 5.50 euros. The bar area was very nice, although the prices can be a bit steep. The position was very convenient with about a 10 minute walk from the station, directly opposite tram stops and close enough to all the attractions Amsterdam has to offer. Overall we would go back to this hotel and recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent choice”
Reviews.Author: Claire Whalley M Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Went on a mid-week break and even though it was freezing cold, this hotel was perfectly heated and super-comfortable. Hotels in Amsterdam aren't known for being very big but the room we had (standard king-size) was perfect for our needs. Also, try the Duke of Windsor bar if you can for Apple pie, whipped cream and coffee - an absolute treat! Staff were friendly and had a very lovely 3 night break here. Thoroughly recommended

Reviews.Title: “disgusting service black mould in hotel room”
Reviews.Author: Dave P
Reviews.Content: The hotel room was dirty there was black mould all over the bathroom roof once i complained we were treated like Scum off the streets Staff were very rude they over charged us 100 euros because they did not put my mum on the booking moved us to a smaller room with single beds was meant to be a tripple queen or double room there where three of us staying in the same room Manager had the worst attitude problem when i told him his hotel was disgusting after the crappy service DO NOT STAY HERE ........ 50 euro for a single bed to be added to your room per night !!!! DISGUSTING! the mattres 's were bases of beds with a thick blankets instead of Real mattreses all three beds were the same.. cleaners were lazy and left crap every where make you wait if you want fresh milk with your coffee and breakfast was meant to be included but then they tried to charge us 23 euro each per day for a salami and cheese sandwich there was no cereal or milk or bacon or eggs or anything So much for a full continental brekky

Reviews.Title: “Charming hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: Layla D
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I went to Amsterdam for my birthday and stayed at this hotel. The room was clean and cosy with a lovely comfy bed. The hotel bar was nice for a cocktail before heading out for the evening and getting around from there is very easy by tram or on foot. We will definitely stay here again when we return to Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel in old classic style.”
Reviews.Author: vkovr
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel in old classic style. Not far from the central station and main Amsterdam attractions. Very good lounge bar. Friendly staff. Hotel is good for couples and friends.A lots of bars and coffee shops nearby. Minuses â€“ WI-FI not very good.

Reviews.Title: “Like sleeping in a cloud...”
Reviews.Author: KB2010
Reviews.Content: I booked two twin rooms at The Convent Hotel after exhaustive searching. I have stayed in Amsterdam before and my experiences of the hotels there ranged from grim, to indifferent. I was taking my daughter and two friends, and it's always hard to get things right when booking for other people. I had originally booked another hotel, which was the same price, but more of a boutique hotel and situated in the red light district. My daughter wanted to be in the thick of the action, and the hotel looked really nice from the photos, but thankfully, I had second thoughts and decided to re-read the reviews. It was the one which described a 'sticky white substance' which had appeared on the outside of the bedroom window overnight, which quickly made up my mind, and I cancelled my booking immediately. We passed that hotel during our stay, and I was very glad that I chose sober convent over sticky boutique. The Convent Hotel is an easy walk from the station and is centrally situated for everything you might wish to see in Amsterdam. Our check-in was smooth and pleasant and we were given adjoining rooms, which was great as we had a connecting door. I have read about the decor being tired in the rooms, and admittedly, it is not a boutique hotel, but you are not paying boutique hotel prices. We found the rooms spotlessly clean, tidy and containing everything you might need for a comfortable stay: Lots of new, white towels, great toiletries, bathrobes, and without a shadow of a doubt, the most comfortable beds in Amsterdam, of not the whole of Europe. I'm a bit of a stickler about hotel bedding and hate cheap, foam pillows. The beds at the Convent have mattress toppers, clean, crisp white sheets, which appeared to be brand new, and the softest, most comfortable pillows in Christendom. It was like falling asleep in a cloud. We didn't eat breakfast at the hotel as there are a huge number of places to eat within strolling distance. The bar is lovely, and inexpensive if you choose happy hour. But, be warned, any drinks not included on the happy hour cocktail menu are fearfully expensive - double JD and coke = Â£17. In conclusion, we were all delighted with our stay at the Convent Hotel, for it's location, helpful staff, lovely bedding, and very reasonable price. I would recommend this hotel to anybody looking for a really comfortable, peaceful stay in Amsterdam. N.B.There is an amazing restaurant called Humphrey's just around the corner from the hotel, which was so good we ate there on both nights.

Reviews.Title: “excellent place”
Reviews.Author: amfitryon
Reviews.Content: This hotel is on the second station of the tram from the central station [on your right hand when you exit from the central station,you will find the tram].For me is the most important,because,when you are in Amsterdam you must be always outside [museums,entertaiment,shopping,concerts,ballets,canals view ect].The hotel is in very good condition,but,if you want bigger room,or street view,you must pay more.Helpfull staff,good breakfast,charmy bar.Thats all.Many restaurants around the hotel,the main shopping street [Damrak] is behind the hotel and the Dam place also behind,150 m.Suggestion: is better and very cheep to use the day ticket of public transportation [15 euro 3 days] and no the expensive love amsterdam.You will find outside of central station,close to tourist info.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable Stay”
Reviews.Author: smbsstt Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Perfect location, central to all attractions and restaurants! Rooms getting a bit tired, perhaps. But nevertheless, they were clean and comfortable. The staff ver also very helpful!

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable stay”
Reviews.Author: dancing_luv
Reviews.Content: The Convent is quite a big hotel. Centrally located, you are in walking distance to Dam Square & moments from the train. We upgraded our room to a Luxury Room & reception was very helpful & got us checked in before the normal time. We had a great room with lots of space. Bed was extremely comfortable & the bathroom was nice & spacious. The water pressure in the shower however was fairly poor & didnâ€™t heat up very well. This was the only downside. I would suggest getting breakfast included in your package here, as I donâ€™t really recall seeing many cafÃ© options nearby. If you are coming to Amsterdam by train/Eurail, donâ€™t bother getting a taxi to the hotel, as itâ€™s only about a 10 min walk or less (& the taxi will charge you a minimum of EUR 10 for a 2 min journey). Staff very helpful and professional.

Reviews.Title: “Good and Bad”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Perfect location, within walking distance from the train station and other sights. Great bar. Rooms are spacious as are bathrooms. Free wi-fi kept knocking us off which was annoying. Bed was incredibly comfortable. Ask for a room not on the street as we had a lot of drunk noise makers walking down the street late at night. Besides the location, the best thing about this hotel is the people. Couldn't have been more friendly and helpful. Even though the carpet was frayed and lumpy in the room and there was mildew in the corner of the tub, we would definitely stay there again because the people and location were so great.

Reviews.Title: “A jolly weekend in The Dam”
Reviews.Author: WanderinWoman
Reviews.Content: Had a great stay in this hotel. Room not massive but quiet and well located to all the local attractions.Hotel bar lovely and cosy and reception staff helpfull. Bed very comfortable and mini bar not too expensive, All in all would recommend this hotel for couples and business and great for a getaway weekend any time.

Reviews.Title: “Best services I have ever had in a hotel, and a great location too.”
Reviews.Author: IamMatt
Reviews.Content: The staff here are fantastic, they were very friendly and helpful. They were very easy to deal with and didn't make us feel that we were bothering them. The location is very good - a short walk from the train station, dam square, Anne Frank House, and most of the main sights in Amsterdam. If it is too far to walk the tram stops right out side. If I visit Amsterdam again I will stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Birthday Weekend”
Reviews.Author: bobSouthport Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for my wifes birthday, the large luxury room was excellent, the living area was large with a settee two arm chairs and a small drinks table, the bed was huge and very comfortable. Bathroom a bit tired but adequate, the room service could be improved, no shower cap, the toileries and tissues weren't replaced and light bulbs weren't working, small details but important Location was great, a couple of small cafes doing good breakfasts, on a couple of tram routes and walking distance to the station

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location, great staff and the most confortable bed ever”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: I was looking for a good central hotel and this one was a great surprise - 6 minutes walk from the Grand Central train station, comfortable, great staff service and close to everything you need from Amsterdam. I got a special 50% discount by booking via their website, so I was on the Luxury room, that have a private lift access and the windows are for the less busy street - so you can really have a nice night sleep (or day, if youÂ´ve spent your night two blocks across the street at the Red Light district). Pros: service (great front staff people), bed comfort (yes the one IÂ´ve used was really good!), bathroom (cool shower), location (Dam, Redlight, restaurants, coffeeshops and shopping, just around the corner) ; Cons: maybe a small update at the rooms, but minor stuff.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet and welcoming”
Reviews.Author: michaelkb Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Arrived early morning to 'dump our bags' but the room was ready and was in it by 10am , also ofered a late chack out free of charge until 2pm on the Sunday. Service was as good as expected , rooms although a bit dated were comfortable with the whole hotel very quiet although busy. Food/drink overly expensive but the overriding feel of being in a country hotel in the middle of the city outweighed any negative points. Location excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Just average, likely overrated”
Reviews.Author: angelic1-2
Reviews.Content: The Convent Hotel had an excellent location as mentioned many times before. Close to Dam Square, the Central Station, Anne Frank House, Red Light District and transportation. The staff were pleasant but not overly friendly and really not helpful. The rooms were good sized but really need to be updated and given some new life, the bed was not very comfortable at all-lumpy and hard. The bathroom had a deep tub which could be hard for some to navigate! The room was quiet, we stayed on the back of the hotel overlooking the alley and there was no noise or disturbances. The restaurant and bar prices were outrageous so we ate outside of the hotel and there were plenty of options very close by. Overall, I don't feel it is a 4 star hotel in any aspects, the room rates were really high for the service and shape of the rooms. Next time in Amsterdam, I will definately find a different place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Convent Hotel Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The Convent Hotel has a great location. It's close to the tram, restaurants, and shops but away from crowds and noise. Although we did not eat at the hotel, the neighborhood offered a wide variety of restaurants. The staff was friendly and helpful. Our room was well furnished and quiet.

Reviews.Title: “Weekend in Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The staff were very friendly and the luxury room was great , although maybe not with the "Wow!" factor to match the rate. The hotel bar was cosy and very nicely done in an "Orient Express" train style and the cocktails were extremely good especially in happy hour. Well worth a look and central for all the attractions.

Reviews.Title: “Amsterdam DEC2011”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: This hotel has a very good location, near Dam square and main shopping area. Value for the money also very good. There were spa facilities in the hotel but I haven't use any so I can not give any feedback on that. The superior room that I booked was quite big, a bit old fashion furnished, but in general good and clean enough. The breakfast was a bit expensive but that's an option and you might skip it.

Reviews.Title: “Nice location”
Reviews.Author: Amy_traveltheworld Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Close to the station. The hotel is situated between the 'coffee shops' and modern shopping area. For us ( 20.y.o female and 25y.o. male) we loved it. We were initially concerned by the proximity to dozens of coffee shops, but soon realised this was apart of the Amsterdam atmosphere. The bathrooms certainly needed a renovation giving them a 2 stars. The hotel is not worth more then a 3.5 stars, whilst the building and room are nice, the service was only that of a 3 star hotel. Would stay here again for location.

Reviews.Title: “very decent rooms and well situated”
Reviews.Author: Wim H
Reviews.Content: rooms are big and well equiped. very clean. nice fitness and sauna facilities. staff is extremely friendly and helpfull. the hotel is in the middle of the centre and close to all activities. 1 disadvantage: no parking and no free wi-fi...

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Great location & Good value! We stayed at more expensive hotels before and after our stay at the Convent but this was my favorite spot. There is a very cozy pub downstairs modeled after the Orient Express. I would definitely recommend it to friends who plan to visit Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: Axyl100 Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: This is a gem of a hotel. It is a really beautiful building with a very stylish decor. The Pullman bar was cosy and welcoming with an interesting cocktail list. Staff at breakfast were so welcoming and friendly and breakfast was staisfying even with the limited menu choice. We would definitely go back

Reviews.Title: “Amazing stay”
Reviews.Author: fredlivbr Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Wonderfull hotel! The better location I`ve had in Amsterdam, nice and friendly stafs confy and soft beds. Anyway, one of my best stay in my life! Thanks to all The Convent McGallery hotel team. Frederico Brazil

Reviews.Title: “Not what I expected from a MGallery brand hotel”
Reviews.Author: Robberbobbles Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: MGallery is pitched as "a collection of excetional hotels" just below the Sofitel/Pullman brands at the top of the Arcor product range....but honestly, I have stayed in much nicer Novotel and Mercure hotels. There is nothing exceptional about the location or the hotel...Sorry Arcor... this one lets the brand down and I will think twice before I try another one. A warm welcome and easy checkout...but the hotel is clearly an older property and has nice lobby area and bar, but even the latter serves nothing more than cheese and ham toastie foodwise during the day - not exactly "exceptional". However, its the rooms that you pay for and these are where I felt most let down. The bed had some uncomfortable feather comforter on top of the mattress which lumped up to the middle and left you rolling out of the bed, and the bedding on top was barely adequate. I'll ignore the window and balcony of another house 3ft in front of my window....that goes with the city location and a standard room, but not being able to crack the window open...poor as was the thinning and old looking carpet in the room. The bathroom was also pretty average....has been a long time since a makeover with the sink worn and yellowed. Basic 3* fair except for the toiletries etc. For me the stay was summed up by a comment made by one of the reception team at checkin while resolving a credit card problem...that they would have a good christmas if they could find a buyer for the hotel....maybe he was joking, but in hindsight I would agree, Arcor should either lose this one from their property list or spend some serious money to make it an exceptional place that Ms Kristan Scott Thomas (their brand ambassador) would want to come and stay.

Reviews.Title: “great location, great service”
Reviews.Author: leicia
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for the first night of a short countries-hopping trip and it became the benchmark to beat. Best bedspreads on a good bed, free and working wi-fi and the reception/concierge was really accommodating. Location is right smack where everything is and yet it remained calm and quiet for good sleep. For a first time try, it was better than I expected and wouldn't mind staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: csbsn2002
Reviews.Content: We booked into The Convent Hotel in a luxury king room for our first visit and just loved it. Spacious by European standards, wonderful bed, so comfortable. This had a private entrance and elevator and very quiet. The location of the hotel is perfect for sightseeing in Amsterdam. We left Amsterdam for a couple days and returned to a standard room at The Convent. Again, extremely comfortable, slightly less space in this room but still great comfort. The Staff here are all so very friendly and helpful. Directed us to great places to eat etc. We so would encourage others to try this hotel. We are going back to the Netherlands in 2012 and plan to stay again at The Convent.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient stay in Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: Jon5440
Reviews.Content: A friend and I stayed overnight in December 2011. The hotel was a great base for exploring the surounding area - an easy walk from the train station (which is itself an easy transfer from the airport) and close to Dam Square and just about everything you'd want to visit as a tourist. We chose a superior room, which was very large and comfortable, with plenty of in-room ammenities. Previous posters have included pictures of minor imperfections in rooms, such as sinks with small hairline cracks, and our room was of similar age/condition. That said, we didn't have any concerns with these insignificant details, as overall the hotel shows very nicely. The view was of rooftops, which was pleasant. The beds were comfortable and easily configured into two seperate twins (by special request ahead of check in, but certainly easy enough for guests to rearrange themselves, since night stands were also able to be moved). The breakfast (free through an Accor promotion) was much better than I expected, with a large selection of hot and cold items and good quality and presentation. The hotel was kind enough to store our bags all day, and they were gracious when we needed to access them midday to retrieve hats and gloves for the worsening weather. All and all I'd recommend it without quetsion.

Reviews.Title: “Very Good”
Reviews.Author: Sakalis Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The hotel is situated at the very heart of Amsterdam.It is within walking distance from the Amsterdam Centraal station.The staff were very friendly.They answered very politetely all our enquiries.We had no breakfast, so I can't comment on this.The room was cleaned very well every day.Maybe the only drawback is that the hotel is in need of new carpets or new flooring but what the heck,you can't have everything.

Reviews.Title: “One night at the Convent”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The staff are very friendly and helpful, with a can-do attitude. The room was in good shape and well-equipped with accessories. I liked the full buffet breakfast (hot and cold options). All things considered, the Convent is a good option for either business travellers or tourists.

Reviews.Title: “very good hotel!”
Reviews.Author: sara_psq
Reviews.Content: We have been there at the beginning of December 2011. The hotel is in a very convenient position, near to the Central Station (500 meters more or less) and it is just behind Dam Place. The location, besides being near to several attractions, is also a quiet street. The room was nice, not very big, but there was enough space for our luggage as well! There was free wifi in the room and in the lobby. Also the lobby is very cozy and warm. There are some restaurants in the area, so there is no need to go far from the hotel for dinner. The only thing that I have to say is that the bathroom needs to be refreshed and renewed.... but the room and bathroom (the latter despite being quite old) were very clean, Staff were nice and very helpful. We did not have the breakfast included in our room rate, but we enjoyed a good breakfast at 10â‚¬ per person, which in in my opinion is a good price! Of course this is not the price for the full breakfast menu (that is â‚¬22). I would highly recommend staying at this hotel in Amsterdam, for the good service, the staff, and also for the free wifi and for the hotel itself.

Reviews.Title: “Almost perfect”
Reviews.Author: Scoobzy
Reviews.Content: Compared to other hotels in Amsterdam old/new town area with similar cost and star rating, I would definately recommend this hotel. Positives: location (walkable to most tourist attractions and transport links). Comfortable, spacious rooms. Safe area (and a safe walk along main streets to hotel when coming back late night), nice building and front desk staff. Negatives: - poor shower pressure and our room had a view of a brick wall. These points had very little bearing on our stay however but I would request another room for the sake of getting in some natural light if I came here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: akd94
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights in August 2011. The reception staff were very friendly and helpful. The rooms aren't that big (if you have really big suitcases you could be falling over them), but are clean, comfortable and the bathroom is modern. There are tea and coffee making faclities (which is always appreciated when staying on a 'room only' basis). The location is great - on one of the main roads, with a number of trams running past. We walked pretty much everywhere - nowhere seems to be too far from the hotel and if you get tired legs, you can jump on the tram. Its worth getting the IAmsterdam card - free entry into loads of museums, reductions in some restuarants and canal trips, and a tram pass as well. We got the 48 hour pass, which is valid for 48 hrs from the first time you use it. If you want to go to the Anne Frank museum, do this first (i.e before using the IAmsterdam card to maximise the amount of time you can use it for) and book a slot online - you literally walk past the queues, and go to the talk beforehand. And dont forget a waterproof - even in August it rained constantly.

Reviews.Title: “Weekend in Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: lisa t
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel 1st weekend December 2011, and would like to say it is one of the nicest hotels i have stayed in for a long time, rooms were very clean well organised and the bed was very large and comfortable, I travelled with my partner and another couple who were all equally impressed with this hotel. The location is excellent as you are within walking distance of the central station as well as all other tourist attractions bars shops and restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “An excellent hotel - don't believe the poor reviews”
Reviews.Author: bollidear
Reviews.Content: I've read all the reviews and am amazed by anyone who can give a negative slant on this excellent hotel. I consider I am qulaified to compare this hotel having stopped at the Krasnapolski, Barbizon Palace and Crown Plaza. There really are some professional moaners on Tripadvisor. We arrived early (12pm) and were welcomed by attentive reception staff who phoned housekeping to ensure our requested room was made available. The room was spotlessly clean, well apointed and with an excellent bed. An Amsterdam room in a 400 year old building will never match the size of an American characterless concrete box - so don't compare (unless of course you have an American 400 year old Holiday Inn to compare to. If I had one comment, it would be that the room lacked natural light. Again, this is due to the age of the building and the surrounding buildings that can obsure the light a little. It caused us no problems and only added to the ambience. But if you feel a moan coming on about a room with diminsihed daylight - don't book the Convent. We stayed on B&B and were amazed at the fantastic breakfast laid on in a delightful dining room, served by friendly, attentive staff. The freshness, quality and range of food was the best I have ever seen in a hotel outside of the Ritz. Its hard to articulate and quantify what I realy liked about the Hotel - but we just felt incredibly comfortable in it. Not too stuffy, informal, relaxing, genuine and just a damn good place to stay. Location is perfect. Ignore stupid comments about massage parlours - there are only a few and they actually are genuine massage parlours. Theres plenty of the other kind in the red light area. You have bars and restaurants within a couple of hundred yards, including Humphreys. As well as a Grashopper "brown cafe", supermarket, smart shop, tram stop, car park and everything else you'd need. Its a 5 minute walk from the Central Station and the same again to get you to Dam Square or the Red Light district. Surprsingly, it was really quiet with very little main road traffic and none of the stag/hen party drunks you have to put up with the other central hotels. Reviews have posted complete rubbish about this place, so let me put them straight. You DO NOT have to pay to watch TV. There is a package of games and movies that you can pay 5.95 euros for, but you get over 20 channels free including CNN, BBC etc. The internet is also FREE. Its good as well - I clocked 600mb downstream which is plenty. It may not be good enough for Youtube, but bear in mind it is free and fast. You can have two wireless connections per room. We NEVER say any laundry, trays, rubbish or anything left in the corridors in the 4 days we were there. This will now be our Hotel of choice in Amsterdam - excellent find.

Reviews.Title: “A lovely Hotel”
Reviews.Author: 313Matt Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel for one night. We arrived early after a morning flight and were very happy that our rooms were ready and we were able to check in straight away. The lady at reception who checked us in was extremely curteous and friendly, the rooms were large, clean and very big. I would recommend room 501 in particular which has a beautiful vaulted ceiling and exposed beams. The location of the hotel was perfect for us, a short walk from Central Station and close to most of the main sites without being right in the chaos. One of the rooms was at the front of the hotel, but I heard no noise from the street. I just wished we had been able to stay for longer to see more of the sites and enjoy the hotel more.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Brian A
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here one night during a trip around Europe. Not knowing much about Amsterdam, we chose the hotel based on the price, location, and the unique history of the building. We were able to walk from the train station in less than 10 minutes. Once we arrived, we were upgraded to one of the suites, which was a great surprise. The room was VERY large and the bathroom was luxurious. My wife can't stop raving about the multi-head shower. The bed was huge and so comfortable. We had seen a lot of Argentinian restaurants around, so we asked one of the staff at the front desk for a recommendation. They pointed us in the direction of a steakhouse a couple blocks away that we really enjoyed. We would definitely recommend this to anyone looking for a unique, luxurious hotel in Amsterdam near most of the locations in the city.

Reviews.Title: “Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Another great time in Amsterdam, stayed at The Convent Hotel for the second time. Excellent service all the way. Breakfast was good with a fine selection of foods. Our room was quiet and comfortable. The staff were very friendly and most helpful. We purchased tram tickets from reception which was very convenient. The Hotel is in a great location. Just a few minutes from the train station and seconds from the centre of Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Well placed and great accommodation”
Reviews.Author: MikeeUK
Reviews.Content: Well placed with a short walk from the Central Station which has regular trains from the airport. Tram stops all close by and plenty to do and see within a short walk.

Reviews.Title: “It was very good”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Highy recommended. Very central. 2 min. walk distance to Dam Square. Tram stop infront of the hotel. Very clean. Helpful staff. Just one personal negative comment: Goose-quill bed sheet is not comfortable to sleep.Too soft for me. I removed it myself.

Reviews.Title: “Appears beautiful on outside, not so nice inside”
Reviews.Author: struct84
Reviews.Content: When i arrived at this hotel, I thought, WOW, this looks like a great place. Then upon entering the door, I saw that it was part of ACCOR which owns Motel 6. The room was old, linens were scary, and it was definitely not the worth the price. The location is excellent, but still just not worth the month. After the first night, I checked out and got another hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty Good, will be Back”
Reviews.Author: Chunky-M0nkey
Reviews.Content: Have just stayed at this hotel for 4 nights on business. The hotel itself is I pretty good shape, appears to have been recently refurbished. The staff were very friendly on the whole and certainly made you feel welcome. My room(245) was interesting, you open the door and were faced with a set of steps down in to the room, quite odd. The room itself was very well appointed, the bed was very large and very comfortable. The bathroom was OK, clean which was good. 2 disappointing things with my room, the air con didn't work well, and the windows were locked, and apparently house keeping wanted to keep the radiators on full even though I turned them down everyday. The second thing, whilst the room was very nice, it was at the front of the the hotel, literally above the lobby looking out at the street, but the noise in the morning of the trams and trash collectors etc was very loud, even though the room had double glazing I was still awake by 6 am every morning. The bar area feels every opulent, and is very comfortable, the bar staff were very helpful as well as knowledgable about their cocktails etc. Location is good, easy distance from Central Station and Dam Square, and if you like Japanese food, the Kobe restaurant a couple of doors down is a must ! Overall a good hotel, ticked all my boxes and I will be back

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable stay. Stay here!!”
Reviews.Author: jinkygenius7
Reviews.Content: This was a nice relaxing hotel with the best bed i have slept in. So big and comfy it felt like I was living in a marshmallow lol. The room we were in was very quiet and warmly. All the staff were charming and made us laugh at check in which makes you feel welcome in a hotel instead of a bland face. The staff and bed are the best things in this place. I would return but I hated Amsterdam. This and Anne frank house was the only highlight of my two day tour.

Reviews.Title: “Very comfortable hotel in great location.”
Reviews.Author: SydneyMaisie
Reviews.Content: Stayed three nights at The Convent Hotel. Very cosy bar downstairs, great room service and the staff were helpful and friendly. Room was clean and well furnished with the BEST and most comfortable beds ever.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, Central, Friendly Staff!”
Reviews.Author: JulieMarie718
Reviews.Content: My travel buddy and I loved this hotel. It is only a short distance from Centraal Station and the staff was friendly and helped us with everything we needed. Would definitely stay here again. Thanks Convent Hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay!”
Reviews.Author: Ashverse
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Convent from October 25-27, 2011. The room was pleasant and clean. The staff is exceptional. They provided the names of two great restaurants and even made the reservations for us. The night before we left we realized a mistake in our reservation in Brussels. The desk staff even made the call to the hotel in Belgium to help correct my mistake! We bought tram passes at the train station - 2 days -11 euros each. We rode the tram everywhere..very good value especially since it was raining one of the days. Tram stops in front of hotel..how convenient is that?

Reviews.Title: “A good stay overall”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: In the centre of Amsterdam, steps from Dam Square and an easy walk from any attraction and shopping. Bus route also within steps of the hotel and 7Euros will get you anywhere in 24hours and very easy to use and transfer between sights, conference centres, train station and shopping and art districts. The hotel has old charm with traditional service and very approachable and knowledgeable. The staff were very friendly and accommodating. The rooms were very clean and comfortable but the TV converter didn't work well, the outlet in the bathroom didn't work well, there wasn't enough bright lighting in the bedroom area and one of the lights above the headboard wasn't working. The building showed its age in the tub as the faucets could use more caulking and the tub didn't have anti-slip mats (and unusually high off the floor). Most bothersome was that the double bed had sleeping wells on either side with a big mound in the middle and it didn't make for a comfortable sleep (but the pillows were perfect). In addition, I found it odd that there was not clock radio or iPod speaker system as an added value on the night stands. My room looked out into an office building window and the curtains did close fully and I had to use a hair clip to hold them shut. Overall, a good stay, easy to move about this wonderfully beautiful city and the service was very good.

Reviews.Title: “Convent Hotel Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: BigMax123 Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 3 nights Oct/Nov 2011 - convenient location close to Dam square - shops in street behind hotel one way and canals the other. Staff friendly & helpful - 20 mins walk to Leidesplien for nightlife - try Sumo for food and the piano bar for after - tram stopped outside hotel if you wanted to ride (under 4 euros one way). Free internet to check in at airport for return flight.TV channels limited unless you paid extra - but not there to watch TV. Free use of safety deposit boxes. Only 5 mins from Centraal Station and bus links to Vollerdam and Edam for a day out of the city 9 euros each for a day ticket (goes from behind the station). Would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't fault it”
Reviews.Author: MalC757
Reviews.Content: What a fantastic find this hotel was. It is conveniently situated for everything. Easy walk from the station and to most of the Amsterdam attractions, including Dam Square and Anne Frankâ€™s House. The trams are a good way to travel and quite frequent. Beware of the bikes â€“ the have there own idea about obeying road laws! We had a side room and there was no noise at all. The room wasnâ€™t the largest we have ever had, but very clean and comfortable. The staff could not have been more friendly or helpful. Breakfast was included for us and was good and plentiful. However, probably a bit expensive if you had to buy it separately. All in all a really good hotel and would definitely recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “My first choice in terms of location and value”
Reviews.Author: SirMikey Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Good location â€“ ok Pricing Well, Hotels in Amsterdam are usually no bargains, neither is this one. Nevertheless: Itâ€™s a nice, clean and secure hotel at a great location: Only a few minutes away from main train station and the City Center. My room was small, but clean. I had a comfortable bed and I loved the â€œRitualsâ€� amenities. Hotelâ€™s staff is very friendly plus you get free WiFi. What more for a weekend trip? :)

Reviews.Title: “Extremely Good Service”
Reviews.Author: dolcengabbana
Reviews.Content: The staff were incredibly we arrived very early and our room was ready. The room wsa small but lovely, clean and serviced regularly. Location was fantastic and overall was great.

Reviews.Title: “Needs a bit of work...”
Reviews.Author: Giuhotels
Reviews.Content: The hotel is conveniently located, close to the train station and Dam square. Staff was corteous, the room was however quite small and facing a back street. Cleanliness was good considering the fact that the rooms and the hotel overall do need some refurbishment. Breakfast is ok. Would rate this hotel as a good three-star. We payed very very high rates as the city was full due to a Medical congress but would not be eager to return soon.

Reviews.Title: “Be close to everything in Amsterdam with warmth and charm”
Reviews.Author: pottyaboutparis Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: My husband and I first stayed in this hotel three years ago and thought it was charming. We still do. The rooms are beautifully equipped and the outlook over the streetscape is what I crave. Nothing that we asked for was denied, other than being able to use travellers' cheques to pay our extras. Noone seems to want travellers' cheques any more. The Duke of Windsor Bar is charming at the end of the day for a couple of drinks to settle down for the evening. We are not the type who go out for dinner every night of a trip and use lunch as our main course but there are some really nice nibblies to have with your couple of drinks which make you feel like you have had a drink. Would definitely recommend. PottyaboutParis.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: An excellent hotel, with high standards for every aspect! All employees were very friendly and helpfull, also when I called to make the reservation. The room is not special, but with everything you need and very confortable. It is located near the city center, close to everything but still seems a safe neighborhood.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: VAECalifornia
Reviews.Content: We dropped by early to drop off our luggage and they went out of their way to get us in a room as quickly as possible even though it was only 0900 hours. They upgraded our room from superior to luxury and it was very large. Had a private elevator (only two rooms accessed by it). The bar is one of three replica pullman cars (this one red). Good bitterballens. VERY HOT. Let cool before you eat them. Breakfast was well worth it. Great selections of cheeses. Convenient to everything and only a 14 Euro cab ride from the river boat dock. Easy to get all over with a tram stop right outside the hotel. Good business center with printer. Great staff. I really can't say enough about this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “More character than your standard chain hotel”
Reviews.Author: cusc0
Reviews.Content: Our room in the Convent Hotel was very large, had a very comfortable bed and was well equipped. The bathroom was large, but watch your knees as you step into the shower, it hurts if you kick the benchtop! The desk staff were helpful. Location was convenient, short walk to both the central station and Dam square.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and small but good room.”
Reviews.Author: 29AJW
Reviews.Content: Convent Hotel was a very good hotel. It was within walking distance from the Central Station, so very easy to get to, but far enough away from the seedy side of town. It was just a few minutes walk away from the Royal Palace so a very good location. There was a business centre downstairs where they had computers with free internet access. The room was quite small, but it had everything you needed. Staff were polite and very fast in their work. Overall a good hotel.

Reviews.Title: “very comfortablw, quiet, great location”
Reviews.Author: R0nitR
Reviews.Content: stayed there for 3 nights this weekend, after reading recommendations on Tripadvisor. The hotel is located close to the central station and 5 min. to the dam square, in a central street with many restaurants, good coffee in the morning( at the nearby coffee connection) and a big supermarket nearby (HY ). The hotel was very clean, the staff was friendly, the room very nice and clean. The bed was the most comfortable. We had to cancel the first night at 18:00 the same evening, due to a delay in flight, and were not charged for that night. We definitely recommend this hotel to anyone staying in Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Convent Hotel Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: This 4 star hotel was in my experience quite excellent on all counts from value for money, location, standard of rooms. I'd definitely return on my next visit to Amsterdam. The room was spacious and very well maintained. The staff were friendly and it was a pleasure to be served promptly and efficiently in the restuarant and bar. Breakfast came in a range of options- such a pleasure to be served "The Dutch style" at my table. The quality of the food was first class. The hotel is centrally located-hard to find somewhere better in my view. The bar is in the stlye of a 1920s Pullman dining railway carriage and is a very cosy and relaxing place. I stayed in a superior room. The cost averaged 200 Euros a night and although that puts the hotel at the more costly range, I can think of hotels which would charge more for less. Given the excellent standards in this hotel, the cost was well worth it for me. If this is within your normal range of expenditure, then I'd think about making this a hotel of choice in Amsterdam. Otherwise if you're looking for a treat, give it a try. I hope your own experience would be as positive as mine.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: emzolita
Reviews.Content: Stayed here last weekend. was unsure when we pulled up outside, however there is a lovely charm as soon as you enter the lobby, very warm, and period decor. Our room was small-medium size, but seriously SPOTLESS clean, and had lovely above average toiletries. the location is great, 5 mins walk to Daam Square but far enough away to be quiet at night. The bar in the hotel was my favourite thing of the entire weekend. It was themed on The Orient Express and had lovely Gothic, Burlesqey style decor. (almost like the 1st class in Titanic) The barmen were very obliging and helpful, and gave little bowls of dried fruits and nuts, and when I ordered a tea they gave me a plate of biscuits and chocolates. The check-in was efficient and fast, and the staff were all very friendly, it was raining one of the days and the doorman ran back inside to get us an umbrella. A lovely little hotel that goes that little extra to make things nice. Would Definitely recommend.

Reviews.Title: “What a Find!”
Reviews.Author: BritTraveller68
Reviews.Content: This hotel was booked via Hotels.com, but no where on that site did it mention that this was part of the Accor Hotel Group. It appeared to be an independent property, though on arrival, although it's proud to trade under the Convent Hotel name, the secondary signage indicated it was a higher grade Accor hotel. Check-in was excellent, completed by a liveried concierge, who couldn't have been more welcoming. The bedroom was towards the rear/side of the property, overlooking a narrow alleyway, so it was very quiet. The bathroom was on the small size, with a tiny bath. The highlight of the room was the bed - one of the most comfortable I've ever slept in. There's lots to see and do in Amsterdam, but you'd be forgiven for wanting the longest lie-in every morning. The hotel bar is in the style of an "Orient Express" train carriage, complete with "luggage racks" and hat boxes. Service there was quick and polite. Breakfast offers something for everyone. You can choose from a variety of buffet types, from two/three continental selections, to the full hot/cold spread, complete with champagne on weekend mornings. Prices range from around Euro 10/13 up to 22. The hot food could have been a lot warmer though, but I've noticed that's not unusual across the Continent. The location is good....just a short walk from the main train station with its fast links to the airport. Behind the hotel are the main sights, but do venture the other way (westward), where you can find lots of smaller and more reasonably priced bars and restaurants. There is a small business centre off the large lobby, with two PCs and a printer and it was free to use/print off. Great for online check-in when it's time to head home. I would have given this hotel 5-stars, but along with the luke-warm hot buffet choices and the fact that housekeeping left a cart full of dirty bedding in front of the bedroom door for 24 hours, which also blocked one of the escape routes one would need to use, I've had to mark it down by one star.

Reviews.Title: “sadly going downhill”
Reviews.Author: frequenttraveller94
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel 2 years ago booking through a site which let us pay the hotel and booked again because based on that experience, we thought it was good value . HOWEVER it has gone downhill a bit. This time we booked through Thomas Cook breakfast wasn't included this time and the room we were given was quite small. The sink in the bathroom was cracked, stained and mottled, there was a crack in the floor tiles in the bathroom and the carpet could have done with a good clean. The bed was comfy though. The attitude of the staff had changed. There was no remote for the tv and I when phoned down I was told bluntly that it was there, then, after half an hour of no show, we had to phone again. The man who came thought he was there to fix the tv and had to be persuaded to give us a remote. 2nd day, we came back to find ourselves locked out the room. Found that the receptionist had only booked us in for 1 night instead of 3. Some of the bar staff were good others were mediocre at best. One deserted the place for 20 minute and lost customers in the process. Good points,1. they do 3 different types of breakfast including one for 10 euros which was bread croissants, pastries, orange juice and tea/coffee. 2. literally 5 minute walk from the station and Dam Square. 3 Quite quiet even overlooking the side street.

Reviews.Title: “nice room, central location”
Reviews.Author: Vicky A
Reviews.Content: The rooms are generous and very nice. They have complementary coffe and tea in them. The hotel is clean and the staff very helpfull. The location is very central in front of a tram stop and mins walk to the main plaza. The room gave to a small street on the side and got a little noisy in the morning (7am).

Reviews.Title: “The Convent - short walk from station but could do with a refurb”
Reviews.Author: xxxluv2holidayxxx
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 2 nights last weekend of september. Plus points - Had a nice at the front of the hotel - 104. Nice high ceiling, bed very big and really comfy. Trams run outside the hotel but we werent disturbed by outside noise. Very friendly and helpful staff. 5 min walk from station 2 coffee shops next door!! Was able to check in my flight online and print boarding cards free of charge at the reception business centre Minus points - Decor is very traditional throughout the hotel if anything dated. Bathroom sink was obviously old. Hotel could do with a refurb! Any questions just ask!

Reviews.Title: “wonderful choice”
Reviews.Author: jacobgram
