Reviews.Content: we stayed 2 nights pre cruise. excellent choice. modern lobby, small but very nice and clean rooms - wonderful beds. Three wonderful English breakfast paces next door - avoid closest one - long wait - lukewarm food - other 2 great. Less than 5 minutes to Dam Square. Walked to Anne Frank house, Red Light district - trams very convenient. Definately would stay there again !!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel - Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Great hotel situated in fun neighborhood! Staff was pleasant and courteous. Buffet breakfast was EXCELLENT with so many options and fresh-squeezed juices. Close proximity to all the major tourist attractions and easy walking distance from local communities for a different side of Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “GReat stay”
Reviews.Author: PurpleMum337 Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: We had a room on the top floor with a room in the roof line, view was fantastic, room had that great quirky European feel of old world with all the convenience we needed. Not your typical sterile modern hotel. Fantastic.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in excellent location.”
Reviews.Author: LOIDs
Reviews.Content: Had a relaxing four night stay at this wonderful hotel. Staff was friendly and helpful. Room was large, comfortable, quiet with a great view. Location is an enjoyable 10 minute walk to Central Station, Tram stop across the street, will take you to most of the great museums in this amazing city.

Reviews.Title: “The beds should be featured in Amsterdam's Torture Museum!”
Reviews.Author: JoanfromToronto
Reviews.Content: The beds here are the worst in which I have ever slept. Way too soft with a hump in the middle and large depressions on both sides. We travel a lot and are in our mid-forties and after a few days in this hotel our necks and backs are extremely stiff and sore. We had a standard double room and after the first night inquired if upgrading would give us a better bed. We were told the same beds are in all of the rooms. Also, while this was not an issue for us, the step up into the tub is very high and could pose real problems for people with some mobiliy issues. The only good thing I can say about this hotel is the location is very central. Lots of hotels in Amsterdam...do yourself a favor and pick another one.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Position”
Reviews.Author: sharon18031969
Reviews.Content: Very clean hotel, friendly staff, and in the centre of absolutely everything. The breakfast was amazing and just what we needed. The Red Light District, is a eye opening but worth lots of window viewing, the Ann Frank Museum is worth a vist, and the Heineken factory. Soverign shops bars and restaurants everywhere - it is very eye opening and very laid back, every bit worth the experience.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Fantastic Hotel, Fantastic Location & Fabulous Staff - Great Stay and would highly recommend this hotel to anyone visiting Amsterdam - close to Central Railstation easy walk with luggage on wheels. Lots of shops, bars and resturants right on doorstep. Staff on reception so helpful and pleasant - very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Made our anniversary unforgettable”
Reviews.Author: Dexxxe
Reviews.Content: Fantastic service, personal touches, hospitable, friendly and efficient. Made our anniversary very special!! Thanks to all the staff at the Convent Hotel

Reviews.Title: “Location”
Reviews.Author: aviationbuff
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights together with my friend who was in Amsterdam for the 1st time. Since it was a relatively short trip we wanted to be as centrally located as possible to be able to cover all central Amsterdam by foot. And the hotel was a perfect fit for this. I also liked the fact that the hotel was only a 7-10 minutes walk from the Amsterdam Centraal railway station - very convenient when arriving from or going back to Schiphol Airport. We stayed in a Classic room (the cheapest option in this hotel) which was facing a backyard. The smallish size didn't bother us much - after all it was just a place for us to sleep comfortably and refresh. The room / bathroom were both very clean and tidy. The hotel's lobby was looking somewhat gloomy because of dark wood / carpets and low ceilings. Although I prefer modern designs and brighter colors I didn't mind staying in a hotel with a traditional character to it. Check-in / check-out was quick and efficient. Being a gold a-club member I asked for a room upgrade but was refused on the grounds of (un-)availability.

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location”
Reviews.Author: rlimagon
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located in a very convenient part of the city, very close to Dam Square but just far enough to avoid the crowds. Staff was pretty nice and the breakfast was AMAZING. My room cozy and quiet, but it was pretty small and the bathroom needs maintenance (the sink was disgusting and needs to be urgently replaced). Also, they don't have a safe box in the room and you have to use the one at the reception, what can be inconvenient.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel with great location”
Reviews.Author: RobertVPrague
Reviews.Content: We spent in this hotel two nights in July 2011. This is very nice hotel in the center, close to main square, central station. We had superior room with street view, the room was spacious, big windows, tea or coffee facilities. Staff was very friendly, we got free wifi password. Only problem was when showering, the water was immedietly on the floor. I can recommend.

Reviews.Title: “very good location.”
Reviews.Author: teresa42
Reviews.Content: We had a lovely city break here with two friends we are in our early 60's. The hotel was very convenient and the whole experience was good.

Reviews.Title: “Charming and immaculate”
Reviews.Author: Grand_A_Foodie
Reviews.Content: I found this hotel through a kiosk at the airport, as my flight was delyed and I needed to spend the night. The hotel is an easy walk from the train station at less than ten minutes, even with two bags. The hotel was incredibly clean. While the room had a queen bed, it was tiny, to the point where it would have been uncomfortable to walk on the other side of the bed under the sloping roof. I was alone, so it didn't matter. I assume the rooms on the top floor are this way. The bed and linens equaled five star hotels where I have stayed for three times the cost. The bathroom was generous in size with all of the amenities. At one hundred sixty nine euros, I felt I had a bargain. The TV had five english channels. Breakfast was not included, and the posted menu looked very expensive, so I ate out; and of course there are more than enough restaurant choices within a block or two. Ask for a room in the rear where it was very quiet. The internet was around six euros for a day. I have added this hotel to my phone directory as a place to stay again!

Reviews.Title: “Our First Euro Hotel Experience”
Reviews.Author: HerrMV
Reviews.Content: Our stay at this hotel was our first hotel experience outside the U.S. We knew we were in for a few unusual expectations as European hotels are usually much different than comparable U.S. hotels. This hotel had much to offer in appearance and old world charm, but this was compromised by acceptable European standards. The hotel sits on a very busy street near a trolley and bus station. Our single euro-king size bedroom was small with very little room to move around and lacked any space large enough to open our luggage. The bathroom was also small and a leaky pipe filled the floor with enough water to create a small pond. We had to put some of our towels on the floor to avoid slipping and it was necessary to wring them out several times a day. The bed was very comfortable which made it easy to fall asleep. Our view was nonexistent - that of a brick wall of the building next door. The hotel bar was very elegant, but extremely pricey. We did not try the breakfast buffet for that same reason. We did not have any issues with the friendly staff. The hotel is within walking distance (if you are so inclined) of many of the major sites and numerous restaurants and shops. It is within walking distance of Centraal Station although carrying more than one bag along the busy streets and sidewalks can prove challenging to some.

Reviews.Title: “Simple but OK!”
Reviews.Author: pinkgisa
Reviews.Content: The hotel is kind of old, but itÂ´s clean and nice. The staff is amazing! There was a brazilian lady that was really lovely with me and my parents when she found out weÂ´re also brazilians. But the rest of the staff is also very kind. The hotel is near the most famous places of Amsterdam and really close to the Centraal Station. If you are coming to Amsterdam using this transportation, itÂ´s perfect! If you donÂ´t eat much in the breakfast you should ask for the small breakfast. In may it was 9 euros per person and it was perfect for me. The rooms are a little bit old, but itÂ´s not a big problem if you donÂ´t care for these things.

Reviews.Title: “FANTASTIC ATMOSPHERE AND LOCATION”
Reviews.Author: KandiManPerth
Reviews.Content: We stayed for three nights having bed and breakfast. This hotel is so convenient to the central rail station and the key sights in Amsterdam. We walked to the station with our luggage to travel on to Paris by train. The atmosphere was very welcoming and friendly. The room was well fitted out and really comfortable. For breakfast our booking included the buffet and this was very enjoyable with friendly staff to assist. The buffet was continually refreshed and the choices were excellent. Eggs to your liking were prepared on request if desired. The only surprise was there was not an in room safe. However there were individual safes in the reception are and these were easily accessed on request to reception. We did this often and it was not inconvenient and the staff were always willing to provide access with a smile. A lot of our travel includes 5 Star hotels in Asia. This hotel was not like this and had more of a boutique feel to it. Our room overlooked roofs, but when you are staying in a character building you don't always get the view so a view wasn't expected. We would stay at the Convent Hotel if we visit Amsterdam again.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful hotel it an excellent location”
Reviews.Author: simeon
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for two nights. We had the standard room with a King sized bed. Our room was clean, spacious and had everything we needed. The hotel staff were friendly and helpful. The location is excellent on one of the main streets. We arrived by train and easily walked to the hotel (maybe 7-8 minute walk). It is far enough away from the station that it is in a nicer part of town. It is right around the corner from the Dam Square and a 10 minute walk from Anne Frank House. It was a short trolley ride to the Van Gogh Museum. One of our frustrations with many European hotels is that they don't provide facecloths. It may be a small thing, but we were pleased that they had facecloths for us. The breakfast buffet is pricey at 22 Euros but it was very good. We would not hesitate to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed feelings”
Reviews.Author: Sinbad_the_Tailor
Reviews.Content: The "superior" room was not good enough for my taste -- too dark and claustropohbic. I was offered a triple room facing the main road - it was worth the money. Breakfast was abundant and tasty. The hotel though has a somewhat subdued and tired atmosphere. Next time I will look somewhere else to stay.

Reviews.Title: “A real gem!”
Reviews.Author: matthewpaul80
Reviews.Content: Nice fresh rooms - very modern, much more than the 'classic' lobby which is also nice. The rooms are new and modern, but not that tacky-modern that many hotels are opting for. The furniture and fixings are quality. Great free wi-fi. Easy to walk to the train station from the hotel, even with luggage. I had a great room with a view on the street - windows must be sound proof, because it was so quite and relaxing inside. A nice streetside terrace for drinks. You won't be disappointed here.

Reviews.Title: “Best beds ever”
Reviews.Author: Philcerys
Reviews.Content: Stayed for one night wish it was more the beds are so comfy,they had a service where we could leave bags and pick them up later which was very handy

Reviews.Title: “Excellent weekend”
Reviews.Author: JoannaM66 Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Hotel has very good location- close to station and Dam square too. Opposite to exit is tram stop so connection with interesting places in Amsterdam is very simple. Hotel is nice with beatiful lobby, rooms are small but elegant and convenient to short vacations. Four kinds of breakfasts are very good idea- we don`t eat very large breakfast so the Dutch kind or healthy is sufficient (and also prizes are differential). The bathroom is also small (a litlle bit too small) but the hotel is localisated in very old buildings. In conclusion, the place and its localisation is very good and service is well and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: GlobalBen
Reviews.Content: Rooms were small, but were better than other European rooms. Fantastic location to central Amsterdam, within walking distance from everything. I would definitely stay agin when next in Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant hotel!! Would highly reccommend”
Reviews.Author: sarahrose83
Reviews.Content: We stayed here as a family of 7 adults for a wedding anniversary. The hotel was amazing, the staff were great, the rooms were spacious and clean (BIG COMFY beds too - a plus!) plus the rooms were dark and quiet, which is hard in a hotel (I didnt use my ear plugs once.) the location of the hotel was also brillant - just minutes from the Dam square and about 5-10 mins to the main train station. Breakfast was standard continental with lots of choice. We would definately stay here again. 10/10

Reviews.Title: “Good Value, Excellent central Location”
Reviews.Author: Cali50s Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: 10 min. walk from Central Station, this reasonably priced hotel is a great base for exploring Amsterdam. Even closer to some of the touring highlights like the Grand Palace, Amsterdam Church, Dam Square and more. Good sized rooms, free wifi, good cleanup each day. Quality service as you expect from Accor. Shortcomings: Street is a bit noisy but sound proofing is OK. Typical European "open shower" with partial glass means part of floor will get a bit wet. Overall, this is a good value in a high priced city.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed, did not live up to expectations presented on the website”
Reviews.Author: Riddler1
Reviews.Content: The rooms on the website looked good, and whilst i know they always show the best rooms, we were in a very dated room - we'd paid for a room with a sitting area, which we got - but the armchairs were shot, to the extent that you could actually sit on them (you sank into the base of the chair !) The bed was equally bad - with a strange hump in the middle which left you feeling like you would roll out of bed The reception staff were excellent and friendly and very helpful when we asked questions. The wifi was free, which is always good The bar was curious (in a nice way) but the staff were appalling - they had run out of many items, and rather than suggest alternatives or say what they had, we were told to go and complain, as the bar man was 'sick off never having stock and customers complaining'. Not surprisingly we never saw anyone else using the bar The location was good, short walk from the station (ten minutes) and very central

Reviews.Title: “Customer service needs improving”
Reviews.Author: SM66
Reviews.Content: Quite good hotel in a reasonable location. Check-in staff very pleasant. The room was of a good standard though the bed could have done with being levelled - there was a slight slope to the outside which, although not uncomfortable was not ideal. The bar is what let this place down for me. On our second night we thought we enjoy the 'happy-hour' cocktails. There were about 5 or 6 cocktails to choose from, I chose a Mojito however I was told they had no mint, nor did they have basil. This ruled out a Mojito and two or three other options. I didn't want any of the other cocktails so asked if I could have a gin and tonic at the same price as a cocktail (G&T was more than a Euro more expensive). No, was the answer. I didn't think this was particularly good service; so decided to take my custom elsewhere. I told the barman this - and his response was to exclaim "it's not my fault!" and I should just put in a complaint. I said I might do just that; to which the response was "Good!". I'm afraid I found that exceptionally bad service and am wondering what happened to 'owning the problem'?

Reviews.Title: “Great location, spacious room”
Reviews.Author: Kagsy65
Reviews.Content: I travelled to Amsterdam with my 2 teenage children at the end of July 2011. We arrived at the hotel 3 hours before check-in time, intending only to drop off our luggage, but our room was ready. Check-in was efficient and friendly. The room was very spacious, not at all what I expected from a city central hotel. It was spotlessly clean, and the beds were very comfortable - plenty of pillows, which we were pleased about as we usually have to ask for extras. The air con worked well, we had everything we needed - yes the hand basin in the bathroom was a little past its best as lots of reviewers have pointed out, but that was really the only criticism I could come up with! Wi-fi is free, and for 2 devices, another bonus with 2 teenagers in tow. The location is great, very close to The Dam and the central station, 2 minutes walk to the nearest canal, and plenty of cafes and shops nearby. Our room overlooked the street, some people have complained about the noise - it certainly didn't stop us from sleeping well. We didn't eat at the hotel, but when we had tea and soft drinks from the bar in the lobby, they were served very elegantly, with chocolates, biscuits, dried fruit and various nibbles. The Hotel staff were all polite and efficient. overall we had a wonderful stay in Amsterdam, and the fact that we were so comfortable in the Hotel, contributed to that.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, but hotel needs maintenance”
Reviews.Author: KenGPhila
Reviews.Content: We stayed here as a pre-cruise extension for a Rhine River cruise. The hotel is an excellent location, located in the heart of Amsterdam near the ports. However, the hotel rooms needed maintenance. The room heater never worked. We reported it and the hotel didn't respond. We reported it again and they told us that the heater had to be replaced and they couldn't do it before we checked out. They offered us extra blankets instead. Also, the tub glazing was chipped and the marble sink had numerous hairline cracks.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel and Location”
Reviews.Author: MrTonyG1
Reviews.Content: It is with in walking distance to everything, the staff is very helpful, the room is great and we would stay there again

Reviews.Title: “lovely hotel,friendly staff,conveniently placed for sightseeing in amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: joannecbratt
Reviews.Content: my friend and i ,arrived about 2 x hours before we were supposed to book in,but the friendly reception staff told us this wasnt a problem and if our room was free we could have it straight away,as well as changing it from a double bed to a room with two singles.our room was lovely and clean with an olde world charm about it.it the hotel is very easy to get to from centraal station ,about a ten minute walk,but the no.5 and no.2 tram stops straight outside it,and these run about every 6 minutes.its very conveniently placed to see all the sights,and again we found reception staff very easy to approach if we had any questions we wanted to ask. we didnt have time to take in the steam rooms because we were so busy,but the bar staff are lovely serving half price cocktails between 5 -7 pm . we sampled a few before hitting the town!! we only stayed for two nights,but wouldnt hesitate to recommend it to anyone and would definately stay there again myself when i go back to amsterdam,which i hope to do soon as i love the place!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: sparkly_shoes
Reviews.Content: We loved this hotel and would definitely use it again if staying in Amsterdam. The location was good and easily within walking distance of Central Station and many sights. Staff were friendly and helpful. The room was clean and bed extremely comfortable. Wifi was not included. The breakfast offered a wide range of fresh and cooked food. While quite expensive compared with previous hotels I have used in Amsterdam, I felt this hotel justified the additional cost.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Staff Excellent at the Convent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: mkextra
Reviews.Content: Nice Hotel, exceptional staff, convenient location. However, the location within walking distance of Central Station can seem a little rough at times. Overall, Amsterdam seemed to be having a problem with lots of trash and litter - city seemed very dirty. We had booked the luxury king room only to discover after a long travel day that the room had no bathtub, only a shower. Check ahead if that's important to you (like it was us). Breakfast included with our room was exceptional.

Reviews.Title: “What a marvelous surprise!”
Reviews.Author: yoduladyhoo
Reviews.Content: We are nearing the end of our stay at The Convent Hotel and our entire holiday has been wonderful. Our travel agent wanted to book us at the Sofitel, but friends and relatives who've stayed there did not recommend it, with everyone saying it did not deserve it's 5 star rating. Looking for lodging in the Dam District, I stumbled upon The Convent Hotel. Since it is Amsterdam, I was not expecting much from a 4 star, just hoping for a clean room that would be larger than a shoebox. We were very pleasantly surprised. We are travelling with another couple, so we were given side by side rooms. Both rooms are identical and have large beds, close to "king-size" that are very comfortable. The rooms are rather good sized and nicely appointed, though we have no view to speak of, even though we are on the top floor. I cannot say enough about the hotel staff, especially those at the front desk who keep us laughing with their sharp dry but witty "Amsterdam Humor." Everyone has been very helpful and accommodating. I was, also, very surprised that we had free wireless in our rooms. We did not arrange breakfast for our stay since we wanted to sample the local fare, instead. The Convent Hotel is a nice little haven from the noisy, busy and, sometimes, very gritty experience that is Amsterdam. We cannot wait to come back.

Reviews.Title: “Room smelled like urine”
Reviews.Author: Zebra740
Reviews.Content: Good location, nice staff, but carpet and furnishings need to be cleaned and then burned.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay in Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Easy to get to, great staff. Definietly ask to use the gym and Sauna, as it's just for your private use at any one time, which makes it ideal for a family or a couple. Nice and cosy bar, very good breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “In the heart of it all”
Reviews.Author: lynrube
Reviews.Content: The Convent Hotel was lovely - clean, quiet and helpful staff. It is centrally located and within an easy walk to almost everything. We would stay here should we return.

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location.”
Reviews.Author: Haraldsenb
Reviews.Content: Spent 2 days at the Convent Hotel Amsterdam for my stay in this fantastic city. The hotel is located within walking distance from the central station (5min). The Area was nice with some ok cafes and restaurants just around the corner. Very nice location! We booked a superior double bedroom with a view to the main street. No problem getting some good sleep. The trams passing by is not a problem. The room was nice with free wifi and our room was very roomy. The hotel has a nice pub with a very friendly staff. Free business center with internet and its options. This hotel is very recomendable for travelers!

Reviews.Title: “Great location!”
Reviews.Author: JadeTzi
Reviews.Content: Lovely spacious hotel which is only 10 min walk to central station and then 5 min walk to Dam square. Havet needed to use public transport once. I had a large double room - very spacious but saw some other rooms which were much smaller. All in all though they are nice and clean and comfortable beds. Staff were all great.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, very good location.”
Reviews.Author: CairnsGirl25
Reviews.Content: Room was very small and squeezy to walk around the furniture, but extremely comfortable & well furnished to a good quality. Bathroom very modern and plenty of space. Staff were efficient & helpful. We walked to the hotel from Central station, also walking distance to Dam Square with all the night life & restaurants, plus some good cafes & restaurants very close to the hotel. The tram right outside took us to Anne Frank house and one change on the tram to get to the Heineken Experience. Very comfortable bed & pillows. Not cheap but definitely worth it.

Reviews.Title: “enjoyed our stay”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The Convent is ideally located, close to Central Station, and is a lovely old (historical) hotel. We had 2 rooms for 2 adults and 3 teenage boys. We were actually able to secure a 3 person room... spacious because it's actually designed to accommodate 3 twin beds. We spent 2 weeks traveling Europe and we found these 3 person rooms to be hard to come by! Staff was friendly and very helpful. The breakfast buffet was 22 Euro/ person but was pretty extensive. Free WiFi was available (2 per room) and worked well. Only complaint is that one of the 2 elevators was out so wait times for an elevator were longer than usual. Would definitely stay again. Can't say enough nice things about the reception desk and staff. Very nice experience!

Reviews.Title: “They charge you for everything, great location”
Reviews.Author: GlamorEyes
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 nights, the location is great and the staff is very helpful. However the hotel charge you for everything . starting from watching TV - yes I mean just open a TV on the news channel. also we had a toll free number and when we use the phone in the room to call to a toll free nunber they charge you 2.5 E for just using their phone per each call. outrages. When we told them that they said that this is normal. I would not go back to this hotel if this is their policy

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and location in Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: LynnTed1
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Convent Hotel in May 2011. The hotel was very nice. The rooms were spacious and nicely decorated. The bed and pillows were so very comfortable. The staff was very nice and helpful. The convent hotel is within walking distance to the train station, the canal boat tour entrance, the Ann Frank House, Dam Square and a couple of nice shopping streets. The hotel had a nice bar for snacks and drinks. When in Amsterdam try the many types of pancakes they have to offer and the stroopwafel cookies. They are fabulous:)

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Wraxall_Travellers
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Convent Hotel for 3 nights. We upgraded to a junior suite at the back of the hotel. The room was clean and well equipped. It is an easy walk from central station and to Dan Square. Trams run past the front of the hotel. Breakfast was included in the price; it was a buffet and quite adequate for our needs.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly staff, comfortable room and great location.”
Reviews.Author: jimlve
Reviews.Content: Following an overnight flight, we has a long day with an easy early check-in, a day to see the sights, a comfortable night, and another morning of touring followed by hotel-arranged shuttle to cruise ship. Staff was super helpful, room was well maintained and nearby shops, attractions and restaurants were quite convenient. Would stay again if returning to Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome hotel and location”
Reviews.Author: exileonmainstreet
Reviews.Content: Second time staying here with a small group of friends. Really great hotel and service, in a fabulous location. For the price, its a real find and extremely comfortable beds. Very spacious rooms and spotlessly clean.

Reviews.Title: “City Tax”
Reviews.Author: Joshcook90
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel, nice room, really enjoyed my stay, as me and my friends were checking out we must of upset some sort of god, by queueing quietly and orderly, because the man behind the reception was in a foul mood and barked the order to pay CITY TAX. After asking how much is it, and exactly what it is, (as lastminute.com didn't put it in any literature) we were barked at once again to "just pay because I am telling you it is a city tax and you should take it up with whoever you booked the room through" Ok I'm not pleased Lastminute.com didn't tell us about it, but it was the foul mood of the short haired man behind the reception who left a bad taste in the mouth right at the end of what was a brilliant holiday. :( So please don't see this as a negative review of the hotel because it is really nice, but the way we were spoken to really ruined the last couple of hours of our holiday.

Reviews.Title: “Great Loction..average hotel”
Reviews.Author: littlelou1975
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights as it was our honeymoon and we had previously stayed here on our first trip away together in 2002. The hotel has since changed name & hands but the decor is EXACTLY the same. Carpets in rooms could have done with a shampoo...one of the plug sockets by the bed did not work. Staff were pleasant enough. Breakfast was not as lavish as our first trip but adequate enough to start the day. Breakfast was included in our room rate but would not have paid the 22Euros otherwise. More 3 star than 4 in my opinion but central location trumps all this if you get a good rate.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel - poor maintenance”
Reviews.Author: Chicagoan_008 Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: This is a wonderful hotel in so many ways - but we needed maintenance to our bathroom due to flooding floor. We asked 4 times over 8 days and nothing was done. My daughter nearly took a bad fall, as did I, when getting out of the shower (it's a BIG step over the edge of the tub and then down to the slippery floor). We tried towels to sop up the mess, but they too slid on the floor. Our room was nice, the beds were excellent, the mini-fridge is super-handy, and the cleaning staff did a good job. The room was generally very quiet, too, which we appreciated. They are renovating, so only one of 2 elevators worked (not so handy) and key-card access to the elevator was hit/miss.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay , recommended”
Reviews.Author: bernieBelfast
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in January,The weather in Amsterdam was wet and miserable but thankfully this was not reflected in the hotel!!!. The hotel is ideally situated near to or accessible to attractions . The staff are friendly and very helpful even when we had booked out ! I would definitely stay again and recommend .

Reviews.Title: “This hotel blew me away - AMAZING, loved it!!!”
Reviews.Author: GreenVelvet
Reviews.Content: We booked a room in this hotel for a 4-night getaway with a friend in March 2011. We requested a king bed and a twin or double, as we were all staying in the same room. I researched our hotel exhaustively, read lots of reviews, wanted a very nice hotel where we could all be comfortable in the same room. I thought the price we were paying for this would be a fairly good deal... but that was before I saw the room and the hotel! I can't recommend The Convent highly enough. The room we had was lovely - I've lived in studio apartments smaller than this room! I was expecting "Euro tiny," but it was positively luxurious, one of the nicest hotel rooms I've ever stayed in. Interesting to read other reviewers opinions of what may have been the same room, but we just thought it was amazing. It was on the top floor, the only room on that floor, and it was very clean and well-appointed. I thought the bathroom was fabulous - very large shower with great water pressure and tons of hot water, and a bathtub so large I could practically swim in it! The bathroom itself was larger than some bedrooms I've had in small city apartments! I took a bath there every night. The room was also impressively quiet, given its location within easy walking distance to Centraalstation; we are light sleepers all, and were surprised have slept so deeply in such a busy area of town. Another plus - the windows actually opened, so we could let in fresh air for the very beautiful weather we had at the time. We did not try the hotel breakfasts. We had a fridge and a large table, and were right across the street from a grocery store; we bought local bread and cheese and ate in the room each morning. Great value. However, we did try the hotel bar (great decor!) for drinks and dessert one night: surprisingly reasonable prices for an in-hotel establishment, excellent beer on tap, and a really delicious piece of chocolate cake. They held our luggage for us when we arrived, since we arrived early in the morning, well before we could check in. Our room was ready when it was supposed to be. The internet connection worked beautifully, and their business center with two computers and a printer was also a great resource. (I shouldn't have brought my laptop - there was no need for it, with that business center!) The beds were indeed exceptionally comfortable, and I have a bad back so I'm really sensitive about that. Finally, the service was outstanding. Although I didn't quite agree with the dinner recommendations, when we did run into a couple of real snags and had to make emergency phone calls to the USA - one for a banking situation and once for a pet emergency - they were very accomodating. They were having trouble with their international phone dialing system, or maybe just calls to the USA, but they ended up not charging us for two international calls, because it was a little bit of a hassle to make them. I thought that more than made up for the difficulty. The staff were friendly, approachable, and very professional at all times. Also, we did not take advantage of this perk but I wish that we had - there was a private sauna that guests could reserve for their own use. If the weather had been cold, we would have reserved it, but we were blessed with unseasonably warm and sunny temperatures. If I return to Amsterdam on a pleasure trip, I won't think of staying anywhere else, and I will recommend this hotel highly and without reservation to any friends and family who are planning a trip there. The value for what we received at our price point was just incredible, and we had a marvelous time there.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable Hotel”
Reviews.Author: MidlandsTravelg
Reviews.Content: A great location only 10 mins walk from Central Station. The hotel is "comfortable" . Stayed in a luxury room which was quiet, on the top floor, it had a separate lounge area - sofa & chair, workstation & flascreen TV, a second TV is in bedroom area, but it was a bit dated. Excellent Sofitel "my bed", you get a really good nights sleep. Bathroom would benefit from a refurbishment. Great to have free wifi included. Breakfast is expensive at the hotel, there are numerous places close by where you can get an excellent breakfast (Cafe Blom on the main shopping street can be recommended).

Reviews.Title: “A Caring Hotel”
Reviews.Author: ronvoyage
Reviews.Content: Stayed three delightful nights at the Convent Hotel in Amsterdam in room 545 with my honey. What a cute room with a high gabled ceiling with exposed beams. Also, the front desk staff at the Convent are the best because of their willingness to answer unlimited questions and provide excellent information. The hotelâ€™s web site offers good rates and specials for this property. I found a offer to buy two days and the third day and daily breakfasts were free. The breakfast was typical of good European spreads. There were lots of staff available to provide extra services at breakfast and the food was well prepared. You can purchase a 24 or 48 hour GVB transportation pass directly from the front desk. This pass is an excellent value and allows transportation on the buses, trams, Metro, and the ferries. The five minute walk to the Convent is a good idea if it is not raining. A number 2 or 5 Tram will deliver you close to the front door of the hotel from the train station for a few bucks.

Reviews.Title: “Well done, Convent.”
Reviews.Author: Connie1291 Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Very pleased to have chosen this hotel. Well located, easily accessible by public transport - the trams 1,2 & 5 stop right in front. Staff is helpfull and nice. On top, I had the possibility to see Barcelone winning the Champions League on TV in the bar... what else...

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic service and great location”
Reviews.Author: TonySallyBath
Reviews.Content: The Convent is ideally situated for touring central Amsterdam and beyond. Close to all the famous areas (including the red light district) but a step away from the lovely bohemian area of the Joordan. We also enjoyed visiting the slightly edgey areas of the city with the main tourist streets close by. Dam Square and Rembrandt Square are 5 minutes away from the hotel. The trams run past the hotel and the train station and canal boat stations are a 5 minute walk. Our room overlooked a small courtyard garden and was tucked away at the back of the hotel. The bed was really comfortable and our room was lovely. The hotel staff were all very well trained, spoke excellent English and were very welcoming. Example: I left my handbag in the taxi from the airport to the hotel and the staff rang around the taxi company and located my handbag and arranged for it to be delivered to the hotel. If you cannot bear to be away from the internet there is a nice internet lounge/busines centre which is free of charge. The restuarant does not open at lunchtime or in the evenings but the hotel bar and lobby areas are very comfortable. There are plenty of good restaurants close by for lunch and evening meals. There are no leisure facilities in the hotel but we were too busy exploring the city to worry about that. Well worth a visit.

Reviews.Title: “Comfort @ the Convent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: maisiegirl
Reviews.Content: We had a lovely stay @ the Convent Hotel Amsterdam. The location was convenient to the sites we wanted to see and to the train station. Many local trams were also easily accessed and the location also made it easy to walk most places. The beds were comfy, the room clean, and the staff, especially the breakfast room crew friendly and helpful!! The cleaning ladies were also wonderful. Wish the bar stayed open later than midnight but found the wine/cocktail list had great choices and the bar was a nice place to hangout after taking in Amsterdam. Also, loved that on nice, sunny days the bar moved outside for prime people-watching! The hotel's history was interesting and I would recommend this hotel. We loved our time in Amsterdam which is a magnificent gem of a city!!

Reviews.Title: “Convent Hotel Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Excellent location, excellent staff who are very helpful. The room we stayed in could have done with some renovation work particularly the bathroom but still a good room. Very good for walking into the centre about five minutes. Plenty of choices of bars and restaurants, though many serve the same kind of food.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel appraisal”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Hotel was very plesant to look at and I liked the history that went with it. The room was very nice and accomated two women nicely, although the beds had to be separated when we arrived and the night table put in between. I noticed that the floors were not vacumed every day, but otherwise the bedding was exceptionally comfortable and bathroom quite adequate except for a bit of water on floor. Enjoyed our stay, and would reccomend to friends. The ladies at front desk were very helpful with restaurants and tours.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent night at Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Everything is good :) Why would you choose the Convent? 1. Location, 2. Fine interior of rooms. I would say that there is some very special atmosphere in the hotel!! And surely its no-smoking policy :) Oh, what is the bed!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “good location friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: PGMAustralia
Reviews.Content: The hotel is centrally located in Amsterdam and about a15 minute walk from the main railway station. The staff were easily the friendliest I have ever experienced in Europe. I was travelling with my wife and young child which usually adds a few complications when travelling, the front desk staff and restaurant staff at the The Convent could not have been more helpful. Hard to believe this hotel was once under the Sofitel brand. The hotel itself is a little tired but that is the only negative comment about this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “made my stay pleasure”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: firstly, the check in process was very quick and impressed by a very nice receiptionist. she introduce the hotel and the area near by clear and quick. the amenity is a quality of service, nature product ( i forgot the brand, though) is a very deep concern of the management. good for ourself / good for the earth.. we were there for looking for our old friends who moved from the contacted address... believe it or not, your receiptionest helped us to find their new address (telephone number) from the internet and I have met my old friend.. who i lost the contact for 14 years !!! thanks to you, thanks to quality hotel !!!

Reviews.Title: “location!”
Reviews.Author: granvisconti
Reviews.Content: Location is everything - a 10 minute walk to Central Station, a tram stop directly in front of the hotel, 3 minutes to Dam Square. The room itself was a bit worn - carpets, chairs, furniture all dated. However, the room itself was amazingly comfortable. The worn club chair totally enveloped me at the end of the day; the featherbed sucked me into unconciousness! Bath was large and spotless. The refridgerator, free cable, and free wifi were also great amenities. Few minor drawbacks: - my room was directly in front o fthe elevators, depsite asking for a quiet (meaning; end of hall) room - a bit pricy for the property. (however, as noted, the great amenities and location were the payback) - all of those church bells!!!!! good luck sleeping past 7 am (this is true in most of EU) :) Again, LOCATION was everything! I could walk 10 minute in any direction and be in the best restaurant/museum/shopping/coffeeshop/bar! Though not as posh as some of the hotels out in the canals, I was very happy and would consider staying again on a future visit.

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay..perfect location”
Reviews.Author: mrfuni
Reviews.Content: Wonderful stay. Rooms were nice, great shower and the location can't be beat. Short walk to Dam Square and the train station. Fabulous breakfast that was included, but many options on the street for food. Would definately check this place out first on our return trip.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel close to train station and center of city.”
Reviews.Author: mollyd2
Reviews.Content: This hotel is great and I would stay there again. Would compare quality to a hilton garden in in the US. Good service and we got a great rate through one of the girls w us since she is a flight attendant. Had a Triple room which is sometimes hard to find. We had rolling bags and walked it from train station. Right off the tram tracks for easy transport. Has 2 elevators, restaurant etc. Plenty within walking distance. It is across from police station. Some noise as we stayed in front of hotel but not as much as some European hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Can't beat the location.”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at many hotels in Amsterdam as we travel their regularly. This hotel is really nice especially for the proximity it is to Dam Square and the tram is right out front. The staff is friendly, rooms were clean and I absolutely agree with the reviews that the shower has the best water pressure in Europe.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant Stay & Friendly Staff”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: My first time to Amsterdam. The hotel is located near to centeral station and within walking distance various attractions. Hotel is clean. Staff is friendly. My room was nice and comfortable, except it was located next to house keeping - it was a little noisy during the mornings but bearable. I'll be sure to ask for a room in a quiet area the next time I visit, which I hope will be fairly soon.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant Stay, Friendly Staff”
Reviews.Author: SavvyTravelerChicago
Reviews.Content: First time in Amesterdam. Hotel in nice location. Central station within walking distance. Comfortable room. Friendly staff.

Reviews.Title: “Good Queensday location”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: I've gone twice to this hotel for Queensday. Each time I've enjoyed it. It's a great location (close enough to the train station and the bars and canals) but it's still calm. I'll go again next year and already have a reservation.

Reviews.Title: “Good service, location. Bad room”
Reviews.Author: LondonDj
Reviews.Content: Good points: Very friendly desk staff I was able to check in and get a room at 11am Free internet offered without having to ask Location - near station, dam square etc Not so good: Room was tatty. Stains on carpet and chair. Noise form delivery vans in access road very early in morning Uncomfortable bed - 2 singles pushed together, both of which sagged Shabby bathroom

Reviews.Title: “Ideal location!”
Reviews.Author: PaulaJAtlanta
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Amsterdam Convent for 3 nights (package with breakfast included) and were very impressed with the location and the staff. We were in a standard room and, unlike an earlier review, had free TV with 4 or 5 English channels, including CNN and BBC (just check on how to access it--no need to purchase the packet). In addition, we had fast, free internet connection in our room (get id and password info from the front desk). Breakfast buffet was very good with a variety of choices available. The room was large for European standards, the bathroom quite spacious, the beds comfortable, and closet and storage more than adequate. Amsterdam is very walkable (we're in our 70's), and we only used the tram to go to t he Van Gogh Museum. We would recommend highly the Netherlands Museumkaart to save money on entrance fees if you plan to visit at least 3-4 museums. The tram stop is just across from the hotel. We would highly recommend the Convent Hotel in Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Convent Hotel Amsterdam - One of the most idea places to stay ... Conveneince & Easy to Access”
Reviews.Author: Great_Leisure_in_BKK Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Convent Hotel Amsterdam is just steps away fro the Centraal Station in Amsterdam. Directly from Schipol Airport to Amsterdam Centraal Station takes less than 15 mins and then from the Centraal Station to the hotel (walking towards the Dam Square) takes you less than 10 mins. Very IDEALLY located at the city center and also just right in front/behind the Dam Sqaure. In addition, there are numerous restaurants, coffee shops and convenience shops just right outside the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Convent Hotel Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel with an excellent location making the more well-known attractions easily available and within walking distance. The staff were extremely friendly and gave us a free up-grade. The rooms were a decent size and clean. The bathroom was lovely and Rituals products were supplied. We will definitely return

Reviews.Title: “Very pleasant stay”
Reviews.Author: poohbearRowlett
Reviews.Content: My room was clean and comfortable; staff was friendly and helpful; breakfast was delicious, free internet in the lobby, good location for walking, several good restaurants close by.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, good hotel, expensive breakfast...”
Reviews.Author: col1000
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 3 night stay, this Hotel is well located for Dam square and many tourist attractions. Check in was efficient and decor is very clean and well presented. We had upgraded to a superior room before check in, glad we did as not sure what the basic room was like but superior was not boutique standard despite 4 star rating, this room had a larger bed but was on the front of the Hotel so you do get road and tram noise which was a little off putting I also wasnt pleased at the request to pay 18 euros per night (24 hrs) to watch tv, it did include movies and internet connx but i just wanted tv for background noise. I hope this is not the way hotels are going in europe now.. . Service excellent, food in the Orient express themed bar was great, this was definitely a good experience. I would stay here again but would ask for a room at the rear of the Hotel However, breakfast is expensive at 22 euro each for full buffet / hot bfast which is a lot (they do also have cheaper options at 9.50 euro and 12.50 euro). We managed to book inc bfast so I was pleased (smug) when i saw others paying. Breakfast tasted so much better knowing i was not spending 44 euro each time. This is a good hotel,owned by same chain as Ibis, Novotel etc and you could see a bit of that in this venue, but trip advisor ratings never let me down and this is somewhere i would go back to again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel in a central location.”
Reviews.Author: mstiwin
Reviews.Content: The Convent Hotel in Amsterdam was the best hotel on my recent trip to Europe. The room was of decent size and the bathroom was excellent. The beds were soft and comfortable. The airline had lost my luggage, and the hotel's front desk staff made phone calls to the airline throughout the first day to check on it and delivered it to my room when it was found. The location was excellent as well. We were able to walk to everything in the city (train station, Red Light District, museums, etc), but it was on a street that was quiet enough to not keep us up at night. Excellent hotel.

Reviews.Title: “WOW!!”
Reviews.Author: Melly2207
Reviews.Content: Amsterdam was the absolute best part of our trip. The hotel was beautiful!! Our rooms spacious and the beds were the most comfortable we had in Europe-and we had great beds everywhere we travelled. The staff were wonderful and supplied plenty of information, vouchers ad were extremely accommodating! Our bags were brought to our room and on our departure day we were able to secure a 6pm checkout (at a small charge) which was the best thing we could do prior to an overnight rail trip. Couldn't fault the hotel. It was a short walk from everything, trains, dam square, red light district, everything! Highly recommend!! Price was excellent value!

Reviews.Title: “It would be hard to do better.”
Reviews.Author: NatoAb
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at Convent the last of March and the first of April. This hotel has a lot going for it location wise. On a main (but reasonably quiet) street, close to the train station, and just steps from a tram stop that will take you most anywhere you need to go in Amsterdam. Also, the staff was unfailingly polite and helpful. They were patient and (like most Dutch) well versed in English. By European standards, the room was quite spacious. The furnishings had seen better days, but certainly not shabby. The bathroom was cleaned everyday to a luster. The bed was much to my liking but not so much to my wife. The mattress had a feather comforter which you sink into and feels luxurious. There are numerous places to eat nearby and you can get a good, reasonably priced breakfast right next door. Some things that weren't so good: 1) Even though it was near freezing outside at night, the room was often too warm. The bed had only a duvet for cover; no sheet or anything else. The air conditioning had not yet been turned on for the summer and with the duvet over you, waking up in the middle of the night in a sweat was common. The housekeeper, however, was kind enough to leave a sheet in the room for us which we put under the duvet and we slept much better. 2) The evening before we were to leave we went to our room and found two strange suitcases sitting inside the door, belonging to a tour group that had checked in that afternoon. Our things were quite obviously still in the room so why these suitcases were put there remains a mystery. On the up side, the bellman removed them immediately when I notified the desk. We stayed there eight nights and felt we had a very good experience at a reasonable price. It should certainly be considered if you are going to Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Very good service”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The service was excellent, the location was fantastic and the hotel was easy to find. We were able to get good direction, and when we came home I realisead that I had forgotten a thing in the room, which they were kind enough to send to me.

Reviews.Title: “Great location...”
Reviews.Author: tjcheerio
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a great location for sightseeing and for first time visitors. It was only a few minutes walk to the train station which was perfect for us. The only thing we took a taxi to was the Van Gogh Museum. Overall, the hotel is a bit dated and the room seemed old. The bathroom was dirty when we arrived but it was quickly taken care of by the hotel. I would recommend this hotel for its location but probably wouldn't stay again. It was just average.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel in Amsterdam!”
Reviews.Author: Donnakim
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed in this hotel to celebrate our wedding anniversary, and we honestly cannot wait for a chance to return! The hotel is a ten minute walk from Centraal Station and very easy to find. Check in was quick and easy, and we were upgraded to what my husband keeps calling 'the Penthouse suite' which was amazing! The suites have a private secure entrance and lift which is a nice touch. We had the top floor of the hotel with a view out over he main street, the bed was huge and amazingly comfortable, the bathroom was elegant, clean and the huge shower-head now makes my own shower a disappointment. The staff are friendly and polite, the bar is gorgeous and the barman is happy to recommend excellent cocktails. The breakfast buffet was very varied and delicious, it was included in our package but I would have happily paid for it. All in all, we couldn't have had a better stay. One tip: we walked to all of the major attractions, but we're a pair of fitness freaks! You may well want to get a tram pass and use the stops outside the hotel entrance.

Reviews.Title: “Highly Recommended!”
Reviews.Author: markset
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just spent four nights at the Convent Hotel Amsterdam. We walked to hotel from Central Station, and though it was at night and our first time in the city, the hotel was easy to find. It is less than a 10 minute walk from the train station and only a 5 minute walk to Dam Square. It is also only a 5 minute walk to the lovely Jordaan District. The hotel staff was very friendly and helpful throughout our stay. When we got to our room we were pleasantly surprised at how nice the room was. The room was much larger than we expected, especially for Europe. We had just come from London and this room was twice the size and much nicer than our room in London, all for the same price per night! The room was very clean and had comfortable furniture, which was nice to use after walking around all day. The bathroom was nice and clean, however they have a strange shower curtain/shield that didn't work well and water ended up all over the floor. That is the only fault I can find with place. I highly recommend that you stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Rosemarydub
Reviews.Content: Just back from Amsterdam got a great deal on this hotel location fantastic staff very friendly,great breakfast,lovely bar with half price cocktails from 5 to 7 each day. The room was small with very big bed really comfortable, tea and coffee making facilities, good bathroom with nice toiletries. Overall very good

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, friendly staff and excellent location. Decoration a bit outdated.”
Reviews.Author: marenio
Reviews.Content: Situated in the heart of Amsterdam centre, close to everything, tram stop right out of the door. Very friendly staff, I was upgraded as VIP and got a chocolate box in my room, very nice attention. Rooms very clean, however the overall decoration seems to date a bit. A little refresh of the hotel would be welcome. Nice choice for breakfast. A bit expensive but all good hotels are in Amsterdam...

Reviews.Title: “Quiet hotel in fantastic location!!”
Reviews.Author: JD153 Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel, very close to central station and Dam Square. Depending on where your room is it can be very quiet otherwise you may get some noise from the trams. The rooms are dated and could be done with being refurbished especially with the price you pay for staying there but they are clean and spacious. I would recommend staying here if it is your first time in Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, but...”
Reviews.Author: Jocaxxx
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a little bit pricy by judging what you get. The location is good, you can reach almost all of the tourist attractions by foot. The room furniture is outdated. The bed is amazing, very comfy. The bathroom is great, very big and well illuminated. They have free wi-fi access in the rooms. The breakfast buffet is average, nothin to write home about. Spacious rooms.

Reviews.Title: “A good place to stay”
Reviews.Author: CB_Highlander10
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for 2 nights last summer as part of an Insight vacation package. The hotel is located right in the downtown area and you can walk to just about everything. The red light district is just a 10 minute stroll from the hotel. The rooms were decent and we had the buffet breakfast at the restaurant each morning which was pretty good. The small pub in the hotel is a nice place to relax and have a beer. There were tonnes of cafes and bars around the hotel so there is lots to choose from.

Reviews.Title: “fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: hebedee73
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a fantastic location, service was excellent, efficient, prompt. We paid extra for a luxury room and as we were there 3 days it was great to have extra space. We didnt pay for breakfast and ate at local cafes (must try bakkerswinkel currently at zeedik) Loved the bar styled like the orient express and after a very long days walk it was great to sink into comfy armchairs. Only minor criticism is that the sink and some furnishing seemed a little tired and in a traditional hotel you still need a feel of newness rather than 'tired'. Generally most reviews sum this hotel up!!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and wonderful location!”
Reviews.Author: 2Calgarians
Reviews.Content: We would really like to recommend this nice hotel in Amsterdam. It's perfectly located and they offer a great services. The rooms are really clean and quite big, for European standards. Thank you kindly, Chris & Hector.

Reviews.Title: “WONDERFUL HOTEL IN A FANTASTIC LOCATION”
Reviews.Author: myholidaysaway
Reviews.Content: We have returned from a 4 night stay at this wonderful hotel where the management and staff were very polite, couteous and helpful. The breakfast was without fault. This is one of the best locations in Amstedam as it is so central to visit by foot the main attractions. It is an easy ten minute stroll from Central Station, from there a 20 minute direct train ride to the airport. We were here celerbrating a very special occasion and the Manager upgraded us to a superb room and left us a box of chocolates as a welcome.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: JulieDT
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Convent hotel for 3 nights while in Amsterdam. The location is outstanding as it was a short walk from the train station. The hotel greeted us kindly. The location is central and therefore made it easy to walk to all parts of Amsterdam. The room was small, as most rooms in Europe are, but was comfortable and very nicely decorated. There was no coffee in the room, but a great little bakery across the street where we got coffee to go with a croissant. Would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location, fantastic service and wonderful beds”
Reviews.Author: helenmannersvaughan
Reviews.Content: The hotel location is excellent for seeing all the sights and close to many good restaurants and shops. Maotmahal - Indian restaurant serves beautiful authentic indian food and the owner and service is extremely welcoming. Even better that it's just across the road from the hotel. We enjoyed staying in the hotel bar on a couple of occassions - very relaxing and the staff are very friendly. The nibbles were great although it would have been even better if the selection of bar snacks were a bit more extensive. We found the breakfast to be very extensive though serving cereals, fruit, juice, breads, meats, cheeses, sausages, bacon, eggs....... just about anything you wanted. Opt for the self serve option rather than table service so you can go back as many times as you wish! We like the idea that breakfast was served from 6.30am until 10.30am. We would definitely stay here again on our next trip to Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Plusses and minuses”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The first room we got was great, for the first night and the best shower I ever had. Then, we had a leak in our room. When we came back at the end of the day, we smelled a stench as soon as we walked in the door. It was SEWAGE leaking from above. We had to move, which was a hassle, to another room which was not as good. Not the good shower and TV was smaller and not by the bed. The next night, we tried to watch a movie on TV and the system didn't work. After about 4 different folks came up and tried to fix it, by pushing buttons seemingly at random, it was finally fixed by someone over the phone in Belgium. We got free movies out of the deal. WOW..!@! At check out, and ONLY after almost insisting, we received half off one of the nights. So, it was good, not great. We wouldn't have missed anything if we would have started off in the not so great room to start with. I am not sure I would go back. But the staff, did TRY and help out. And for our troubles, they sent an apology with some mediocre chocolates a coupon for two free drinks which we did not use as we don't drink. We would have felt better if we would have been compted a full night's stay, and we should have been told of this right after we had to switch rooms. Kevin M. Passer, M.D.

Reviews.Title: “Convent Hotel Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: In a perfect location to access all the sights of the city. Most within easy walking distance. Service at hotel was first class. Very helpful and friendly staff. Did not dine in hotel so unable to comment in this area.

Reviews.Title: “PERFECT”
Reviews.Author: dundrum
Reviews.Content: I dont usually do reviews but thought I must as we really enjoyed our stay and will defiantly return to this hotel. It has very comfortable beds, lots of choice for breakfast, cosy bar to relax after a day exploring .The staff are very pleasant staff and willing to help book tours. We also enjoyed eating in Humpfreys , Yellow bike tours ,Wine and Cheese evening boat trip.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: We loved this hotel. The location was perfect with a number of trams stopping straight outside the hotel. The bed was comfortable and we had no noise problem. The staff couldnt have been more helpful or friendly. Plenty of nice places very close to the hotel for cheap breakfast in the morning. Only downside was we had no view from our window, just a wall !! But we werent staying in this hotel for its views. Overall I would definately stay at this hotel again and strongly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Winter in Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Hotel location was great and very good bed. Soft furnishings in the room were dirty and need serious updating. Not good value for money considering it was winter.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in beautiful City”
Reviews.Author: Laura_bj Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: I chose this hotel for a mini-break to celebrate my partners 40th Birthday after much research into hotels in the city. I can honestly say, I made a great choice. The hotel is within easy walking distance of Central Station. The receptionist was very helpful on check-in, offering advise on restaurants and places to go. I upgraded to a delux room with breakfast and was not dissapointed by either. The room was comfortable, clean and had the most comfortable bed I can remember from any hotel worldwide. The Convent is in a great location and all areas of the city are in easy reach on foot. My only critisism would be the lack of free wi-fi, something that I expect in a 4* hotel in this day and age. I have already however recommended this hotel to friends and family and will definately stay there again on my return.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient, comfortable and good value”
Reviews.Author: Doolaah
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a great value 3 night trip including a room upgrade and breakfast, plus an extra night free (booked via Expedia). The hotel was calm, clean and very well located. Our superior room was spacious, comfortable and well equipped (2 TVs and free WiFi!). Recommend the breakfast buffet especially if you can get a B&B deal. Lots of good restaurants nearby for dinner (esp recommend "Seasons"). The hotel staff were very friendly, professional and helpful. Everything you could want really for a base for your Amsterdam city break and only a five minute walk to the rail station.

Reviews.Title: “Good location Good everything”
Reviews.Author: EKT&ADT
Reviews.Content: Thoroughly enjoyed our weekend break here. The standard room was large enough to have a desk and lounge chair in so just for the weekend we didn't feel the need to upgrade. Located about 5 mins walk from the Central station and less than that to Dam Square. It's on a main road but does not have a lot of traffic in the day or at night. Our room was on the side anyway so we had no noise. The bed was very comfortable and we overslept both mornings. We hadn't booked the (pricey) breakfast option so this didn't matter. The room had good tea and coffee making facilities, free Wi-Fi, Sat TV with BBC channels, a mini bar (useful for storing delicious Dutch cheeses etc) and a decent bathroom with lovely deep bath and good shower. The bar is very elegant and the staff are excellent. It was nice to relax there after the day and enjoy some nice drinks and snacks before heading out for a night on the town. We especially enjoyed the recommendations of the staff at the reception desk such as going to the local market (Saturdays only) near Anne Franks house instead of the tourist market on the other side of the city. Nearby is the Pancake Bakery for delicious pancakes. The hotel does not have a restaurant for evening meals but this did matter to us as there is lots of restaurants nearby although we did stumble upon Cafe Van Zuylen which was a great pub nearby serving really nice snacks and meals. We won't bother looking anywhere else in Amsterdam next time we visit. The Convent Hotel for us again definitely.

Reviews.Title: “Room for improvement”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: location is excellent : nearly everything on walking distance. Staff is very friendly (exspecially breakfestroom staff) and helpful (advice on good shops and marketplaces to go to) Bed was not properly made (sheets loose etc), bathroom needs to be renovated, room on the small side

Reviews.Title: “Convent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: I thought the breakfast arrangement at 22 euros for an ordinary buffet was disappointing. No complaints about the room and staff.

Reviews.Title: “For the price - second to none”
Reviews.Author: Holly_82
Reviews.Content: If I was paying a lot of money for a hotel, I'd probably give it 4/5 as yes, the decor was a little faded, there were a few cracks in tiles in the bathroom and the wall paper was a little scuffed..... So if you're looking for a very posh or 'special' hotel then this hotel probably isn't for you. However - I wanted somewhere clean, secure, quiet and near the center and this hotel was absolutely perfect. We arrived at about 1pm and were able to check in straight away. The receptionist was very polite and gave us our room keys (Room 126) which was at the back of the hotel. This suited us very well as it was very quiet. OK, so the view wasn't really all that (an alley and another building) so it was quite dark in the room.... but all we wanted the room for was to sleep and shower, so the view didn't matter. The room was immaculate and the bed was pristine. The bathroom was also very clean and the selection of toiletries was pretty good. The bed was utterly fantastic, so, so comfy and the free Wi-fi worked really easily - all you had to do was ask reception for a 'voucher', enter the username and password and away you went. OK, so you didn't get many teabags and there wasn't any milk, but there was a small convience shop to the left of the hotel, 5 seconds away. On the TV you got BBC1, BBC2, BBC3, BBC4 and a lot of other channels so if you fancy some English TV - you've got it. The shower was basic but absolutely fantastic - brilliant water pressure and as hot as you would like it. The hotel is very close to Centraal station and a train to the airport cost 4.20 Euros - exceptionally cheap for a 20 minute journey and you can certainly walk from Centraal to the hotel in about 10-15 minutes - much cheaper than a 40 Euro taxi! It's also very close to Ann Frank's house, the red light district, the Amsterdam Sex museum and loads of restaurants and bars. We also walked to the Heineken experience and the floating flower market - this took about 20-30 minutes so if you'd prefer not to walk, just get a tram which has a stop right outside the hotel. I would thoroughly reccomend this hotel if you don't want to pay a fortune, but want a very comfy, clean and good Amsterdam experience. When I come back - I would certainly stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, Well worth the money”
Reviews.Author: LinnyB2709
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel in excellent location, so easy to find from Central Station, our room was lovely. Take extra teabags or coffee because you never get enough and we bought milk from supermarket. Staff very attentive to our needs and very polite. Although there is no resturant in hotel you can get room service 24/7and bar meals. Apart from the usual big museums look out for the little ones like the bag & purse museum & Van Loon Museum which is a canal house, both excellent. Most resturants that do breakfast's are around 8 or 9 Euros, so the 9 euro room service breakfast is well worth the lie in. Anne Franks house is a must but either get there for when it opens or make sure you pre book, queues get very long very quickly and you could end up wasting away a morning. Getting into Amsterdam by train from the Airport couldn't be easier. Remember to take comfy walking shoes.

Reviews.Title: “Top of Mercure”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: This is the most perfect Mercure. The architectural of the building and the comfortable of the rooms are in complety harmony. It is the best hotel to stay im Amsterdam. Congratulations to The Convent Hotel (Mercure Gallery).

Reviews.Title: “What a bed!”
Reviews.Author: wilhelmina
Reviews.Content: The best beds ! Perfect.The rooms are showing their age and bathroom need attention in classic rooms.Breakfast was poor with a poor quality hot selection.Room only when I stay next.Changed room to a suite for other 2 nights which had a great bathroom with rain shower.Staff are friendly and great location.

Reviews.Title: “Overnight and Jet Lagged”
Reviews.Author: Jeffghost2 Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: This hotel, formally owned by Sofitel, is showing its age. It is fine, but one should look out for deals in order for it to be value for money. It is very convenient. There is a lot of traffic noise--so take ear plugs.

Reviews.Title: “Central location, welcoming team, v pleasant stays.”
Reviews.Author: DutchUK Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: I stay here every few weeks now. The staff are a great team, the hotel is central for all areas of Amsterdam, and secure. Rooms are larger than most in Amsterdam where hotel rooms in the best hotels, can be very small. If you upgrade your room, you get extra and unusual space and this is rare in Amsterdam. The hotel extends back to several buildings and across, so rooms vary in shape, but all are quiet. For the right rate, book well ahead and use the Accor website, they often have deals there, not on booking engines. (E.g 3 nights for 2!). Breakfast is excellent quality, healthy, well presented. Handy between central station (6 mins) and The Dam Palace /square, (3 mins). The Managament and entire staff team work well together always very professional, make every effort to accomodate you, and this makes the stay very pleasant, and a nice atmosphere throughout. It is part of the Accor group, so well resourced and reliable, and a set international standard 4*. MGallery are stylish individual hotels, reflecting their character and locations well.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous city break hotel”
Reviews.Author: Nicknak87
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel for myself and a mate to stay in for a 3 night break in Amsterdam after reading the reviews on here and comparing to 2 other hotels we shortlisted We couldn't fault any part of our stay, within walking distance to red light district, and main shopping areas, tram stop right outside. The staff were friendly and helpful, the concearge was amazing, giving us directions, and offering advice and places to visit. The room was perfect, lovely comfortable bed, clean and tidy, and great bathroom. Could not fault any part of this hotel, great base for a city break.

Reviews.Title: “Bad service, low quality bathroom”
Reviews.Author: loz-p2 Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Stayed for two nights just after Christmas. We left the room at noon and switched the sign to 'Please make up room'. When we returned at 6.30pm in the evening, the room had not been cleaned or made up yet. We called and complained, so they sent someone but didn't even apologise.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel Great Location”
Reviews.Author: oztraveller042
Reviews.Content: Great location within walking distance of train station, bus stop outside, walk to shops. Excellent service. Room was cosy, but comfortable with bath, quality toiletries, tea and coffee. Internet access available via business centre. Breakfast was up with the best - great selection and staff were most attentive and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Central Hotel! Book up now for a fabulous stay!”
Reviews.Author: Globetrot30
Reviews.Content: Well where do I start! It took me about a month to decided on a hotel for our New Year 3 night stay. I had read the reviews for The Convent Hotel and all seemed rather too good to be true, especially when you get a random bad one. Anyway I booked up absolute bargain! We arrived at 9.30am and I assumed the room would be available to us at 3pm but no it was ready on our arrival! The staff on reception on so friendly and give you all the maps and advice you need to get around Amsterdam! The room was so nice! Really spacious and clean. Bathroom facilities excellent and the bed was to die for! The most comfotable bed I have ever slept in! The biggest pillows you have ever seen! The Hotel is 5 min walk from Dam Square which takes you everywhere you need to get to on a tram! The hotel sell tickets for everything in Amsterdam all at reduced prices! The Hotel is 10 min walk from central station too which is a bonus! The breakfast buffet was included and was really nice, fresh fruit, cereal, breads, hot buffet, yogurts, even english Breakfast tea! Bar in the hotel is really friendly and comfortable well worth a visit after a busy day for a hot choc with cream! There was a restaurant up the road which is Japanese eat as much as you like called GENROKU. 24 euros and is really gorgeous fresh sushi, hot japanese dishes! You get 5 rounds and can have 5 items per round each and you can choose from 100 items! Examples; Tempura prawns, lamb chops Teriaki, Salmon Maki, Miso Soup, Fresh Salmon Teriaki, selection of hand rolls! Its so fresh and good value, unless you are a sumo wrestler you wont get though 5 rounds! Works on the basis you finish one round before ordering the next which is good because you dont waste any! Things you must see...... Heiniken Experience museum (if not for just a few beers as they are part of the price) Anne Frank Museum (very moving) Red Light District (has to be seen to be believed) Resistance Museum (all about the second world war we spent over two hours in there very interesting Tram 14 or 9 from Dam Square to Plantage Kerklaan opposite the zoo) Canal trip ( lasts an hour from central station, discount with hotel flyer) Enjoy!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Centrally located, friendly professional staff”
Reviews.Author: Jsrickus
Reviews.Content: It wasn't easy to find but we had never been to the dam before and it was dark, once you get your bearings it's very well located! Lovely staff, I work in hotels myself and understand what constitutes great service, this hotel fully delivered. The receptionist who checked us in particularly stood out and sorry to say I forgot her name, all requests were met and her city map was a god send, it made the stay complete. Overall a lovely hotel with massive comfy beds, well located and well staffed! Will definately recommend and hope to return.

Reviews.Title: “Really friendly and helpful staff!”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
