Reviews.Content: We stayed for 4 nights in this hotel over Christmas. The hotel was quiet with not many guests but that changed on Boxing day. The staff were very friendly and helpful. The rooms had everything you needed including tea and coffee facilities. Breakfast was ridiculously expensive at 22 euros so we ate at the cafe next door for a fraction of the price. Location is very good and central for Dam Square and the station. Nice big double bed but strangely not that comfortable. Overall a good experiemce though......I recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: great location, staff very friendly and helpful, handy for Station, Red Light Area, Coffeeshops, Anne Frank Huis, good tram service from right outside. Didnt have breakfast as expenseive so cant comment on food, but the Duke of windsor bar is nice. For breakfast would recommend Cafe De Raedt on Raadhuisstraat (behind Magna Plaza).

Reviews.Title: “Amsterdam Business Trip”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: This is the fourth time I have stayed at this hotel and I have always found the staff to be very helpful and friendly. The location is excellent and the hotel has an old time flavor but a very nice decor. The lounge is beautiful! I have always enjoyed staying here and will do so again. I have recommended it to my colleagues to travel to Amsterdam on a regular bases and even though it is some distance from our office, it is worth the inconvience to have to travel there.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel, excellent location”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: We found the Convent in Amsterdam very convenient. It was very centrally located and it offered various good services such as good breakfast, clean room and free internet.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, but a very customer unfriendly night receptionist. He handles a complaint in a n unprofessional way .”
Reviews.Author: klacht
Reviews.Content: A very customer unfriendly night receptionist. The handling of a communication error from the sales department was very unprofessional and poorly handled by this person. This person was definitely not suitable for imparting a service profession. Because of this incident. we as a company certainly not use this hotel in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Another good weekend”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Returned to The Convent after a good stay same time last year. Still impressed. Reception and concierge extremely helpfull. Nothing better than a couple of drinks in The Duke of Windsor Bar. Very comfortable beds. Will return next year.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel with manour house feel”
Reviews.Author: MCZedeler
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for a weekend and we thoroughly enjoyed our stay. The hotel has this 19th centry manour house feel to it which we realy like. We had a room towards the back(read - away from the street) which meant that it was nice and quite. Looking around the room you could see a bit of wear and tear but that did not make the room any less nicer than it was. Breakfast was not included in our rate but the hotel had plenty of options. We however opted for a canal side cafe a short walk away instead. The only bad thing that can be said is that the internet was not free and in-room entertainment system was a bit unstable. I don't know if it would have helped to by the upgrade package that was available. I dared not do it. I would gladely recommend this hotel to any traveller.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: PCsGirl
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed two nights at The Convent in Amsterdam. It is in a great location within walking distance of the train station and other local attractions. The room was quite large with a nice bath and amenities. The staff was quite friendly and helpful. We would definitely stay there again - one of the best places we stayed in Europe.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel very central”
Reviews.Author: Pete4liv
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend Treated us 2 a trip 2 the dam and we stayed here last week. Very short walk from central station. We arrived before midday and check in wasn't till 2 but man on front desk said wasn't a problem so signed a couple of forms then gave us our room key. He was very nice and helpful as were all the hotel staff. Room was very nice. View wasn't great but very tidy and plenty big enough for 2 people. Bed was huge and could have slept in it all day. Wish my own bed was as nice. As u walk out hotel and to the left your only a 5 minute walk 2 dam square and town centre. Didn't have breakfast as was very expensive (Â£20 per person per day) but there r plenty of cafes or fresh bakerys nearby. Also found a lovely restaurant nearby ( turn right out hotel and walk about 5 mins) called humphreys which had excellent food and good value. Would advise this hotel 2 anyone especially couples and would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Okay!”
Reviews.Author: jo.el.jo
Reviews.Content: Nice building conveniently located. Was obviously once a great hotel - communal areas are lovely, bar is like an old fashioned railway carriage. Rooms are quite chintzy and could do with updating. We had breakfast included and it was good quality. Our room was at the back so no probs with road noise.

Reviews.Title: “Best Beds Ever, In Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: ZuzuGiza_Egypt
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at The Convent for 6 nights, and it was just right . It is centrally located, a few minutes walk from various restaurants, touristic attractions, and best of all, the tram stopped right in front of it. It is 10 minutes away from Central Station, and river boat trips, a definite asset. The hotel has style, and the staff are friendly, informative and very helpful. My only comment is that we booked a Classic room and that was a bit small for 2 people. However the beds were wonderfully comfortable, and the room very clean. We didn't eat there as we thought breakfast was a bit steep. But pancake places and sandwich shops are all around, so no problem. Amsterdam is a beautiful city, most definitely worth another visit, in a bigger room.

Reviews.Title: “Great location but noisy”
Reviews.Author: Brava2
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4 days in s superior king room which was located in the old convent part of the building. Noise from the road, including human merriment made for sleepless nights but the room was comfortable and clean, well located and staff were very helpful Would recommend but try to obtain a room in the modern part of the hotel..

Reviews.Title: “Great location, all in all worth a visit.”
Reviews.Author: ALLWRIGHTY
Reviews.Content: Stayed here before, great location close to Dam Square and Centraal Station. Lovely king size bed , only gripe is no room safe - a hotel of this class needs safes in the rooms, having to wait at reception to gain access to the safes there can be time consuming . Some areas of the hotel, (lifts and hallways) are in need of attention , as was my sink, but all in all i'd recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel in great location!”
Reviews.Author: ibizaH
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights and it was lovely. Very close to the train station, centraal area for coffee shops, restaurants, shopping or red light if you please! Also found a great supermarket for food further down the road. Everything we wanted to do from our research was in walking distance. The room itself was clean, well decorated and as so many others have said - the bed is amazingly cozy! So perfect for our trip. They have cable TV including MTV, always a plus. Would recommend this hotel and stay there again myself. Thanks!

Reviews.Title: “a good central location - a safe bet...."”
Reviews.Author: Lawyers-from-Leeds
Reviews.Content: Our stay started well - able to check-in far earlier than we expected (not long after 10am) and get a wash etc after our journey. The hotel is nothing special as a building - but more than adequate for what it is - a hotel ! It is very central - a 10 min walk from Centraal Station or 3 min tram ride. Wherever you go in central Amsterdam the hotel is not far away - usually 15-20 min walk from most of the action. The rooms are clean (we were a party of 7 with 5 rooms between us - one room was a little under par on the cleanliness stakes) and the beds very comfortable indeed. From my own point of view I had a very quiet and confortable nights sleep both nights we stayed. The hotel bar was pleasant and bar staff very friendly - not somewhere to spend a whole night-out, but good for a few pre-city walk drinks etc. and not too expensive. We didn`t eat at the hotel - too many good restaurants within walking distance. Breakfasts can be had at the cafe right next door for 5 or 6 Euros for a full cooked Dutch (or even English if you want) . As for exploring - cross the road in front of the hotel and head-out down the narrow passageway - keep going and you find allsorts - a mini (and tame) Red Light street and then the increasingly elegant streets towards the Jordaan area - all well worth walking through. Veer to the left and you can be around the Anne Frank House in little over 10 mins. Veer to the right and in the same time you are near to the Noodermarkt area - a very good farmers type market with a few nice bars around the area.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, friendly and centrally located.”
Reviews.Author: skidudesAberdeen
Reviews.Content: Perfect for a short stay in Amsterdam. This hotel is very centrally located, the staff speak good English and are very helpful. The rooms are very comfortable and clean, especially the bed which was huge (super king size) and very comfy. There are numerous cafe's and restaurants within a short walk for breakfast, lunch and dinner and the hotel also has a lovely bar and restaurant. We would definitely stay here again and have already recommended it to a friend. We used the park and ride and the hotel was just a 5 minute walk from Dam Square where our tram stopped.

Reviews.Title: “Great boutique hotel in fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: SoMisty
Reviews.Content: I booked The Convent for a group of friends pre-cruise and am pleased to say everyone was very pleased with my choice. The hotel has character, staff are friendly and helpful and the location could not be beaten - five minutes walk from the Central Train Station pulling a suitcase is pretty hard to beat. The train from Schipol to Amsterdam is a short, cheap, direct ride. From the Convent we walked everywhere - the Museums, Ann Frank's House, the Redlight District etc. The excellent buffet breakfast, included in the rate is served in a very nice dining room adjoining a cosy bar. Amsterdam is a beautiful city and The Convent a fabulous place to stay to explore it. Sue NZ

Reviews.Title: “Good clean Hotel in great location with good sized rooms”
Reviews.Author: Margaret R
Reviews.Content: This was a great Hotel to stay in , the beds were very comfortable , the rooms clean and serviced well everyday . The desk staff could have had some more charm but otherwise no complaints . The hotel is in a great location , easy walk to most shops , cafes and sights .

Reviews.Title: “This is a very pleasant centrally situated hotel which is good value & has extremely helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: janetking65
Reviews.Content: This is a very pleasant centrally situated hotel which is good value & has extremely helpful staff. We were a party of 8 60+ women staying 2 nights. We found the rooms comfortable & suitably appointed. Breakfast is extra so we ate out. The reception staff were unfailingly helpful, patient & good humoured, from phoning restaurants to enquire about bookings, dealing with a potentially lost safety deposit key, not only providing a corkscrew but uncorking a bottle of wine we had bought with us to drink in our room, serving us drinks at 00:30 in the reception area when we came in late after the bar had closed,& dealing with various enquiries about tram numbers, & locations of tourist attractions. They could not have been more pleasant or assisted us better. Weâ€™d all thoroughly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Ridiculously Small Room . . .”
Reviews.Author: The_TravelerUSA101
Reviews.Content: My opinion of the Convent Hotel is definitely jaded by the size of my room--which was ridiculously small. I reserved a standard room and I was given the opportunity to upgrade upon check-in. However, the standard room was not cheap and I thought it would be sufficient. I was wrong. The room was tiny, barely enough room to walk along the sides of the bed. The walls were slanted, which made the room feel even more claustrophobic. The decor was dated, the closet space was severely limited and there was no drawer space. Therefore, I couldn't even unpack my bags. So, if you're considering staying here, be cognizant of the spatial limitations or upgrade to a larger and more expensive room. Despite the negatives, the hotel staff is professional and helpful. The hotel is centrally located--close to the train station, the old town and the Dam area. The Concierge/bell hops are especially helpful. Lastly, my favorite restaurant in Amsterdam was De Belhamel. Great atmosphere/service and the food is outstanding. If you're going on a Friday or Saturday--call ahead for reservations.

Reviews.Title: “Convenience and Comfort, but Beware”
Reviews.Author: hapetraveler
Reviews.Content: The Convent Hotel in Amsterdam offered us an early check-in upon our early morning arrival. Staff was helpful and friendly, and recognized us whenever we were in vicinity of reception area. Room was comfortable, maybe a bit outdated but still roomy and comfortable nonetheless. Beware of the "555" phone service for international calls, as there is a $45.00 connection fee. A call that was made to the US for less than 1 minute (only to leave a voicemail message that we had arrived safely) cost a whopping $46.00 plus change. Hotel - great. 555 phone service - rip off.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: sona
Reviews.Content: I stayed here last year in oct and had a good sized room, not the best views (facing the other end of the hotel) but didnt bother me too much. ROOM: Very clean, sheets clean and very comfy bed. Felt like I felt like I slept on a cloud! Bathroom was clean, didnt see cracked tiles etc, but was spotless We didnt eat breakfast here as it was 22 euros for a buffet! which we thought was far too expensive. However if you turn left out of the hotel and walk a little down, there is a large supermarket which was more or less same prices as you pay here so we got a few things from there. We had a mini bar (small fridge) so we used that to keep things cool. There was a bar where you can have a drink or some food, but it looked very old fashioned from the decor, and we are not drinkers so we didnt stay there, so cant comment much on that. Though the prices looked expensive for a drink, cant remember how much and theres so many bars/pubs around the corner from the hotel, we didnt feel it was worth checking it out anyway. LOCATION: Great location, just 5 mins walk from the train station and if you turn right and then right again, you come across loads of argentinian restaurants serving steaks, etc. We ate there and had a lovely meal of very well cooked steak with some chips and salad for 8 euros. Just beyond this is Dam square so the location was very central. SERVICE Staff were friendly upon arrival. We asked about a tram pass and the lady at reception gave us a 10 single pass ticket for 7 euros( I think). She explained to get it stamped for each trip on the tram which worked out to be cheaper and any unused trips can be used next time(no expiry) Overall great hotel, clean room, and fantastic location.

Reviews.Title: “It is small”
Reviews.Author: Spongejim
Reviews.Content: Went for a weekend to Ansterdam with a friend. The hotel looks good and is very conveniently located being a short walk from Amsterdam Central Station as well as the many attractions. However the room was small, had a strange layout and a small bathroom and shower. The facilities in the room were adequate but not what I would expect for the price of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Superb staff at this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: wommy
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 3 nights with friends, first time in Amsterdam, and this hotel was perfect for us. The location is great, the rooms are fine, there is a lovely lobby area with comfortable sofas and newspapers etc, and the breakfast is really plentiful and good quality. However, the thing that makes this hotel so good is the staff, all of whom where just so friendly, helpful and courteous, couldn't do enogh for us and reall made our trip go so smoothly. All in all a superb hotel in a fantastic city!

Reviews.Title: “Okay depending on what room you get..”
Reviews.Author: cheesecake0509
Reviews.Content: I can't fault the location, the staff or the comfiness of the bed but as a business traveller I was disappointed with the room. It was up in the eaves and was small, dark and difficult to work in. Also, the room service menu was limited, there was no real space to eat it once it arrived, the internet was unreliable and no iron in the room. Small issues to some but as a business traveller you notice these things. However as I was leaving I saw one of the other rooms being cleaned and it looked so much bigger and brighter so perhaps if I had got a different room my review would be different and with hindsight I should have asked to be moved in the first place! The moral of the story is ask to be moved if you get room 501, although joking aside I think the hotel need to address the iron, room service and internet issues.

Reviews.Title: “lovely little hotel”
Reviews.Author: luxe_travelLondon
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Convent with my partner for a one-night city break. I booked a Classic Room online, and was upgraded on arrival to room 151. Check-in was smooth and friendly, and it was great to get into the room by 1pm already. 151 is billed as a suite, and while I think it's not really spacious enough for a suite, it was perfectly adequate, had a nice quirk with the bed on an elevated platform, a modern, clean bathroom and comfortable bed and pillows. There really is no view to speak of, and it's quite dark, due the wall that's almost right in front of one of the windows, but it's not a huge issue and we were very happy with the room. Worth mentioning is the fact that although it faces right onto a main road and is only on the first floor, the windows are double glazed, and we did not hear any traffic at all. Service from all members of staff (reception, bar, housekeeping, concierge) was friendly and polite. We ordered the 'convenient breakfast' to the room, which costs a very reasonable EUR 9.50 p/p, incl. hot drink, freshly squeezed orange juice and a selection of pastries and baguettes. Even better, there was no sur-charge to have it in the room! We called in the morning and it was delivered 10min later. The only minor downside is the speed of the internet connection. Considering that you are being charged for the code, it really is too slow. All in all, we would definitely come back to the Convent.

Reviews.Title: “A nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Rochesterian_Guy
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the hotel Sept. 2-6, 2010. All in all, very satisfied. Location is good. You really don't want to the be any further north, which puts you closer to Central Station. Nor do you want to be too far to the east as that puts you in the middle of rather gritty Dam Square area, Chinatown and the Red Light District. For a central location, this is indeed the best location on a very nice street. Comfortable, but small room (stayed in 206). The first room assigned was right across from the elevator. Management cheerfully obliged my request to move to a "quieter" location. Minor improvement opportunities: One wash cloth, funky shower that took some practice, $18.00 a day for the Internet package (use it by the hour for $2 Euros in the business center) and $22 Euros for breakfast buffet (skip it...outrageously priced). Recommendations: Don't eat in the area. Walk a few short blocks to Jordaan, which is much nicer and more upscale...lots of charming places. Or even head south to Leidersplein. Otherwise, a very satisfactory place to stay and base from which to explore. Next time, I think I will try to find something in the museum district.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: Packed_10
Reviews.Content: This hotel is conveniently located and well appointed. However, the majority of the day staff is indifferent and unfriendly. I sensed they were not fond of tourists. Although my stay was fuly paid in adance, there was a problem with my credit card upon check-in and the desk clerk was not going to extend her time to work out the issue. I was required to leave a cash deposit in addition to having my stay fully prepaid. Staff seemed to have difficulty with communication of policy and daily procedure. No two employees seemed to know what was going on. Hotel housekeeping is given to arguing loudly in hall ways in early mornings. Beware the rooms on the first floor overlooking the hidden alley. It is filled with riff-raff and next to a coffee shop that promotes marijuana. The party in the alley went on all night. TV appears to be accessible only with purchase of an entertainment package that includes Internet, music, games and TV. Bathtub/shower is very unsafe; lacks safety grips in tub. This is an expensive hotel and not worth the money.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Service, Great Room - Right in the centre of Amsterdam!”
Reviews.Author: TianaV
Reviews.Content: We got to the hotel at 11am (our check-in was scheduled for 2pm) and our room was ready for us. We asked if we could get a queen bed instead of two twins and they obliged without a question of doubt. The room was small but had all the neccessities and the bed was soooooo comfortable. The price was quite reasonable as it was literally a 2 minute walk to Dam Square and Centraal station.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, with friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: StickiVicki
Reviews.Content: We booked the Convent to celebrate our 10th wedding anniversary and we weren't disappointed. Rob on reception made it even more memorable by upgrading us, free of charge, to a luxury suite, where we had our own special entrance. We had plenty of room with a separate toilet and shower room. The shower was heavenly, with a massive showerhead on the ceiling and a huge walk-in shower - I want one of these at home. The water was constantly hot and the power was amazing. We had complimentary slippers and bathroom robe, all thick and fluffy, and a drinks ticket for a free drink in the hotel bar. The bar prices in the hotel aren't that much more than the pub prices (Vodka & Coke and a pint of lager is approx 13 Euros). The bed was huge and extremely comfortable with feather pillows and duvet. In fact I slept soundly the whole night through on both nights. Although we were on the ground floor at the front of the building, hardly any noise was heard from the traffic or people going about their business. Although check in is stated to be 2pm, we arrived at The Convent at about 10am and was greeted by the lovely Rob who made us feel really welcome and said our room was ready straight-away. We would definitely stay here again and recommend it to our friends.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable hotel - convienent location”
Reviews.Author: BenLeigh250
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for one night on a whistle stop tour of europe and had a very pleasent stay. Hotel beds were comfortable and used the my bed concept also found at sofitel hotel chain. Got the room on an incredible deal thanks to my friend so did not spend hundreds of pounds on the room!

Reviews.Title: “Okay but disappointed”
Reviews.Author: travelbatty
Reviews.Content: After reading all the good reviews for this hotel, I have to say I was disappointed. While the hotel staff was nice and friendly, and it is a central location, I found the area a little on the seedy side and didn't feel so completely safe and comfortable there. The hallways in the hotel looked as though they had not been vacuumed in some time, the room which I got was in need of a good cleaning and airing. The chairs in the room had dirty and stained fabric. I checked the bed and thankfully that was clean. The bathroom was okay, but could have been better. What I was really surprised about was that there was no in room safe. You also had to pay for Wifi. I only stayed for one night, because of convenience to the central station. I have stayed in better nicer hotels in Amsterdam for the same price.

Reviews.Title: “FANTASTIC location and very comfy bed!!”
Reviews.Author: stacey_holloway
Reviews.Content: I actually won a stay at this hotel in a raffle, and got even luckier when the staff upgraded us to a suite on arrival! The hotel was very nice - although I'm not sure I would pay hundreds of euros for a suite as I'm sure a regular room would be just as good! The room was quite large, with a huge squishy bed. There was a small flat screen tv, and a fantastic shower. I can't say that the "suite" lived up to my (possibly very high) expectations - being someone who normally stays in hostels/basic hotels, I was expecting a huge swanky room with huge plasma screens all over the place..! However it was very nice. The hotel itself has an "old school" feel to it - some might say it's in need of a refurb, but it is nicely kept and I think it just has character. The staff were incredibly friendly and helpful - veryy happy to direct us around the city and to recommend restaurants (there's an amazing argentinian steakhouse just up the road, for which they can give you a voucher for a free glass of wine and it's amazing!). We had breakfast included, which was decent - the usual buffet breakfast which offered eggs cooked to order and some hot items. We also had a drink in the bar which is like being aboard the Orient Express - very civilised, all decked out in red velvet - nice! The location was the best thing about this hotel - very close to everything and only a short walk from the train station and easy to find. We didn't need taxis/public transport once. Our window overlooked a busy street but we didn't find it particularly noisy. I would recommend this hotel - although I'm not sure what it costs!!!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic! We will be back!”
Reviews.Author: elbodans
Reviews.Content: This was a great hotel from top to bottom. The location was great--a less than ten minute walk from the train station, and directly across the street from a tram stop. The room was clean and quaintly decorated, with a little sitting area and a minibar that had room in it for your own things--should you want to chill a bottle of wine. The bed was, and I quote myself, â€˜like sleeping in a giant marshmallowâ€™--I have never been so comfortable. The staff was warm and friendly, and the lobby was well appointed. There was a little bar with giant overstuffed chairs that we would have visited if we would have stayed longer. I cannot find any fault with this hotel at all. Oh--and if you care about this sort of thing during your stay, it was two doors down from a not-so-scary-looking coffee shop (some were scary looking), and next door to a great little pastry shop that sold fantastic apple turnovers (my husband had three in the two days we were there!) We will return to Amsterdam, and when we do, we will stay at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: CHERYL1976
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Convent Hotel on a weekend visit to Amsterdam. Its close to central station and to Dam Square. Other reviews have talked about rude staff. I found it a 50/50 mix. Room was pleasant however after 2 emails and asking rude member of staff to ensure no feather bedding I still got some!!!! This was changed with us in the room, bed fully stripped and I have to say all bedding was spotless. Wouid not partake in breakfast as it is very over priced. And you can get a lovely breakfast whilst watching the world go by in Dam Square. There is a lovely cheap Italian restaurant opposite, however be prepared for slow service.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel - clean, friendly, good location.”
Reviews.Author: nyc212_10
Reviews.Content: My mom and I stayed at the Convent Hotel for 5 nights. It was easy to get to from the train station, and we had no problem getting to any of the sights. Quiet location but very centrally located. Breakfast was good, staff was friendly and helpful. We would definitely stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: Khalid_Nadeem
Reviews.Content: I can never imagine that accor can take this hotel under its umbrella. location and brteakfast is great but hotel is very run down. The room carpet was very dirty and bathroom sanitory was century old. The hotel does not deserve to be an accor group hotel.

Reviews.Title: “CHECK IN TIME IS 2PM NOT 12 AS ADVERTISED”
Reviews.Author: OLDHOUSE
Reviews.Content: My partner booked this Hotel due to the advertised check in time of 12 noon. My partner booked 6 rooms and only 3 of the 6 were ready. I contacted the Hotel who were very rude and told me that the check in time is in fact 2pm not 12 and that it is a mistake on the website. I asked how they would compensate the guests who's room was not ready and i was abruptely told they would not do nothing. I explained this was false advertisement and was more or lesstold, "SO WHAT" Below are the ACCOR website terms and condtions, Sales conditions of rate The Convent Hotel Amsterdam Hot deals - no change, no cancellation - see conditions Classic room with 1 double bed Special terms : : Client must provide credit card details to qualify for this promotion. No change or cancellation may be made after booking. The client acknowledges that the full price of the stay will be charged when the booking is made. This amount is non-refundable in the event of cancellation or change of dates of stay. Cancellation delay : Full deposit is not refundable even if the booking is cancelled or modified. Check in Policy : The room is available from 12:00. Check out Policy : Check-out time 12:00 Children policy : Accommodation is free for 1 child under 12 years sharing parents' room, a 50.00 pct discount is applied on breakfast. Package Inclusions : Hotel 100% smoke free. All the rooms are non smoking.~ Guarantee Policy : Full amount of stay is payable in advance by credit card at booking time. The staff refused to do anything and were very rude. Would not reccomend !!!!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice, comfortable and central location”
Reviews.Author: terri9AnnArbor
Reviews.Content: At the end of a 3 week long holiday, was nice to decompress at this hotel before returning to US. Location is ideal, allowing walking to all central attractions. wonderful restaurants nearby, shopping and museums. Bedding very clean and comfortable, AC working, and bath functioning. in summary, would return.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel”
Reviews.Author: Well_travelled028
Reviews.Content: The Convent is very conveniently located. It's less than 10 minutes walk from Amsterdam Central station. It is a short walk to Dam Square and The Palace. It is a stone's throw from the Singel canal. Be sure to walk the three canals Prinzengracht, Keizergracht and Herengracht. Here you will find Amsterdam at its finest. Don't take the boat trip in front of Central Station for 13 euros, instead take it from Munt Plein at the bottom of Rokin for 8 euros. Same tour, different departure location. Don't miss the flower market which is in the same location. Do eat in the Italian restaurant opposite the hotel for seriously good pasta at very reasonable prices. If you can afford it, upgrade to a luxury room at the Convent - well worth the money. Try to get breakfast included in the cost of the room. It is seriously good! Smoked salmon and scrambled eggs - yummy. Just one of the many options available. Beer in the lovely air conditioned hotel bar was just the same price as a beer in a crummy bar on the main road! Amsterdam is the most expensive city we have visited in a long time.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful on every level! Will definitely be back!”
Reviews.Author: LukewarmCatastrophe
Reviews.Content: My partner and I have just completed a short tour of Europe and stayed in a variety of standard of lodgings, ranging from 1 star hostels (hovels?) to this little gem, a stones throw from Centraal Station. After several nights in humid, overpriced hostels in Switzerland, we arrived at the smart, air conditioned (hooray!) Convent Hotel to be greeted by a wonderfully warm and helpful receptionist who actually looked pleased to see us, rather than just viewing us as another obstacle in her day as so many hotel staff often view their guests. I may as well mention now, that EVERY member of staff we dealt with in this hotel was nothing short of first class in terms of their service to us, whether it was a smile or a joke, we felt very welcome and I can't praise the hotel enough for this. Our room was on the first floor, 135. No street view, but I didn't ask for one, so no complaints at all. The room was cool and surprisingly spacious, with fully adjustable air-con, the decor was pleasant and well-appointed, and everything looked crisp and smelled fresh and clean. There were tea and coffee making facilities, a flat screen tv, a large desk, a chair, a huge comfortable bed with feather pillows and a private bathroom with a hot, powerful shower and great and abundant complementary toiletries. We had an early check out the next day to get to a concert and wanted to leave our rucksacks in the left-luggage facility. The receptionist ordered a bell boy to deal with this for us and it was done so quickly and politely. Upon returning to collect our rucksacks after midnight, we told the receptionist we had some "left luggage" to collect to which he remarked "LOST luggage!!??" and he gave us a cheeky smile - again, great service and even though we had checked out of the hotel already, he was happy to let us use the bathroom facilities in the reception area to freshen up before our long journey to Germany later that morning. This is the first time I've used a Mercure hotel. I am actually an Accor Loyalty Card holder as I use the Ibis/Etap chains quite a bit back in the UK when I am travelling about and the Mercure's are often a little out of my ideal price range as my requirements from a hotel are very basic (I don't order breakfast/room service/require conference facilities, etc!) but we got the Convent Hotel at a VERY good rate during Accor's 50% off promotion so only paid Â£56 for the night which is pretty incredible for a 4 star hotel in the middle of Amsterdam. I really can't rate this hotel highly enough and we were actually sad to leave which I think says it all. We will DEFINITELY stay again. Thank you to all staff who made our stay so wonderful!

Reviews.Title: “Good location, good value”
Reviews.Author: ToniTorpedo
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel with a group. We arrived early in the morning so our rooms weren't ready, yet (which was totally ok), but were offered to change clothes in the sauna. We went to a bike a trip for the whole day (got great driving instructions from the guy at the front desk) and upon arrival at 6 pm we were told that not all of our rooms were ready! That was quite annoying since we all were sweaty and tired from the bike trip and all everybody wanted was a relaxing shower. We could sort out this annoyance with a (very) late check-out the following day, which made it up to us. Rooms were nothing to write home about, but were quiet. One room smelled strong of tobacco smoke, even though it's a non-smoking hotel. Central train station is within walking distance, a tram station is in front of the hotel, the area was quiet and safe.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay”
Reviews.Author: Europe2010_10
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I stayed at the Convent Hotel after a recommendation from a friend who had travelled to Amsterdam in January 2010. As a party of two females travelling alone my priority for accomodation options was a safe location, cleanliness and security of 24 hour reception and attentive reception staff. This hotel ticked all the boxes. We enjoyed a speedy checkin after a short walk approx 5 - 10 mins from the Centraal Station. Our room was booked through Expedia and was classed Deluxe with buffet breakfast included. The room (105) was on the first floor with 3 large windows looking out to the street. The room was very large with lovely feather pillows and duvet on the bed. A comfortable nights sleep no street noise (Thursday and Friday night). The bathroom was very large also even by Australian standards. The reception staff offered information on public transport and sold us a 48 hour tram pass for 11 euro this was an exellent buy as the tram stopped right outside the hotel entrance. The breakfast room was spacious and the food selection good. The lobby was a relaxing space with a library and lounges which I used while my daughter used the computer in the business centre for a small fee. We had a great stay at The Convent the location is fantastic, service and ambience first class.

Reviews.Title: “perfect location, perfect staff, good value for money.”
Reviews.Author: CMeloyWorrall
Reviews.Content: We love Amsterdam and this hotel was excellent value for money. It was clean, excellently located and very helpful staff. CAN'T RECOMMEND HIGHLY ENOUGH! Beddington's restaurant was recommended by hotel staff was amazing.

Reviews.Title: “Surprisingly great”
Reviews.Author: humasamim
Reviews.Content: I booked the hotel same day on train to amsterdam. it is located in centreof shopping,entertainment, amusement. central station is walking distance.Dam sqaure is just behind the hotel afew minutes. the staff is just great with huge smiles on their faces. It was just perfect for the budget we had for a european 4 star hotel. the hotel is originally a old buildings renovated into a beautifulluxury hotel. living in the middle east, we are quite spoiled with hotel quality. this hotel is good for people coming from middle east.

Reviews.Title: “Rude obnoxious reception staff.. DO NOT use this hotel for a group booking”
Reviews.Author: wagondragon69
Reviews.Content: We booked 3 rooms..one twin and 2 doubles for 5 of us..Reception staff told us we had not paid for rooms even though we had booking confirmation and pre paid vouchers for all 3 rooms. On check in we were told we would have to pay again... staff refused to help us. We eventually got 3 rooms and when we returned they had removed our belongings and resold one of the rooms. Front of house staff are the worst that I have ever dealt with and I travel for my job. I would never ever stay here again...nor were we made aware that there was an 5% city tax payable on all rooms on check out.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and value for money, very friendly. :)”
Reviews.Author: redstaff
Reviews.Content: A outstanding hotel where all the staff are very friendly. When staying there i lost my bank card, which i didn't realise until the hotel left a message in the room to go to reception. I went down and spoke to the the very well presented receptionist which informed me of my bank card missing. Great place, i will go back.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, Great staff, Great rate”
Reviews.Author: TheTrueKingWally
Reviews.Content: Room was comfortable and standard European size. with a very comfortable bed. The location was outstanding, being a short walk from Centraal station, close to the Dam square and the Jordaan district, with a tram stop directly across the street. Laundry just down the block, and good restaurants close by. Breakfast at the hotel was a bit expensive, so we had our Pannokokenen next door. Service was excellent, and we would definitely stay here again on our next visit to Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Stay at the Convent - the perfect retreat!”
Reviews.Author: Davienick
Reviews.Content: My wife and I were fortunate to stay at the Convent on a recent weekend break with friends. The central location of the hotel is ideal for sight seeing the amazing city of Amsterdam. The staff were welcoming, friendly and professional. Their multilingual skills are typical of their nation. Our room overlooked the main road but the noise from the trams and other traffic was not intrusive. The bathroom was spacious and well decorated. The separate "loo" was a bit cramped. The Duke of Windsor Bar was cozy and a good choice for an aperitif. We only had breakfast on the last morning of our stay but wished we had tried it sooner, because the "full English" was generous as well as tasty. A pot of coffee would have been a better choice than the individual cups. If we ever have the chance to stay in this fine hotel again, we will take it.

Reviews.Title: “Great Birthday Stay”
Reviews.Author: h_andy1
Reviews.Content: I'd always wanted to go to Amsterdam and my partner took me there as a surprise treat for my 30th birthday, booking us at this hotel. The location was great - easy from the main station and close to tourist sites. The hotel was lovely and I'd definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “AMAZING! Beautiful!!!”
Reviews.Author: pitytata
Reviews.Content: Great place, very charmous!!! The best bed that I ever saw!!! Big and comfortable. Great location. Only one bad thing, it's a 4 stars hotel, it was my birthday and a 4 stars hotel offer me half bottle of water and biscuits (lol) .. but its ok, the place is great anyway!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for the Amsterdam experience”
Reviews.Author: FrankEastAnglia
Reviews.Content: The room was excellent, although they could provide a few more coffee/tea sachets, Great soundproofing, easy to understand heating control. Staff friendly, professional and helpful. Hotel itself in great location. A first rate experience.

Reviews.Title: “Agree with the good reviews”
Reviews.Author: mongrelmuppet
Reviews.Content: We live in a near-by city, so we don't often stay at a hotel when we visit Amsterdam. We stayed here overnight this time to meet up with friends arriving very late. For the location (so close to Centraal Station, tram stop right outside, well positioned for a great many of the city sites) the rate was excellent. It's clean and comfortable. Staff is excellent (friendly, accommodating, pleasant, knowledgeable). Everything worked in the room. Small mini-bar fridge with enough room for storing your own extra drinks and such. The only minor problems we encountered were key cards that took multiple tries to work each time and we could hear the bells of the trams (they ring a warning bell each time they close the doors and begin to move again after making a stop), which run well into the night and start early morning again. We didn't eat the breakfast (the vast majority of hotel breakfasts in most of Europe are so over priced for the quality it isn't worth it.) Overall, I'd stay here again with no problems and recommend it to anyone needing a good hotel in a great location.

Reviews.Title: “Good value hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: Collectandtravel
Reviews.Content: After a long train trip we were pleased to be booked into this hotel which was only a 10 minute walk from central station. The Convent is within walking distance of all the main attractions and the multilingual staff are helpful and friendly. They directed us to good local restraunts and the best options for canal tours etc. There was even a well-priced laundry within 50 meters which was a huge bonus after 2 weeks travlling. Our room was a good size with modern clean bathroom and a great bed. There were a choice of breakfast styles and price ranges which were basic but good. We would stay here again

Reviews.Title: “No better than average hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: Fish_in_a_Blue_Bag
Reviews.Content: The hotel itself looks lovely on the outside but really dated to me - perhaps it was just the floor (4th) we were on? The wallpaper seemed a bit twee, the furnishings were ok, and the bathroom functional, but certainly not as nice as I had hoped for following reading the other reviews. However, the staff were friendly and helpful and the location was great. It's on a busy street (but still nice and quiet - we even had a room overlooking the street and didn't notice the noise) but within 5 minutes walk of Amsterdam Centraal railway station (where you arrive at from the airport rail transfer) and Dam Square. Ann Frank museum only 5 minutes the other way, and 5 minutes from all the nightlife / coffee shops and red light district, so great for whatever you had planned in the Dam! Overall, we enjoyed our stay at the Convent, but for the price we paid I felt that we could have done better.

Reviews.Title: “excelent service and good location”
Reviews.Author: Inescarlos
Reviews.Content: What pleased me most was the service, especially at reception, very helpful and attentive. The room is a little small, the location is good, near the centre, near the station. The breakfast is basic , the bar is beautiful and charming and there is internet for low price.

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded our expectations.”
Reviews.Author: huploppy
Reviews.Content: Lovely building in good location. The rooms are a good size and very clean. Breakfast was very tasty and well cooked and we would stay there again. It was also good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Snowyann
Reviews.Content: The room was very clean and decorated tastefully. Nevertheless the staff could be a liitle more active during the breakfast (they don't come if you don't call them). Excellent situation.

Reviews.Title: “CONVENienT Location”
Reviews.Author: TravellingTrippers
Reviews.Content: Stayed at The Convent for a three night sightseeing trip, and enjoyed being within walking distance of Amsterdam Central Station, Dam Square, Anne Frank Museum, canal tours, shopping areas, eateries and a tram stop opposite. Hotel room a little dated but enjoyed a nice quiet cosy room, comfortable bed, flat screen TV with BBC, kettle to make tea, and lovely view over the rooftops towards Dam Square. I got a good rate with HotelClub with breakfast included, and was of reasonable quality. Hotel desk very helpful and sold me a sightseeing tour to the Tulip Fields and a 24 hour tram ticket. Internet available in the lobby for a small charge (50 cents for 15 minutes).

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Fantastic Location”
Reviews.Author: MMagdalena
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Convent Hotel for 3 nights and I must say, I could not have been more pleased. From the check in with the friendly staff, to the great room (best comforter and pillows), the whole stay was great. The hotel is located down from Central Train station (less than a 10 min walk). It is the perfect location as it is close to Dam Square but quiet enough that you wont be hearing all the noise from the main street or square. I stayed in room 445 which had a great view of the main street. Was not too small and everything was very clean. Only drawback is that they did not have a safe/lock box but besides that, I would recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Nice location, restful place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Bunnydots
Reviews.Content: I was booked to stay here for one night but due to the volcano one night turned into three. I was attracted to this hotel because it was in a historic building and was centrally located. It turned out to be a nice, restful place to stay, also very centrally located and close to tram lines, Central Station, the RLD, the Singel etc. Unfortunately the building inside is pretty much an ordinary, older hotel and does not convey much of a historic sense except in the lobby and the old-fashioned bar (which is very nice and the bartender gave good service), but the outside is nice to look at. The bed was EXCEPTIONALLY nice and comfortable, a large bed (not two twins shoved together or any of that nonsense) with a lot of extra pillows. My room did not have a view (I had booked one of the less expensive rooms intending to spend most of my time in it sleeping) but looked out on some picturesque rooftops. The bathroom fixtures were not brand new but neither were they ancient. They were pretty clean and worked reasonably well except that the tub stopper did not hold the water in the tub for very long before it all leaked out. The room was pretty clean although I found you have to be careful that the maid doesn't throw out things of yours (such as note papers) on the tables in her hurry to clean up. There is tea and coffee in the room and also a minibar, although it is not "fully stocked" unless you buy a higher priced room. (I'm not sure what the point is to that policy as I would have appreciated a better-stocked bar and don't see why I need to book a room that's too huge for me in order to get one, but whatever.) There is also a limited room service so I was able to get some soup and dessert, which was quite good. I did not try the breakfast as I don't like to eat a lot first thing in the morning normally. There is a convenience store (not part of the hotel) just across the alley a few steps from the front door, and also there is a supermarket a few blocks down the street, so you can get bread, cheese, cookies, drinks and that sort of thing and maybe keep some of it in the minibar fridge if you don't want to eat restaurant food all the time. TV was not pay and included all four BBC channels, although no US channels. Internet is pay but if you have a KPN or Tmobile subscription, you can use it to access the wi-fi, so I was able to use my subscription and did not have to pay. Overall this is a nice place and I would definitely consider staying again. The biggest minus for me, aside from the tub that did not work, was the complete lack of a safe in the room. Really a pain not to have a safe place to store one's valuables and laptop computer.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in excellent location”
Reviews.Author: baywatch_10
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Convent Hotel for a few days over Easter. It's a great hotel. Vey close to the station - about 5 minutes walk and easy to find. The room was clean and comfortable. The staff were all very helpful and spoke excellent English. Although there are no safes in the rooms you can leave valuables in the hotel safe. The hotel is in walking distance to Anne Frank House and the museums.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, comfortable”
Reviews.Author: Gutch2
Reviews.Content: We stayed here two nights while on a coach tour. This hotel is very comfortable, easy walking distance to everything you might want. The Police station is actually across the street so it certainly seems like it would be safe. Breakfast was good. Room was comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful beds & Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: JoJoDro
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Convent Hotel for 5 days with a friend & had a great experience & would definitely recommend it to others. Great location - close to the all the action of the Red Light District & to the train station. Our room was very nice & we were glad to have electric tea pot. The beds were probably the most comfortable beds I have ever slept on in a hotel...seriously! Big comfy pillows & blankets, which were great because the weather was freezing! Coffee shops & restaurants, bars are all close by, plus there is a little store right next door which comes in handy! I would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: neelp
Reviews.Content: Spent a weekend in this hotel for my second trip to Amsterdam. The location is great as its right next to Dam Square, waling distance to Centraal Station, everything you need. For a 4 Star hotel, the rooms are fairly dated - no safe in the room etc (they insist on cleaning your room according to their timetable otherwise they dont). The reception staff are incredibly helpful and I would certainly go back to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, but very average hotel”
Reviews.Author: macidublin
Reviews.Content: Pros:Great location, within easy walking distance of all sights. Cons: The room was very dated with no soundproofing at all. If you like your sleep, you will not get it here. There is no safe in the room, so be warned.You can leave your valuables at the reception, but i found that a pain to be honest. Receptionists may of being having a bad night, but we found them very rude and unhelpful.

Reviews.Title: “excellant”
Reviews.Author: happyholidays042
Reviews.Content: The service in the hotel was very friendly and helpful. room was very clean and comfortable, Great location a short walk from the station, very close to shops and restaurants. will be staying there again.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location near Dam Square”
Reviews.Author: Corkii
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel with my partner and a friend for a long weekend. We chose the hotel because of the location and price and were pleased with our choice. The room rate included breakfast which was buffet style (both continental and English choices) and of good quality. Our rooms were not the largest I have stayed in or the most luxurious but they were clean and had everything that you need for a weekend break. Of particularly note was the bed which was probably one of the most comfortable I have experienced in a hotel in a long time. The bathrooms were well equipped and had various amenities such as shampoos and shower gel. In summary, although we didnâ€™t spend much time in the hotel I would be happy to stay here again (especially if I got a good price). There is no "wow" factor about this hotel but itâ€™s in a good location and is clean and comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “First class comfort and service”
Reviews.Author: deeintheculdesac
Reviews.Content: Great hotel if you're planning a trip to Amsterdam. Centrally located, yet quiet. Fantastic staff who understand the meaning of going the extra mile. Nothing was too much trouble and they couldn't do enough to ensure our stay was as comfortable and enjoyable as possible. A rarity in a big city. Room was superb - have never slept in a more comfortable bed - and the shower room was fabulous, with the added bonus of fluffy bathrobes, slippers and high quality shower and beauty products. Fruit bowl and complimentary bottles of water were very much appreciated. This hotel exceeded expectations in every way, but its major asset was its staff - they were fantastic. Will definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “central, clean, excellent”
Reviews.Author: duff73
Reviews.Content: Stayed here last week. 3 of us in one room. the reviews are spot on. the hotel is very central. walking distance to train, shoping, dam square etc. also very clean which is rare in this part of town i believe for the price. room was quiet & plenty of room for 3 of us. would recomend here to anyone. bar is very quiet though. but nice if you want a quiet drink. breakfast was a bit overpriced at â‚¬22 but plenty of places to eat in area. dont use the room phone but thats the same in any hotel. beds are soft but who goes to amsterdam to sleep. would deffo stay here again

Reviews.Title: “Great for the price on Hotels.com”
Reviews.Author: glenntackett
Reviews.Content: No free internet, television, or radio. To use the television cost around 17 euro and I wanted to see the Vancouver Olympics. That was disappointing. Ended up at a pub instead but missed some of the events while I as getting dressed to go. It was at a wonderful location next to the Grasshopper Coffee Shop (not the nightclub). The clerks are friendly and are excellent at giving directions. My room was clean with a nice large bathtub.

Reviews.Title: “Great service and location!”
Reviews.Author: Alwaystravelling3
Reviews.Content: I spent four days in Amsterdam at the Convent Hotel and enjoyed the experience thoroughly. The reception staff is extremely friendly and eager to attend to all your needs. I had read reviews saying that the hotel needed repairs. Although it does not boast a very modern decor, it is extremely comfortable and cozy. The decoration is classical, but the hotel has all the modern amenities, including flat screen TV and internet access. The rooms are pristine and the beds are divine. We got a package with breakfast included, and breakfast was quite nice. If you don't have breakfast included, I suggest you have it somewhere else, as there are fantastic bakeries in Amsterdam and you can eat very well for a lot less. The location is excellent, with several good restaurants and shopping streets just outside the door. The hotel is also a five minute walk from the train station, so no need to take a taxi when arriving by train. A tram stop just in front of the door is also a big advantage. Totally recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “Clients were very disapointed”
Reviews.Author: sbottoms48
Reviews.Content: Just had very good clients come back and they checked out after the first night and they only stayed the first night to not lose money. The room smellled, was very small and the bathroom was not at all up to par. I use tripadvisor often and am not usually disapointed but was not happy to hear from these very good clients who were are very busy and looking forward to a few days of leisure.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed our stay at this hotel”
Reviews.Author: humblebumblebee
Reviews.Content: Well run friendly hotel. Very convenient for all sight seeing either walking locally or by public transport. Rooms are clean and very comfortable. Staff professional and helpful. Well positioned hotel, we thoroughly enjoyed our stay here and would recommend it to anyone. Got to say also, the bed was absolutely wonderful, so difficult to get out of in the morning because it was totally comfortable!!

Reviews.Title: “Exceptionally pleasant experience!”
Reviews.Author: anvas
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel! Exceptionally hospitable, helpful and professional staff. Clean rooms with very comfortable beds. Historical building with big lobby. Nicely decorated lounge bar for an evening drink or a night cap. Perfect central location close to all major attractions at the same time a bit away from noisy tourist streets. Walking distance from the Central train station. Direct tram line to Van Gogh and other major museums. Would highly recommend both for business travelers and tourists, including families with children. When booking make sure that breakfast is included in the rate â€“ otherwise a bit expensive (but there are several places that serve cheaper breakfast just a few steps away). If you want a tasty and reasonably priced pizza/pasta â€“ there is a very cozy small restaurant â€œLa Betollaâ€� just across the street. When going to museums or attractions ask the Hotel Reception for discount coupons. If you have an extra day or even half a day â€“ take a train and visit The Hague (50 minutes on a fast train).

Reviews.Title: “This place needs a refurbishing”
Reviews.Author: netking17
Reviews.Content: An average hotel in it's category (****). Seriously, could be renewed. Been there ten years ago and it was a wonder. Nowadays, the wonder blemishes a little... Just a regular ****, very classic, nothing to except... Good but could do so much better...

Reviews.Title: “Glorious!”
Reviews.Author: manxbrew
Reviews.Content: This was our first stay at The Convent Hotel, and it will not be our last. Staff could not be more helpful, especially Carmen, who arranged a bouquet of yellow roses for my wife. The room (and the hotel) was spotless, the breakfasts were excellent and the location was very close (2 minutes walk) to the main shopping area and Dam Square. Many other reviews have made mention of the comfy beds, and we can certainly concur - they are a real struggle to get out of - far to comfy for your own good! Also worthy of mention is the wet room bathroom with a glorious 'drench' shower that really wakes you up. If you are looking for a romantic break in Amsterdam, we don't think you will find better than The Convent.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasently Suprised”
Reviews.Author: redgrange
Reviews.Content: I was a little worried about showing up to the hotel. Well, it turns out there was no reason to be. I travel consantly and gennerally stay at 4 or 5 star hotels (us and Europe). Well not only was this hotel clean and spacious, but the reception was one of the friendliest that I have ever delt with (definately the best in Europe). Will definitely go out of the way to help you. My room was clean and by European standards, quite large. The bed was very soft and comfortable. I slept great (and I usually have problems sleeping in hotel beds). Location was ideal, walking distance to almost everywhere you'd want to go. And If somewhere is too far to walk, the tram station is right across the street. RLD, central station, and all the other sights are nearby. What even makes it better is that it's in an area that isn't crazy........but within a 5 minute walk, your in the craziness of Amsterdam! I would dedinatly stay there again on my next trip and would highly reccommend it. The only negative is that you have to pay for internet. Also, I read several reviews about the high cost of their breakfast..... Well every morning, I ate breakfast (not the buffet) and paid a total of 15â‚¬ with tip for a delicious , fulling breakfast

Reviews.Title: “Close to center of Amsterdam.”
Reviews.Author: poly65
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very good. People on reception were helpful and friendly. The price was a bit expensive and did not include the breakfast. The room was very nice with comfortable bed. The bathroom was old and clearly needed a renovation. Still we felt very comfortable. This hotel is in a great location - within walking distance to virtually all the major sights.

Reviews.Title: “Great base for sightseeing”
Reviews.Author: yendesk
Reviews.Content: Amsterdam is quite compact, so many of the hotels are in a "central" location. This was certainly true of this hotel; a short walk to Dam Square and Anne Frank House, while we took a tram to the Rijksmuseum, with a leisurely walk back. The decor is a little tired, but the room was a reasonable size, and the bed was extremely comfortable. We arrived early, but were still checked into our room. The service was good (though we ddn't eat or drink there). There is no "wow" factor about the hotel, but for the price, I would certainly recommend it to a non-business traveller on a weekend break

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant location, very comfortable, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: misspink34
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for one night with a friend and were both really impressed with the hotel. Arrived well before check in time as we had travelled over from Newcastle on the ferry which got us into Amsterdam at about 9:30am, but went straight to the hotel really just to leave our luggage until check in time, but were able to check in right away. Front desk staff were extremely friendly and helpful and directed us to our room which was on the first floor and had 3 single beds which, as other people have said, were SOOOOO comfortable! Room was well equipped with tea and coffee facilities, TV, mini bar etc. Bathroom was a decent size as was the room, and had a nice selection of toiletries and a fairly powerful shower. We didnt eat or drink in the hotel itself, so cant comment on that aspect, but overall were impressed with the hotel and feel it offered excellent value for money.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel needs a renovation, Yet we enjoyed our stay”
Reviews.Author: chunky25
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a standard double room for one night. The staff at the check in was very, very friendly and anxious to help us. On check out unfortunately not. We had a voucher. With several employees of The Convent I clarified that I would get the balance booked back onto my credit card. Still she hesitated and told me about problems and procedures of the hotel and that this would not be possible usually. As a 4 star hotel guest I have no interest in knowing about any hotel procedures. If I was told it works, I want it done. The room was very nice with an unbelivably comfortable bed. The bathroom was very old and clearly needed a renovation. Water leaked. Sanitation very old but clean. Still we felt very comfortable. The biggest problem here was parking. The parking garage at the other side of the street was 50EUR for 24 hrs. Alternatively you can park the car outside the city in one of the Accor car parks and catch the train to the city.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant Hotel”
Reviews.Author: irishpat49
Reviews.Content: My husband and i stayed in this hotel for the second time in a year,i wrote a review after first visit and didnt think i could better that.Wrong.It was even better second time around. The reception staff and concierge remembered us and we were greeted like old friends it was like coming home.They cant do enough to help you,for instance i had forgotten to bring a voucher for a dinner cruise i had booked and paid for on line,i couldnt remember what company i had used,the staff phoned every canal cruise company until they found it and got it all sorted out for us,now thats what i call service. We were given a late checkout room free of charge,they just couldnt do enough for us. As i said in my previous review the hotel is very well situated ,you can walk everywhere,and there is every type of eating place within a 5 minute walk.If you want to take any excursions the hotel have details of them all and will book for you. I could continue to praise this hotel all day and plan to go back in the Spring,i read a couple of reviews before we went back for our second visit and wondered if these people had been to same place as us!!!

Reviews.Title: “wonderful hotel!”
Reviews.Author: aussietrek
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for 3 nights and loved it! We would have given it a 5/5 except for the fact that our towels smelled like cigarette smoke. This was odd because the rest of the room was immaculate and the hotel is non-smoking. The only thing we could think of is that perhaps a staff member smokes in the laundry room. This towel issue continued throughout our stay, though in fairness to them, we didn't mention it because everything else was so great! This hotel was in a great location - within walkable distance to virtually all the major sights. The two best things about this hotel were: (1) the beds (soooo comfortable!!) and (2) the service. The service was truly exceptional. Upon arrival, they gave us detailed explanations of everything in the hotel, and of all the major sights. Told us what to avoid, gave us coupons, etc. This excellent service continued throughout our stay. They had free Internet access (including free printing) available in the lobby. Not sure whether they had Internet access in rooms as we did not bring a laptop. We didn't eat breakfast there so can't comment on it. Though we did have drinks and snacks in their bar, and it was very nice. We would definitely stay again!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, friendly and helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: IpinNL
Reviews.Content: The Convent hotel was in an ideal location to explore Amsterdam. The staff were very friendly and helpful. They realised it was my partners birthday from her passport and left her a card, rose, chocolates and a present for her int he room on the day of her birthday - how thoughtful is that! The hotel and room were very clean and bed was huge and very comfortable. The view fromt he room was the only negative point, we looked out onto a building only feet away, above an alley. We didn't use any of the hotel facilities and our deal (very cheap via expedia) didn't include breakfast, the hotel breakfast looke dpricey so we ate in local cafe's. All in all an excellent hotel.

Reviews.Title: “I wish I can bring the pillow and mattress home!”
Reviews.Author: Sporean
Reviews.Content: I really like this hotel for the bed and pillow.Its the best among all the hotels I have stayed in for the trip. I only stayed here for 1 day and its a pity our tour reached the hotel late. There is a shopping mall nearby (abt 5mins walk) and like a shopping district all around the hotel. Its easy to find fast snacks at night. A bus or tram stop is just nearby too. I stayed at the unit facing the main road but I can hardly hear any noise. Maybe because its already late at night (ie 9pm) However, the painting of the elderly man kind of freak me out when I entered the hotel room alone. The painting is so real i feel that the sad looking man is looking at me. Toilet is big and spacious and comes with a bath Tub. we have a small surprise when we have a tray with rose, pack of biscuits, evian and 1 nice house clay figurine. As my tour director mentioned abt 'not taking anything from hotel no matter how nice they are', i am not sure if I can bring that clay figurine home and I checked with the receiption and he said Yes! So now, its on displayed in my room We have breakfast buffet provided in the morning but i cannot remember the spread.

Reviews.Title: “an unassuming gem in a great location”
Reviews.Author: stenson
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 4 day stay at the Convent. The hotel is wonderfully located, walking distance to museums, shopping, sites.The lobby is comfortable and the place is spotless.Front desk was always welcoming and helpful, as was the porter.. The room was small but spotless and well appointed and laid out. The highlight was the incredibly dreamy bed. Unfortunately it didn't fit in my bag and therefore had to leave it there for other guests to use. The bed alone is worth the stay. i highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel in great location with awesome service”
Reviews.Author: OinOhio
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 10 days on our honeymoon and found it to be excellent. The hotel is very close to city attractions, while being on a fairly quiet street. There is a police substation across the street with camera coverage of the area, so it's as safe as you can get. There are 3 restaurants on the same block as well as a convenience store, two coffee shops, an internet cafe and a laundromat. The staff were extremely helpful, the rooms clean, the service great. I would stay there again and would recommend this hotel to anyone. Our room was spacious, the amenities worked well, everything was as it should be. Everything about our stay was positive, from the moment we checked in, until the moment we checked out.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect weekend”
Reviews.Author: Charlywoo
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed in this hotel for 2 nights, we were on a budget so didnt book directly with the hotel, but got a good deal on the internet which seemed to work out cheaper! When we arrived at Central Station the hotel was within walking distance so that saved us taxi/tram costs. We arrived at the hotel about 5 hours before check in but were able to leave our bags in a secure area whilst we went off to explore Amsterdam, the receptionist was extremely helpful and actually informed us that we could have our room at 12.00 a good 3 hours before check in! The hotel is round the corner from Dam Square and all the main tourist areas are within walking distance which was an added bonus. The room was extremely clean and tidy and the bed was amazing, very comfortable! We didnt use the bar or restaurant so cant comment on these. Checkout was just as good as check in, we had a late flight so again could leave our bag in the secure area. I would definately recommend this hotel to anyone going to Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “A classic hotel in the centre of Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: zwerf
Reviews.Content: This is a fine, upscale hotel near the very centre of Amsterdam. It's about 100 m from the back of the Oude Kerk and the Magna Plaza. The street and area around the hotel is typical of the centre of Amsterdam. Nothing sordid, but you have to walk around a bit to find the charm. Lots of small restaurants, cafes, bars, etc. A convenience store nearby. (And of course the Albert Heijn near the Magna Plaza.) The hotel has an impressive exterior. Here is a building with a story. Inside, the lobby is large and comfortable. It feels like a standard 4-star hotel of the kind that businessmen and well-off travellers stay at. The staff were all friendly, accommodating and helpful. No problems there at all. The room was surprisingly affordable when we booked it (considering the quality of the hotel) but then perhaps this is because we booked almost 8 months in advance. The room itself was about 25 sq. metres. So not huge, but not small either. By Amsterdam standards, it was as large a room as one could expect for the price we paid. We had enough room for an armchair. The decor was traditional. The bed was unusually large and comfortable. Lot of pillows, duvet, etc. The smallish bathroom was fine, but not luxurious. Fusion bath goodies. The TV wasn't a flat screen TV. There were only a handful of English stations. Fortunately they had the Comedy Channel, with programming mostly in English. On the weekend that we were there, the internet was free. The breakfast buffet was 22 euros, but they also have breakfast plates for around 12 euros. The buffet was very nice. It had salmon. I wouldn't call it a large buffet though. For that reason, to me this buffet was not worth 22 euros.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel!! Large rooms and large bathrooms!!”
Reviews.Author: palmtree152
Reviews.Content: Best hotel I've stayed in Europe. Large room and huge bathroom and all very clean!! Walking distance to train station and all of Amsterdam. Very friendly and helpful staff. Would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Highly Recommended”
Reviews.Author: 8Busby
Reviews.Content: My wife and I have just returned home after spending an excellent 4 day break at The Convent. I have to say that we had an exceptional time and were treated very well by the courteous and ever helpful staff, especially the young lady who checked us in, and Rob who assisted us when we had an enforced room change. The rooms are a decent size by Amsterdam standards. We were initially given room 204 which is a large classic room overlooking the street. It was a bit noisy into the early hours of the morning with traffic and a few late night revellers outside, but we had asked for a bright and airy room and this fitted the bill. However on the second day of our stay our shower developed a fault which required attention by a plumber. We had to be moved to an alternative room and were very grateful for what turned out to be a luxurious upgrade to room 250. This room had far more space and had a marvellous, walk-in rain shower. (The hotel really should have this professionally photographed and shown on their own website - it was that good !). The bed was enormous, dressed in pristine white sheets and covers, and extremely comfortable. This room also faced the street and had three, floor to ceiling windows which also made it very bright and airy. However it had also been fitted with double glazing which completely eliminated the outside noise. Result ! If I'm being picky there are two things which I feel the hotel could improve on. First of all the gym cannot, by any stretch of the imagination really be called,.......a gym. It consists of 3 outdated fixed pieces of equipment ;- a cycle. a rowing machine, and an abs machine, none of which were worthwhile for anyone expecting a decent workout. Secondly, The Windsor Bar ! This Bar is a wonderfully themed spot to enjoy a few drinks either before heading out for the evening, or for a night cap on the return. It is lovely inside and should really be the first stop for the captive audience, ( the hotel guests!). Unfortunately though, the pricing is a bit steep which appears to have the result of encouraging the guests to look for alternatives elsewhere. We had a nightcap in The Windsor on our first night. The bar was surprisingly empty when we arrived. However when we paid just under 11 euros for a small glass of wine and a small glass of beer we worked out why. This bar is one of the nicest and most luxurious we were in during our stay, and deserves to be full with a thriving guest community. And it would be if the drinks prices were a bit more competitive. A bit of fine tuning here and the Bar would be full every night and profits would be up. Having said that, neither of these points were a real issue for us. Everything else about the hotel was abosolutely first class. We would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone looking to experience the finer things that Amsterdam has to offer.

Reviews.Title: “Very Happy”
Reviews.Author: kevinhector
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a great stay at this hotel. Had a large quiet room on the fifth floor (room 508). Location was perfect, 10 minutes walk from Centraal station and 5 minutes from main shopping street and 10 minutes from Red Light District and Dam Square. Plenty of cafes and bars in the immediate vicinity. If you like Chineas food then do try the 'Wok to Walk' takeaway just around the corner from the hotel. I can confirm that the beds are as comfortable as mentioned in previous reviews. I will not go far wromg with this hotel. Tip: When attempting to locate the hotel from the station look out for the Bellvue Hotel. The Convent is a 5 minute walk further down the street.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice”
Reviews.Author: mrhz
Reviews.Content: Courteous service. Nice bathroom The room was quite small though. Ideally placed from amsterdam centraal.

Reviews.Title: “Close to Amsterdam Centraal”
Reviews.Author: x_tan
Reviews.Content: This hotel is about 10 min easy walk from Amsterdam Centraal Station. Otherwise everything else is average to a 4 star hotel. A bike rental just next the hotel in the side street. Save us lots walk in Amsterdam. But their bikes are VERY OLD! Few block away has 'Yellow Bike' rental if you don't mind 'looking out standing' in Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Good location and comfy beds. Some rooms very small though...”
Reviews.Author: hankhill23
Reviews.Content: Friendly staff, although we kept having to go to reception to find the barman as he kept vanishing. My room was so small I couldn't sit at the desk, and as I was there 3 days I changed it. Internet was outrageous at 20 Euros per day, and the cable connection didn't work, so they removed it from the bill and then tried to charge me 22 Euros for wifi. Beds were great, very comfy with big feather pillows. Had an average breakfast first day for 20 Euros, then went to restaurant next door following day for a full English at 6 Euros. Would happily go again although there's a lot of choice within a few hundred yards.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and the best beds ever!”
Reviews.Author: Ruehl925
Reviews.Content: Great Loacation in walking distance from Cetraal Station. Very easy to find for a firstimer in Amsterdam. Quick and friendly check in. Got a nice room on 3rd floor. Not very big, but big enough for 1 night. Had a wonderful kingsize bed...probably one of the most comfortable beds I ever had in a hotel. Nice amenties in bathroom, and very good towels. The shower was nice, but the showerwallconstruction flooded my bathroom floor, which happends every time with theese kind of showers. Internet is not free, and either is breakfast wich is 22 euros. It was good though...but probably cheaper to find something out in Amsterdam.
