There is a free business center down at the reception though....with quite good chairs, printer, and a fast connection. and btw...theere was a mouse running on the floor in the breakfastroom. Not a big deal for me, but I guess it is for some.....

Reviews.Title: “How can this hotel be in the top 20 in Amsterdam?”
Reviews.Author: enigmatic1jen
Reviews.Content: Wow, we were definitely surprised when we arrived at this hotel, and not in a good way. My husband and about 6 of his colleagues were all booked in this hotel for 6 nights for the IBC show. Upon arriving, my husband was appalled by the standard room they were going to provide us with, and quickly requested an upgrade. The upgrade was not much better. The hotel itself is dated, and all of the rugs seems to be dirty and stained. The rooms are tiny, unless you upgrade at which point they are a little bit larger. The bathrooms were rather lackluster, with plain tiles and not a trace of luxury. The good news was, at least the beds were very comfortable. The breakfast was not bad either. The service at the front desk was sparse to say the least. Any time you needed anything from the front desk you typically had to wait at least 5-10 minutes, as there was only one person, sometimes two available at a time. Another problem was the keycards. Often you would take the elevator up to your room, only to discover your keycard was not working, and then go back down to get it fixed again. This happened several times to us. The location was ideal, close to Dam square, and a short walk from the Central Station. All in all, I am not sure if I would recommend this hotel to others. If you do not mind poor taste in decor and slow service, then you should be fine. Otherwise, run!

Reviews.Title: “Most comfortable beds ever!”
Reviews.Author: Kona09
Reviews.Content: Pros: Walking distance to Central Station Most comfortable beds ever-- beds suck you in Business center Friendly helpful staff Quiet Good price (we booked months in advance so we got internet special rate) Cons: No free wireless in room

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, well presented hotel with excellent reception staff”
Reviews.Author: Railwaytraveller
Reviews.Content: I didn't like Amsterdam but this hotel did make my stay comfortable. The rooms are clean and air conditioned. The TV does have BBC 1 & BBC 2. The reception staff were helpful. The food and bar prices were on the high side but there are plenty of other places to eat in the local vicinity. I travelled by train and this hotel was less than 5 minutes walk from the station and even less to Dam Square.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in a perfect location, couldn't have asked for more!”
Reviews.Author: chris0180
Reviews.Content: Got a great rate at this hotel through booking a flight and hotel package with Expedia quite far in advance - the whole trip worked out at about Â£250 per person, although when we got to the hotel their rates board advertised rooms for Â£300 per night so we definitely got a good deal! The hotel was in a great location - very easy to find, just 5 minutes walk from Central Station. Our rooms were at the back of the hotel and while the view wasn't astounding (people's back yards) it was certainly very quiet and peaceful with no street noise at all. The reception staff were friendly and helpful from the moment we arrived - we'd got there early, and were allowed to leave our luggage at the hotel while we went to wander around the city for a few hours until our rooms were ready so we could check in. Once we got into our rooms we were happy to see that they were spacious, clean and well furnished, with one of the most comfortable beds I have ever slept in - it was like sleeping inside a cloud! As far as the location goes, I already mentioned that the hotel is just a few minutes walk from Central Station. If you take a few minutes to look at a decent street map and work out exactly where you are, there are plenty of short-cuts nearby which get you to one of the main shopping areas and Dam Square in a matter of minutes. There are plenty of cafes and restaurants on the same street as the hotel, as well as a really great bakery ("La Boulangerie") directly across the street. If you should plan on visiting any of the infamous coffee shops while you're in Amsterdam, follow the alley at the side of the bakery and you will see Abraxas on the very next left-hand corner - it's a little out of the way for most tourists so seems to only be used by locals, a really friendly place and their cakes are particularly delicious :-) A top tip for anyone who might be planning to visit Artis Zoo: admission is 18.50, but check out Lovers Cruises (you'll pass their ticket office on the way to the hotel when you leave Central Station) - for 21.50, you can travel to the zoo on a canal boat which takes about 15 minutes, then they will also pick you up and you get a 45 minute canal ride on the way back. So you get an hour boat ride for just 3 Euros! All in all, the hotel and location were superb and everything we hoped it would be. Amsterdam is a truly beautiful city, and one I can't wait to go back to. Hopefully when I do get to go back, I'll be able to find the same good deal to stay at the Convent again!

Reviews.Title: “Near train station and close to main attractions”
Reviews.Author: mpeuro09
Reviews.Content: The room was pretty acceptable in the hotel; comfortable bed, enough room for luggage and space to move around. Being on a main street I was surprised that we could not really the traffic and people on the footpaths which was a great surprise. It took a little while to get the shower head working which as you could imagine was frustrating. Overall the bathroom could be upgraded. The staff were friendly and helpful. Internet provided for free which is always handy. It is a 10 minute walk from the main train station and is walkable distance to all sights and attractions. If you are happy to work out the shower head and need a clean friendly place to base yourself then I would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Really lovely hotel - great!”
Reviews.Author: HoneyBeeScotland
Reviews.Content: Seven of us ranging from 28 to age 82 have just spent three nights in this hotel. We had four rooms among us. Our room 529 was a good size, and the largest of the four rooms, really large comortable bed, air conditioning and was very clean. The staff were friendly and helpful. There is a restaurant for breakfast and light lunches. Breakfast is quoted as 22 euros on line but you could get options for that starting at about 9 euros in the hotel itself. All of my party said they would go back here again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: Indigo_Joe
Reviews.Content: Knew I'd be passing through so booked this on line back in May. Not one to spend a lot of time hanging around the hotel but location wise this is the best you could possibly hope for. Hotel is fine, room very clean with good air con. Staff very friendly and spent time looking for a power adaptor for me on my second day. Book early to get the cheap rate though!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel with great situation”
Reviews.Author: papillion8123
Reviews.Content: Just returned from the summer journey. The hotel is very good. Situation is excelent. Close to the railway station and all the city facilities (shoping, museums, etc). Red light distict is in 15 minutes on foot. Rooms are clean and comfortable. We were lucky to have this hotel for a discount price. So, I can recommend to stay at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent - book it now”
Reviews.Author: EmHBurnley
Reviews.Content: We've been to Amsterdam several time but this was our first stay at The Convent and it will not be our last. The hotel is centrally located with very helpful and friendly staff. The rooms are spotlessly clean and the beds are as amazing as mentioned in previous reviews.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: rarnett
Reviews.Content: Highly recommend. From arrival with Porters, to reception, to housemaids all so courteous and rooms, bedding and pillows most comfortable. Situated between railway station and The Dam Mall, easy walking distance to both with tram stop almost at the door.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: Atreides77
Reviews.Content: If you book through Expedia you get a good deal that is greatly discounted on their advertised rack rate. Has a brilliant location close to the Central Station and to the Dam Square and other Amsterdam attractions. The bed was very plush and comfortable. As the windows in our room were not double glazed we experienced quite a bit of street noise at all times during the day and night. Amenities in the bathroom were very good. Very expensive breakfast and makes much more sense to go to a nearby cafe. Even breakfast on Dam Square is cheaper and more views and opportunity to watch the pedestrians cross the square. Very friendly staff and efficient check in and out.

Reviews.Title: “i love this hotel”
Reviews.Author: kerrymac1976
Reviews.Content: the convent hotel is very good for facilities in the hotel and near by the bed was so comfortable i wanted to take it home if i was to go back to amsterdam i would stay here again

Reviews.Title: “Clean and a great location for city centre - but disappointing rooms”
Reviews.Author: Matthew303
Reviews.Content: I very much agree with the comments by SB01 (5 May 2009). This hotel is extremely convenient for the Central Station and the city centre, but the rooms are rather dingy, with tired, dull furniture (although very clean). The bed was comfortable, although it was two single beds pushed together rather than a proper double. The breakfast buffet is far too expensive. The "Orient Express" themed bar was nothing special. I stayed here with my wife when it was still a Sofitel hotel, she was rather disappointed and expected something a bit more special (as did I). Despite the city centre location, the standard rates for the rooms are unduly high. If you are realistic about what to expect (i.e. it's definitely not a 5 star hotel) and you can get a discounted offer, then it's worth considering. I will look for somewhere else next time.

Reviews.Title: “Get a discount or choose somewhere else”
Reviews.Author: SB01
Reviews.Content: The convent hotel looks good from the outside and is within 5 minutes of both the main station and Dam Square. Inside the welcome is professional but charmless and my room was rather dingy. The rack rate is ca 300 euros but I paid barely a third of this through Expedia. My rate was fair - I would have been pretty unimpressed if I paid the full rack.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for a great location”
Reviews.Author: roscoeroo
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great location as it is a short stroll from the central station, main shopping streets and Anne Frank's house. The room itself was not large but was adequate for two people. It was very clean if a little old fashioned. The staff were pleasant too. I would recommend this hotel and would try to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Spot on for location!”
Reviews.Author: Intellekt
Reviews.Content: My wife and I have previously stayed at this hotel when it was 5-star and part of the Sofitel brand. I have to say that other than change of name, the standards were just as high. The reception staff were very polite and helpful as were the waiting staff in the restaurant. The buffet breakfast is VERY expensive and over-priced at â‚¬22 per head! Even though it's all you can eat, I challenge you to eat â‚¬44 worth for two, first thing in the morning. The set breakfast menus are much better value and I would recommend that option. The rooms are clean and tidy but nothing special (standard business hotel), the fact that they are still trying to charge for Wi-Fi is crazy but this is to be expected from any of the hotels in the Accor group.

Reviews.Title: “Great location!”
Reviews.Author: kittendothroar
Reviews.Content: Just got back on Sunday, hotel is in a really great location for getting around. We walked everywhere and didn't need to take any public transport excluding from Airport. Before leaving I used google maps to print directions to everywhere which helps! Room was clean, though a little dark as our room overlooked alleyway and no main lighting, mainly lamps, one that was not working. Good sized room and bed very comfortable, the duvet was lovely and snuggly! Only minor niggles was bathroom sink was leaking but housekeeping fixed pretty quickly thankfully! Also had to ask for extra toiletries and tea / coffee as they are a bit mean with them - we had 3 teabags, 1 normal and 2 herbal ones. Only 2 sachets creamer, so had to ask for more too if we wanted more than 1 drink per day. Room seemed to be geared up for single occupancy as 1 pair slippers and 1 robe, despite being a double booking for a kingsize room? Staff on reception were very friendly and helpful, happy to help where needed. Didn't eat in hotel as expensive, there is a bakery very near so ate there. Would definately stay here again if returned to Amsterdam

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel - would love to stay again”
Reviews.Author: KathrynW1
Reviews.Content: I recently spent four nights at The Convent with my boyfriend to celebrate my birthday and loved the hotel. The location is excellent. It was a five minute walk from Central Station and another five minutes to Dam Square. We walked to many of the main tourist attractions (Anne Frank House, flower market, Amsterdam Historical Museum, RedLight District, Rijksmuseum etc) very easily from the hotel. You can also take a hop on hop off canal boat from outside Cental Station to get around. The hotel staff were very polite and efficient and the room large, comfortable and very clean. The bed was huge and extremley nice. We didn't try the breakfast as it did seem quite expensive (22 Euros for the buffet, about 12 Euros for the other options) but there are cafes nearby to eat at. We did eat in the restaurant one night and also had coffee and cake one afternoon at the hotel. Both were very nice. We got a very good deal on expedia.co.uk for this hotel and the price was very reasonable. I would certainly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good place in an expensive city - don't pay the standard rates though”
Reviews.Author: Mattinbrum
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located minutes from Central Station, right by the Red Light District. If breakfast isn't part of your deal, there are a few decent places to eat nearby, but take tram no 5 for the best places to eat. The reception area and reception received were average and the hotel does have a nice bar, but don't be fooled by the "leisure club", it's a tiny room you have to book for one or two people at a time! Our standard room was a good size, very clean and had everything we needed, the only criticisms being the beds were rather soft for us and one tea bag is ridiculuous for two English travellers :) Oh and the hot water was....er very warm water. Charging for the Internet is mean - when are hotels going to offer this service free to guests? We got a great rate through KLM and the room was little more than Â£30 a night, which is cheaper than some hostels. The rates quoted at reception are way off the mark. This is a very good. above standard hotel, but not a luxury night's sleep. Restaurant reccommendation: The Wok to Walk takeaways are good value and tasty - choose your ingredients and watch them cooked for you...

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, brilliant location!”
Reviews.Author: RyanWestSussex
Reviews.Content: A fantastic hotel, right in the centre of Amsterdam, easy walking distance of all the sights! It was only a ten minute walk from Amsterdam Centraal Station and the staff were extremely helpful and spoke fantastic English. The rooms were very clean and comfortable with lovely soft beds and we had a street view which was excellent. We stayed 3 nights and for us the 5% city tax came to just over 9 euros which was really good! I would definately recommend this hotel and would go back again!!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, good value”
Reviews.Author: bb1976
Reviews.Content: The Sofitel has a brilliant location on a main road which runs parallel to the Damrak and the main shopping street. It was clean, and very comfortable, but not high luxury. The staff were helpful and friendly, and we were particularly pleased when they let us into our room at 10.00 in the morning, after our early morning flight. The Sofitel is a great base for a city break.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Service, Convenient Location”
Reviews.Author: rcsprs
Reviews.Content: The hotel has a very friendly team who provided us with good information about the location and services around the city. The hotel is very well located near to the Centraal Station and the bus stop. The room and the bed are very confortable for winter time. This is not a very luxurous hotel and now became a Convent Hotel (downgrade from Sofitel title). Overall, I strongly recommend the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: MrandMrsDEE
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our stay in room 315, the hotel is very warm and comfortable (important for a winter-time visit to Amsterdam!) The bed really was like a giant marshmallow and we slept very well in it. The hotel staff were pleasant and helpful. The room was a good size for a city hotel room, and although we got a view of a small side street, we did not want for light. The sink in the room was a little worn, as shown in other people's photographs, but this was really a nitpick. We would like to come back here to stay again, but in the summer. NB: during our stay the hotel changed name to mHotel - The Convent, a downside of the new signage is that the hotel is not as visible from down the street because they removed the vertical Sofitel sign

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant hotel, all you could ask for”
Reviews.Author: matt303939
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located in a very convenient place, 5 mins walk from the central station and 2 mins from Dam Sq. The hotel staff are very friendly and helpful. The rooms are generous sizes and the beds are really comfortable. You get free evain water, lovely toiletries and slippers and dressing gowns, everything to make your stay even more satisfying. The only downer for me was it was really noisy outside the hotel room, at 6 in the morning the delivery trucks would start arriving, became very tedious. Apart from that its great, it has a nice restaurant, a gym, library, masseuse. Would definately stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Accor needs to rename it "MERCURE"”
Reviews.Author: AZjetboy
Reviews.Content: This SOFITEL is very central. Less than 10 minutes walking from the Central Train Station and 5 minutes from Dam Square and all the other attractions in Amsterdam. Staff is very nice, friendly and helpful. The rooms are clean, but are not luxury appointed like SOFITEL spoiled me before in other hotels. You get everything you need in the room, included tea/coffee maker but the enviroment and decor is absolutely NOT a SOFITEL ambiance and the all property looks a little old fashion. I think that ACCOR HOTELS should downgrade this hotel and place it in the Mercure properties because it can't compete with a Luxury Hotel the way it should and in the way SOFITEL is known to be.

Reviews.Title: “Good Stay in a Sea of Chaos”
Reviews.Author: HelmutSchnitzel
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for New Years 2008. The location is right in Dam Square and this is pretty much a standard business hotel. I usually prefer staying in a small local hotel with a little more personality but we booked late and this was really all we could find. Everyone was really nice and the room was quiet and comfortable. If you are looking for a good generic hotel right in the center of the city this is the place. If you want the local experience though, you might want to look else where.

Reviews.Title: “Rundown and Disappointing!”
Reviews.Author: lemmondd
Reviews.Content: The Sofitel was chosen for the group I travelled with for the Amsterdam Marathon. I would not have personally chosen this hotel, that said we did spend three nights in a very dark (even with every light turned on) and very small guest room which looked onto the very small alley way on the side of the Hotel. The decor throughout the property is well past its prime and needs replacement. The carpet in the guest rooms is well beyond that level and can no longer be made to appear clean. The "marshmallow bed" referred to in another posting here...is a veiled way of making a lumpy old mattress seem to have some new life. The feather bed and comforter were nice, but the bed itself was not! The bathroom included cracked tiles along the wall near the floor and just seemed worn (not dirty...just worn). The guest room was directly across from the elevators, which caused me some concern, but did not prove to be a significant problem. The staff at the front desk were young and very helpful with the exception of Rene, who appeared to be a manager/supervisor for the Hotel. When inquiring about internet access both by phone and at the desk he appeared to be miffed that at other locations in the world it is not uncommon for it to be easily accessed or complimentary. Rene clarified that "This is not America." to us as we inquired about hotspots in the neighborhood, and that "there is a charge for everything in The Netherlands." His tone and demeanor put us off from any further interactions with the staff at the Hotel, making us feel very unwelcome and unappreciated as guests in his Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Really good stay at the Sofitel”
Reviews.Author: MC-7
Reviews.Content: We chose the Sofitel Amsterdam after reading various reviews and finding that it was conveniently located to the train station. Unfortunately, British Airways lost our luggage on our way from Heathrow, so our mood upon arrival was less than pleasant. Luckily though, we didn't have our luggage while we walked from the station to the Sofitel. We didn't have the best directions to find it and wound up taking the wrong turn at a junction so after about 25 minutes of walking in the wrong direction, we came across the Sofitel. Upon arrival, we came across two very friendly and very helpful staff who helped us check in with ease. When we informed them that we didn't have any luggage, they took all of the details and continued to contact the agent regarding the whereabouts of our belongings (apparently this happens to at least 15 of their guests per week with BA, so if you have a connecting flight on your way to Amsterdam, don't be surprised if your bags don't make it). The room was a very good size, with a comfortable bed and clean bathroom. We spent more time in the room than we'd expected, waiting for our bags to arrive, and it was very comfortable. We ate in the restaurant/bar which was very nice and also had room service (without a change of clothes we were reluctant to go out too much) which was lovely - they had a fantastic pasta which is highly recommended. The location was great, quite close to the shopping area (and not too far from the red light district). Amsterdam was a lovely city and we were really surprised at how much we liked it. The Sofitel was a perfect choice and was great value for money. Would definitely recommend a stay at the Sofitel Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Deluxe accomodations in the heart of Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: MrFlexible
Reviews.Content: Besides the good price and great location my wife and I stayed here for the "famed" marshmallow bed. We were not disappointed... We stayed for two nights as the relaxing end to our tour through London and Paris. We came in on the train from Paris and the hotel is a short walk from Central Station. It is also a street or two over (and they're tiny streets) from the Damrak and tons of shopping, dining, and just about everything else in Amsterdam. When we checked in, workers were redoing the road outside. The front desk advised that our room would be in the front overlooking the street. I asked if they had anything else due to the construction, but they assured me that we would not be able to hear it through the double windows and that the room was very nice. They were quite polite and exactly right! (they even sent up a fruit basket later just to make sure we were comfortable) The room was practically a suite with high ceilings and large windows overlooking the street outside. The bed was king and was the promised comfort of marshmallow goodness. The shower had a tropical rain spout directly overhead that was like showering in a hot waterfall. The bathroom kit included very nice French soaps, lotions, and shampoos. Maybe we enjoyed it extra much after our smaller rooms in London and Paris, but we loved the Sofitel and would definitely stay there again--make it a tradition even because of that magical bed! :)

Reviews.Title: “Soft spot for Sofitel”
Reviews.Author: DeanoNorthPerth
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for a couple of nights after a river cruise up from Budapest. We were very impressed. I had booked via the Sofitel website and found a "Book 3 nights and get a night free" type package which included a picnic basket on one of the days. Well, the picnic basket lasted us for 3 meals! It was huge. We had to clear out the mini-bar to store the leftovers. And the food was lovely. We had to leave the ship in the morning but the Sofitel was able to accommodate us with an early check in. The room was excellent and the location the same. I could not fault the staff in any way. All were very helpful. I recommend this hotel very highly.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location...Great Bed!”
Reviews.Author: travelhappy77
Reviews.Content: First off I Pricelined this hotel and was very happy with the price and location so my expectations were not as high as if I paid full price. I love Amsterdam and this was not my first trip. The location was perfect. A train outside and walking distance to most everything. The side of the Dam it is on is serene. It is like you are in the middle of it all but in a lovely quiet spot. The room we had was big with a view of the street that had great morning people watching. The front desk was pleasant. The restaurant/bar was overpriced and small but with restaurants and bars everywhere you look I wouldn't bother with the hotel bar. The bed was amazing! The room was clean. The bathroom was big. If I saw this for a good deal I would book it again in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, great bed, horrible view”
Reviews.Author: ericalee
Reviews.Content: We spent four nights staying at the Sofitel in Amsterdam at the tail end of a two week trip in Europe - overall, we felt pretty neutral about this hotel, there was some pros/cons, but overall this was our least favorite hotel of our trip.... In terms of the room itself, it was pretty big and clean. The hotel is very traditional in terms of decor so anyone looking for something modern, look elsewhere. Bed was heavenly as others have mentioned -- nice, big, and fluffy. Bathroom was decent sized as well and nicely stocked. There was a mini-bar with a fridge (but would have preferred to have our own fridge to use to stock beverages and snacks.) One of the worst parts of the hotel was our view or lack thereof. We basically stared at a nasty alleyway whenever our window was open - I don't know if there are better views in this hotel and how to get them, but if you can figure out a way to do it, ask. It would have been nice to have a more comfortable homebase in terms of staying in the room - basically we only were there to sleep and take a shower because the view was so dismal. As far as location, it's situated nicely in the city centre with good tram access. It's also in walking distance to the train station. We walked pretty much everywhere from our hotel including the red light district, west and south canal belts, and the old south section with the van gogh and rijksmuseum (tram might be better for getting to the old south though, we were optimistic on our walk!) Breakfast was not included and expensive (22 euros/person). This hotel definitely had a vibe for older folks, so if you are younger, might want to look elsewhere (we are late twenties/early 30s and felt like the youngest people there.)

Reviews.Title: “Impolite stuff”
Reviews.Author: vegu
Reviews.Content: Me and my husband have checked out around 10 a.m. and requested our bags to be picked up and kept in concierge till 2 pm so we can pick them up on the way to the airport. Around 12:30 I wanted to transfer our shopping bags to our luggages and then unfortunately everything has started to turn bitter. Ms. Eva at the reception asked for a receipt. I told her that she didin't give me one. She said that she gave it to my husband. I said "ok, I am not getting my bags I just want to put the last minutes shopping bags". She took me to the luggage room but our bags weren"t there. I said maybe they are still in the room. The answer was "How am I suppose to know that I need to bring your suitcases here if you don't tell me?" I said "We told you that". She was insisting that we didn't told here. Anyway she started to be realy rude and I was very uncomfortable to hear impolite and unpleasant words from her. Than she told me â€˜â€™do you know how many people I am serving everyday how do you expect from me to remember all of them â€™â€™ at this point I was even surprised more to see the customer relation skills of the staff. I am telling you it turned literally ugly finally she told me to shut my mouth. At that point I was so upset that I started to cry than Mr. Jonathan P. KOK came and has been witnessed some part of this incident and tried to calm me. I went there for a holiday and this person ruined my day. I do not see any point that they may talk to me in that manner no need to mention the insulting part. I don't have an intention to go to any other Sofitel Hotel on my other trips.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Beds!!”
Reviews.Author: PriscillaDublin
Reviews.Content: The hotel location was great, within walking distances of all the sights. The beds were the best I have ever slept in! The rooms were clean and the staff helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Will stay here again next trip to Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: Awaythelads
Reviews.Content: Met all my criteria for a weekend stay in Amsterdam with my friend (2 single beds): * Excellent location, 5 mins walk from Central Station and even closer to Dam Square. * Comfortable beds, adequate (not large) sized room * Extremely friendly and helpful staff * Free drink at the bar and 4pm checkout (I'm a member of the Sofitel scheme) * Reasonable price for Amsterdam (though not cheap compared with other cities). * Relaxing stay

Reviews.Title: “If you pay their advertised rate you could ask for more”
Reviews.Author: A swedish family
Reviews.Content: We stayed a couple of nights in the begining of June. We were put on the first floor overlooking the street outside. The noice from the street did not disturb us too much. We booked it trough internet and got a much better price than advertised in the reception. The room was clean and had a very nice bed for our son, not the extra "kids do not care" type of bed. One of the other beds was slightly leaning so you felt as tipping out of the bed. There was something special about the floor in this room as it felt like uneven concrete under the wall to wall carpet thus makeing the bed lean. The room had nice area to sit and plan your day. Fridge could be used for your own stuff after unpacking the well stocked minibar. They had a kettle with coffee and teabags to use during the day. Bathroom had a tub and plenty of hot water. The sink showed a lot of wear and should be changed as soon as possible as it looked dirty. Along the silicon line there was mould and a wall tile was cracked. Lots of shampoo and all the little funny bottles of conditioner and shower soap. Staff was very nice and polite. They offer free apples at reception. The location is very good for walking around to see the different sights. It is an easy walk to the hotel from the central train station where you end up when taking the train to the city from the airport. For kids its god to know that the down side of the red light district is not visible around the hotel. You will find cafÃ©s selling drugs but this is Amsterdam. If you take left when leaving the hotel and go straight down the street you will find a large store where you can buy food, drinks and snacks. It is the one almost opposit the church. In front of the store some large stairs and a big blue sign with the name of the chain. When taking left as you exit and walk towards the station you will pass the bike rental firm Yellow in just a minute or two. Do hire bikes and see the canals, we did and had some fantastic two hours going around in the bike friendly city. Amsterdam is an expensive hotel town that I know, but I would have been very disappointed of the room and its faults - leaning bed - the sink that should be changed - the mould spots - cracked tile - the strange feeling of rough concrete under the carpet if paying the full rate. Our price was not cheap but we felt the stay was above average so at the end of the day we say go for it if you get a fair price.

Reviews.Title: “Just OK”
Reviews.Author: doobieref
Reviews.Content: I expected more from this hotel. I did not think the beds were all that special. The staff was stiff and some were in training and did not know what they were doing. Breakfast was 22 Euros, which I thought was a lot. In this hotel expect to pay for every service. I wish we would have stayed at the first hotel we were at until our trip on the Riverboat. Probably would not stay there again, but it was not bad.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel / Great Staff / Horrible decor”
Reviews.Author: Moxsd
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a very good location, almost great. The hotel lobby is nice with a very friendy staff. The lobby features a nice bar, sitting area etc, comprabale to 3.5 star hotels. The room and hallways however are out of a U.S horror movie. I expected a demon or jack from the shinning to pop his head through the door. The decor is VERY BAD, I mean its really really just odd. That being said the bed is GREAT, odd enough we had 3 singles for two people, dont ask me why. The location was very good and very easy to find. You just take the schipol train to amsterdamn central. After reaching central you exit the main exit and head to your right (if facing away from station) and straight ahead. The street youre now on stick to your left and youll arrive, left hand side. Dont bother asking information for help at the train station she honestly had no idea where she was. I gave up asked a cop and was on my way safe and sound. For the price and location + the helpful and professional staff its a great stay,

Reviews.Title: “The most friendly & helpful staff we have encountered bar none.”
Reviews.Author: oliverlewis
Reviews.Content: Without doubt the most friendly & professional staff we have found worldwide - nothing was too much trouble & the advice they gave was excellent and always with a smile. The room was spotless, the bed enormous & most comfortable but it did make the room seem small by comparison ! Presumably the price reflects the cost of hotels in Amsterdam but even with our booking well in advance & getting nearly 40% off the rack rate it was still expensive for a room only rate. We didn't avail ourselves of the hotel's breakfast at the extortionate rate of 22 Euros p.p. as there were many eateries offering breakfast at much more realistic prices within a minute of the hotel ( and we could sit outside & enjoy the sunshine ! ). It's typical of a 4star chain hotel - there are no nasty surprises & it's hard to beat for location. One tip ( from the hotel staff ) - if travelling to the airport catch the tram to Central Station , one stop from just outside the hotel & catch the airport train that runs every 15 mins. The fare is 3.60 p.p. as opposed to 45Euros for a taxi & the train stops in the main airport concourse.

Reviews.Title: “What a bed!”
Reviews.Author: hamaudit
Reviews.Content: Good clean hote with good service. I selected this hotel purely on price and have to say that overall I was impressed - in particular with the bed! Recommended

Reviews.Title: “Pretty solid and not too expensive”
Reviews.Author: drunkenmaster42
Reviews.Content: Like most cities, staying in the centre of Amsterdam is expensive - if you want a decent hotel. The Sofitel is not too bad for price and is certainly decent. Would stop there again in a heartbeat!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel - clean, quiet, soft bed and helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: res1902
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Sofitel Amsterdam for 2 nights for a weekend at the end of February. We found a special rate on the Sofitel website which made it very affordable. The location of the hotel was ideal. Very close to Centraal Station (less than a 5 minute walk) and steps from the De Kolk tram stop. The room was a standard size for a European hotel room and the bed was very comfortable. The front desk clerk was extremely helpful in advising us about the different areas of Amsterdam and providing great restaurant recommendations. I would definitely stay at the Sofitel Amsterdam again.

Reviews.Title: “A little disappointing after Brussels”
Reviews.Author: Wiener SÃ¤nger
Reviews.Content: This is a decent hotel, but we were spoiled completely after our experience at the Sofitel Brussels Europe. This is walking distance from the Centraal station, just follow your nose straight down the bridge, and the hotel is on your left. There was a bottle on the table, and after our experience with a few 3-star hotels, and of course at the Brussels one, we drank it. It was part of the mini-bar and we were charged for it. The staff are friendly enough, but were nowhere as efficient or as polished as those in Brussels. The water is one of the cleanest in Europe, so you can drink from the tap safely. Our request for a high floor room and non-smoking were both not met, and we were in a small room with a tiny bathroom, not quite what we expected at a Sofitel. The exterior of the hotel and the lobby were a big disappointment - perhaps the Sofitel Grand is the one that the usual business traveller stays at.

Reviews.Title: “Above Average Hotel: Average Sofitel”
Reviews.Author: Traveller73London
Reviews.Content: Booked the Sofitel Amsterdam for four nights through the Sofitel website. When we first arrived at the hotel my partner's comment was 'hmmm it doesn't look like a Sofitel'. Herein lies the only problem I have with this hotel. The location is good within easy walking distance of the central station and Dam Square and a short walk to the most beautiful parts of the city around the Singel canal. In addition the hotel is located opposite the tram stop so easy access to the museums too. Generally the hotel is in a pleasant enough location to avoid the seedier side of Amsterdam and close enough to major attractions. Our room was spacious, clean and had three big windows looking out onto the main street but was suitably sound proofed. A comfortable night's sleep was ensured by the very comfortable bed. The styling of the room, however, is somewhat dated with mahogany furniture and brass lamps and the bathrooms look rather tired. Generally the rooms do not exude the French flair and luxury that is such an important component of the Sofitel brand. There is no turndown service in the evening and only one bathrobe and slippers for two people. In summary, the hotel is perfectly comfortable, enjoys excellent service, good food and is 'pleasantly' appointed and I would recommend it. However for the price charged I would expect just a dash more 'luxury'.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location And Very Comfy Beds!!”
Reviews.Author: parny
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Sofitel Amsterdam for two nights in March 08. The hotel is very well located about five minutes walk from the train station and close to Dam Square. There are some good cafes and restaurants close by and some very good "Coffee shops". Trams stop outside the hotel and go direct to the Van gough museum and other sights. The hotel is very clean and has friendly staff and a cosy bar thatâ€™s not too pricey. can't comment on breakfast other than its 22 Euros each, but there is a good place opposite the hotel that will get you a nice breakfast for half the cost of the hotel. The rooms are fine, nothing special, but the beds are so comfortable, one of the most comfy beds Iâ€™ve ever slept in!!!! All in all, a great hotel, and I would definitely stay here again when back in Amsterdam. Enjoy!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: knycty
Reviews.Content: I recently returned from my first trip to Europe and I stayed 3 nights at the Sofitel Amsterdam to begin my trip. Room: was very clean, modern and well-appointed. Bed was unbelievable comfortable. Yes, my single room was small by American Standards but more than good for a single traveler. My only complaint is the shower got warm, but not hot. Stayed on the 3rd floor and had no problems with street noise. Staff: front desk staff were very friendly, attentive and spoke English very well. Housekeeping came early AM, but respected the Do Not Disturb sign. Location: Sofitel is walking distance from Centraal Station, Dam Square, the Red Light District, and many shops and restaurants. It is a short Tram, Bus, or Canal Boat ride to the Rijksmuseum, Van Gogh Museum, Anne Frank House, and much more. I had an excellent meal at the Cafe Habsburg just a few blocks west. Breakfast: was sooo good! Great selection: eggs, meat, cereal, pastry, fruit, waffles, pancakes, all very fresh and the service was excellent. Disclaimer: breakkfast was included in my room rate. Overall I highly recommend this hotel without hesitation and would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible hotel!!!”
Reviews.Author: rnaman
Reviews.Content: I have just left the Sofitel Amsterdam and, although being an experienced traveler, I can assure that it was one of my worst hotel experiences ever. I booked my stay for 4 nights through RAI, a Dutch travel agency that was organizing the congress I was attending. The Sofitel simply didn't honor the rate that was in my voucher, charging me more. When I showed them my voucher, they simply said that I would have to complain with the travel agency that gave me the wrong rate. Absurd!! The room was extremely small, noisy and dirty. Besides that, a horrible decor (just tak a look at the candid photos) and crampy service. All that for 200 euros + tax a night w/o breakfast. What else can I say? They charge only 22 euros per day for internet connection. Take my advice: if you are going to Amsterdam, skip the Sofitel.

Reviews.Title: “A very nice Amsterdam Hotel”
Reviews.Author: PortlandBob
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Sofitel for 5 nights (3/23 - 3/28). I thought it was a very nice experience. The rooms were average size by european standards and very clean, nice clean compact bathrooms, the beds were very comfortable and the staff was friendly. Amenities included robe & slippers, instant coffee & tea along with a minibar that you could also store some items in to keep them cool. Of course it is smoky in the lobby but that is most places in Europe and especially Amsterdam. The room however did not smell of smoke. A solid 3 1/2 star hotel. The location is great, easy to get to everything yet not on a street crowded with tourists. Our only complaint was that the AC hadn't been turned on and even with turning off the heat, our room was rather warm but opening the window made for a loud night for sleeping. We paid 140 Euros/night which I felt was a resonable price. It is not on a particularly picturesque street but the canals and Jordaan is less than a 5 minute walk as is Dam square. We will stay here again next year. The breakfast was expensive for our taste at 22 Euro/person. There is a great Seattle style coffee shop at the end of the block (turn right out of the hotel) for coffee and pasteries, the owner Frank is a great guy. Also, along with another reviewer, I would highly recommend Humphrey's Restaurant (also one block to the right out of the hotel at Nieuwezijds Kolk). 21.50 Euro prix fixe for a great 3 course dinner (the best we had in Amsterdam).

Reviews.Title: “Miexd views”
Reviews.Author: Ian_Stanworth
Reviews.Content: Mixed views on this place. Postives -friendly helpful staff - clean comfortable rooms with good facilities - well located Negatives - communal areas stink of smoke. This is an Amsterdam problem not just this hotel - whilst decor is tidy and in good condition it needs updating - previous reviews note very soft beds, pillows, etc. These were too soft making sleeping sweaty and uncomfortable. In general it was OK but will not be going back to Amsterdam because of the constant assault on my nose and lungs by cigarette smoke. I have never seen so many people smoking. Too long here will damage your health even if you don't smoke

Reviews.Title: “A tale of 2 rooms...”
Reviews.Author: MrCBedfordshire
Reviews.Content: Stayed here on a Saturday and Sunday night - 2 adults and 1 child. Checking in and out was hassle free, with friendly reception staff. Our daughter was given a small backpack with some drawing stuff, which was a nice touch to start the weekend at the hotel. The foyer and public areas were clean and well presented. The lifts to the rooms could only be accessed using your room keycard. We were allocated room 118, which was a triple room with a king size and a single bed - both very comfortable. The bathroom was clean and functional with a good selection of toiletries and towels. Robes and slippers were available. The decor was OK. There was no in-room safe, so we had to use the safe deposit boxes held at reception - no hassle whatsoever. Room 118 looks out on to a small alleyway - directly opposite a bar and hostel - perhaps 15ft away if that. The bad news for us was that this bar stayed open all night and we could hear the thumping bass from the sound system. People were constantly coming and going - one on a motorbike, which was revving-up directly under our window at 2.00am. The music was still booming at 8.00am! We werent awake all night, but did not get a restful sleep. From reading previous reviews, we were aware that there were some noise issues, which prompted me to email the hotel and request a quiet room. In the morning, my wife went down to reception and explained the situation. The front desk staff were very apologetic and said they would arrange for us to be moved. We went out for the day and when we came back, we picked up the keys to room 123, which turned out to be what I presume was a junior suite, with a large sitting area containing 2 armchairs and a sofa, which converted to a bed. A kingsize bed was around the corner. The bathroom had 2 doors - one to the lounge area and one to the bed area. There was no difference to the amenities, with the exception of an in-room safe being available. We were presented with a gift tray of chocolate and a tin of Dutch biscuits, which again was a nice touch. It was a corner room and was surrounded on all sides by private residential properties. We had a very restful second night. We did not take the hotel's breakfast or use the bar, so cannot comment on that. However, we were impressed with the staff and the customer service and would use this hotel again, given a room in the right location.

Reviews.Title: “That was a great stay”
Reviews.Author: Mattellone
Reviews.Content: The hotel is situated right in the centre of the city, e.g. some steps from Damrak - the main street of Amsterdam. The Old King's Palace at Dam Square, as well as Amsterdam Centraal railway station and Mme Tussaud Museum are of a few minutes short walk from the hotel. We made the reservation through Sofitel Reservation Services getting a â‚¬ 149 offer per night for 2 adults and 2 children. A â‚¬ 7.03 city tax (per night) was added to our bill upon checkout. When checking-in I was impressed by seeing a great Queen's portrait behind the receptionist; the next day I was even luckier to see Her Majesty the Queen right one meter from myself! The room was great, though we noticed poor general lighting. The beds were excellent and I could hardly imagine whether there might have been a bed better than the one I slept in in Sofitel Amsterdam. The bathroom and shower were allright, too. We were absolutely happy that we had chosen this hotel for our short stay in the Netherlands and I can proudly recommend the hotel to my best friend.

Reviews.Title: “great place”
Reviews.Author: wilhelmina
Reviews.Content: i want that bed at home!!!!great comfortable bed our room was spacious and clean.location was fantastic and near a febo to !!!the breakfast was great as were all the staff we encountered.if the price is right would stay here again

Reviews.Title: “Central Located for Amsterdam Sights”
Reviews.Author: bluecity25
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 2 nights visiting a friend in Amsterdam, overall a good standard 4 star hotel with feather beds and a cosy (smallish) room with plenty of facilities. As it is situated on a busy road - trams, bikes and cars - I would advise asking for a quiet room at the back of the hotel - 501 was great romantic room and of course if you require a non- smoking you must request. Non-smoking is only in the breakfast room and some guest rooms (22 Euros each for breakfast was expensive we thought, so popped round the corner to a great non-smoking coffee opposite the church and directly opposite the tulip hotel. Room - clean, tv, writing desk, minibar, robe, slippers, large bathroom with good shower and toiletries, kettle with tea/coffee etc plus free bottle of water on arrival,24 hr room service. Iron and board on request and anything else you may have needed! 5-10 mins walk from train station, we only had one case so was fairly easy, they did offer us to store luggage once you check out and want to sight see. Staff - friendly and very helpful. 5 mins to Dam Square and Amsterdam overall was easy to walk around, most shops don't open until 11-12 so it seems quiet in the back streets! In De Waag - Neuwemarket - Fab restaurant - ate there 2 nights - fairly pricey but very worth it, red meat, vegetarian and yummy deserts. Great atmosphere, if you want a romantic meal best asking for one of their quiet corners at the end of the restaurant it also caters for large parties and is worth booking in advance. Trams, cars and bikes makes crossing the roads a bit of a challenge so keep you eyes peeled, few near misses!!!! Cold and wet in January so unless you have to I'd wait for the spring, bit like most european places!!! Enjoy

Reviews.Title: “Good central location, but not 5 star”
Reviews.Author: The Wright Family
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a good, central location. Close to Centraal Station and all sights especially Dam Square which is only a few minutes walk up the road. The room was very cramped with a double bed and single bed and awfully dark. No overhead lights only lamps. The room dÃ©cor is very outdated. The beds are not up to Sofitel standards. The staff were helpful. Electric kettle was supplied to room, when requested. The hot buffet breakfast was very enjoyable and charged to your room account. Donâ€™t expect a 5 star hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Best Shower and Bed!!”
Reviews.Author: SKHigs
Reviews.Content: It may seem ridiculous, but the shower in this hotel is the first thing to come to mind about our stay at the Sofitel in Amsterdam. Imagine a huge double space with 5 (FIVE!!!) shower heads, steaming hot water and great products to use. I was in heaven and stayed in there for over half an hour (wrong I know, but couldn't resist). The bed was SO comfortable, huge puffy white cover and so soft. After a few weeks of travelling through Europe and the UK, it was a pleasant change!! The decor of the room was reasonably modern and the room was a good size. We had an Executive Suite (upgraded for free) but our friend who had a standard room was just as happy. (we had a look, not much different to ours) The Sofitel is in a great location .... it taks about 4-5 mins to walk to the main train station and into a great little shopping strip with a million restaurants and shops near the Palace. The Red Light District is only 5-10 mins walk also - what a place hey! Our biggest laugh was the "added extra" we got in our Executive Suite ... as we struggled to open the door of the fridge, a very graphic mens magazine came flying out to greet us. Perhaps this is always the case when you visit Amsterdam?? Nonetheless, it was a good laugh and something to be aware of if you are in the Executive rooms!! If you are planning on getting on the hop-on-hop-off canal boats, BEWARE!! We waited for an HOUR in the freezing cold for a canal boat that never came at a small stop near the floating flower markets. It was a good way to see the city but you might be better just not hopping off because you may not ever get back on!!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: Biogeog
Reviews.Content: We just spent three nights with our two small children at this very nice hotel. It was wonderfully located to the historic sections of Amsterdam. The staff were extremely nice and were very helpful. The rooms were a tad small, but nicely appointed. The street and alleyway noise was noticeable, but I doubt you can get around that if you are staying in central Amsterdam. There are two tram stops out front, so access to the station and rest of the city is very easy. It was a somewhat less crazy part of town then elsewhere, particularly in the evening, so there were not too many obnoxious revelers in the area. There is a large supermarket just down the road and many restaurants in the vicinity. Internet access is fairly expensive (you must buy an hour or day access).

Reviews.Title: “NYE in Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: kooksy
Reviews.Content: Went to Amsterdam for NYE and thought this hotel was great. Good location (5 mins from Dam Square) and near train station too. Will stay here again. Not a new hotel though. If your looking for up-to-date then dont stay here. Old style decor etc.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location... Wonderful Staff”
Reviews.Author: ready4nexttrip
Reviews.Content: We have recently stayed at Sofitels in Asia and N. America so I'm confident with this chain. They do have the most comfy hotel beds, after its convenient location, that was my #2 factor for choosing this hotel. We traveled by train from AMS airport and we departed also via the train station to Belgium. This hotel is about a 10 minute walk from the train station; less without the luggage! It's in a safe/clean neighborhood, tram line is right in front of the hotel, and less than 5 mins walk to the DAM. There is a large supermarket in close proximity also. We didn't have breakfast at the hotel, 22 euros per person sounds like a lot for breakfast food. Hotels has a basket of apples, tangerines at the counter which is a nice little treat on your way in/out of the hotel. If you don't have your lab top, you can get an internet card and use their business center. 10 euros for 45 mins and about 13 euros for 90 mins; we got the 90 mins and we were able to use this same internet access card at the Marriott in Brussels (i-Bahn). We got our rooms on the 1st floor adjacent to an alley; you can hear people talk when they walk by! I suggest asking for a room on a higher floor. Rooms are much smaller than expected but maybe considered large Amsterdam stardard. Extra information/tips not directly relevant to the hotel..... We were there during Dec. 25-28 (all the small businesses were closed).... didn't noticed until the very last day that there is an internet place a few doors over (north of the hotel, same side). We had a dinner meal at this Holland restaurant just a few doors south of the hotel, same side.... we didn't like it. Service was good but I suggest look elsewhere for food near the hotel. We had dinner at this seafood restaurant called Lucius (about 15 mins walk)... it was superb (if you like seafood)! You can easily find info on this restaurant online.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value for money”
Reviews.Author: nikostsepetis
Reviews.Content: I will try to be brief: I am a hotel owner, very peculiar in taste with hotels, normally stay in boutique hotels, difficult with sleep and difficult to be pleased in general. We booked this hotel via an agency as i was travelling with a friend who was on a budget and i didnt want to bother looking around and i was initially sceptical about he choice (could i have chosen i would propably opt for something like Dylan or Arena hotel). I dont know the exact rate but i think it should be around 120-140 euros for a twin with breakfast. For this price level (we were there in xmass which is apparently a,low season to them) this was a very good choice. Convenient location, near but not on the sleezy red lights and very near the 3 beautiful canals (dont remember the names). We got a 5th floor room and it was biggy and confortable with pleasant street views, nice bed, clean and mora than aynything quiet (no noice from neighboring rooms). We were treated in a prof way albeit impersonal (which was still ok). Few negatives which didnt spoil my good feeling: Boring breakfast in an unatractive room (why couldnt they have a more interesting and richer range of cheeses?), dated and more like a 3* bathroom (but not small). Overall if you can get a good rate and a top floor room and if you dont mind this kind of impersonal feeling this is a good pick. To end, Amsterdam is a very pretty city, perfect for a city break (boring for more than 3 nights), with expeptionally polite people and a very bohemian-youngish charm!!

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Sofitel”
Reviews.Author: Nanka19
Reviews.Content: Very comfortable, clean hotel. The bed was the most comfortable ever slept in a hotel. The staff was great. We arrived very early, 9am, they had a room ready for us with a nice city view. Would stay again!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel!”
Reviews.Author: sitemaid
Reviews.Content: This hotel is wonderfully located steps from shopping and entertainment. The trolley stops almost in front of the hotel and it's a short ride to museums. Comfortable bed, nice room, super security and gracious and competent staff.

Reviews.Title: “Even Better 2nd Time Around”
Reviews.Author: Helking
Reviews.Content: This was our second visit to this hotel, and again everything was excellent. The room was a good size for a European hotel, it was a standard room however I did notice that some of the other rooms on the backside of the hotel looked significantly smaller, so if room size is important to you I would suggest asking for one at the front of the hotel. The staff were all very courteous and friendly. Housekeeping was excellent although last time we stayed the tea and coffee was replenished in large quantities but not this time. It was however possible to request a very large pot of tea or coffee from room service for five Euros which compared to the prices of bars, cafes and restaurants in the area is excellent. Again the best bit was the bed!!!! I arranged the hotel for 5 couples and was very pleased that they also were all very happy with the accommodation and service here, thoroughly recommended!!

Reviews.Title: “PRIVATE AND COMFORTABLE”
Reviews.Author: FranklinsFresno
Reviews.Content: WOW-They gave us a wonderful executive suite and it was very quiet. It was a 10 minute walk from the train station. This particular hotel does not offer lotion, so bring your own and they also run out of face towels. Housekeeping is not that great, we had to go behind them to clean things off. It's an older building and the ceilings in the room are low, so I wouldn't suggest anyone over 6 feet to stay in the executive suite and it also does not offer a bathtub but a huge shower. But this hotel is centrally located to everything and I would stay there again. I would also not suggest using there internet from the room, it may not connect , but they do have a business office on the first floor. Jose the Concerige was very nice and accomodating and made our stay very nice.

Reviews.Title: “Nearly excellent hotel in Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: Adam R
Reviews.Content: I had a lovely three day stay at this hotel in Amsterdam which was within a 5-7 minute walk from Centraal Station and right in the heart of central Amsterdam, without being in an overly crowded area. The room was excellent to outstanding, the staff were most helpful and amenities were top quality. I found the internet access (at 20 Euros per day) to be exorbitant, as were many other hotel offers (breakfast was also particularly expensive), and although the room was of european size, it was completely comfortable and modern. The rest of the hotel (hallways, foyer, etc.) could do with an update, but it was definitely clean and welcoming. I'd highly recommend this location.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, Perfect Beds”
Reviews.Author: europe2go
Reviews.Content: I stayed for six nights in a junior suite at the Sofitel Amsterdam at the end of Aug/beginning of Sept. Here is my synopsis: Pros: The bed. I would venture to say it was the most comfortable bed I have ever slept in while traveling - and I travel at least one to three months per year. Best nights of sleep I have had in a very long time. I never heard one outside noise the entire week. Even if there were no more positives, the bed was worth the entire stay. The location. It amuses me that someone would book a hotel within a 5-minute walk of the Red Light district, in a city where smoking marijuana in public is accepted, and then fault the hotel for reminding them of the seedier side of Amsterdam. We walked the city every day for a week and never even happened upon the Red Light District - literally forgot to visit it! And the smoking coffee shops are everywhere in the city - not just on the same street as the hotel. That being said, I found the location perfect for the first-time traveler to Amsterdam simply because it's in very close proximity to many of the places a new tourist visits. It's about 3 blocks from Central Station (walk or pay 15E for a taxi!), it's around the corner from Dam Square, and there is a tram stop directly in front of the hotel - it truly doesn't get anymore convenient than that! The staff. Although I wasn't sure at first, the staff (for the most part) turned out to be helpful and courteous. We were treated with respect and kindness no matter what we asked for or needed to know. As with most European hotel experiences I've had, they don't actively jump in and offer to help, but they are there when you need them. One thing I greatly appreciate about Amsterdam is that most people in the service industry speak perfect English. Cons: The lighting. I agree with the other reviewers that the lighting absolutely needs to be improved in both the bedroom/living areas AND the bathroom. My friend's room next door was even worse - and that was before two of her lightbulbs burned out. The fitness room. Although it is a treat to be offered a fitness room in a European hotel, this one isn't worth calling a treat. A recumbant bike whose seat would not stay in position, a rowing machine, and a thing to do crunches/sit-ups. No free weights and no paper cups for the water fountain. It needed an eliptical or treadmill or both! The Internet. T-mobile - need I say more? I spent a small fortune to have access for a week here, then went to Prague and got 24/7 wireless for free. Other than that, I found no fault with Sofitel Amsterdam, and although I probably would not stay there again (because I always like to try other parts of a city when I come back), I would definitely recommend it to any first-time visitors. I thought it was a good value, great location, and the pros definitely outweighed the cons. I'd like to add that if you are a chocolate lover, you absolutely MUST walk to Puccini at Singel 184. Simply the best, IMHO. It's no more than 10 minutes to walk from the Sofitel.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing stay”
Reviews.Author: annarex
Reviews.Content: My new husband and I booked the sofitel for the begining of our honeymoon in Europe. I must say we absolutely loved this hotel. After flying for 17 hours we were greeted by the hotel manager who made us feel very comfortable even tho we were stinky and tired. We had mentioned when we booked that it was our honeymoon and lucky us, we got an amazing room with a king size bed and vaulted ceilings. Not only that but the windows reached from floor to ceiling. We were right on the street and when the windows were open we cold hear the hustle and bustle of Amsterdam below us. This didn't bother us at all and made us feel like we were in the heat of the city. This Sofitel is in a perfect location. We were able to walk to just about every area from the hotel and enjoyed the cafe and coffeshop just up the street. I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Sofitel”
Reviews.Author: ChloeB21
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from staying at the Sofitel in Amsterdam and I had a great experience there. The hotel is really near to all the main tourist attractions (such as Dam Square) but it is in a quieter street so you feel safer. It is also within easy walking distance of the train station. The staff were very friendly and gave us lots of information about things to do and places to go. The bed was so comfy, I wish I had the same one at home! The room was immaculate and I couldn't really fault much about the hotel except we didn't really have a view but that didn't bother me, after all, you don't visit a city to stay in your room all the time!

Reviews.Title: “Very disappointed in this Sofitel”
Reviews.Author: oenoluvr
Reviews.Content: My wife and I usually love staying at Sofitels, however this one is worth skipping! Even though it has a prime location and is easy walking distance to many key attractions (including the red light district if you are interested in that sort of thing). The hotel itself leaves something to be desired. First of all, the parking situation: If you are driving, do not stay in this area AT ALL! It is very tricky to get around and they are doing a lot of road construction in the area. Once you do get to the parking area it is a ways down the street and it was not very enjoyable dragging our suit cases from the car. What I was most upset about was cost of the parking. We are not strangers to parking in European city centers, however, when we found the cost of parking was 40 euros we were a bit upset, especially since the website does not bother to mention the cost. Next, the rooms: The rooms were quite nice except for the noise and the lighting. We had every available light turned on and the room was still very dark, and that was during the day. We could also hear a lot of noise from our neighbors and from above us. We skipped breakfast for 2 reasons. First, we were tired of eating big breakfasts (this was our last night of a month long trip in Europe). Secondly, the price 22 Euros/person. A steep ransom for eggs, cheese and cold cuts. Another turnoff for us was the surroundings. As soon as you step outside the hotel you are in the thick of what makes Amsterdam not-so-charming, the sex and drugs! We are not prudes, but we both feel that Amsterdam could be one of the Europe's most charming, attractive cities if they got rid of the red light area and the drugs. But because of these, there seems to be a layer of scum on the city that can't be scraped off and is always a distraction no matter where you go in Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Don't bother.”
Reviews.Author: daisyk
Reviews.Content: We have just returned for a trip to Germany and Amsterdam, having enjoyed our stay at Mercure in Koblenz, we booked the Sofitel in Amsterdam, which is owned by the same group. The location is very good, however, the hotel certainly does not represent good value for money. It is dark and a bit depessing. Housekeeping was practically non existent, perhaps becasue we stayed over a weekend, but for Euro 450.00 for two nights we expected the the beds would be made etc. New towels were delivered and that was that. Lack of cleaning was evident in the public areas also, the caprets were dirty, whatever was on them when we arrived was still there when we left! Unlke the Mercure, where I could use the computer in the foyer free of charge each day to check my emails, sofitel charged 5.00 euro for 15 minutes. I'm sure there are better choices to be had in central Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: v_et_p
Reviews.Content: Location: 10 minutes walk from Centraal Station, 5 minutes from the Dam place. A few tramways stop right in front of the hotel, line 2 and 5. Several bagel and coffeeshops nearby and also some good restaurants. Room: We spent a week in a confortable bedroom with a kingsize bed (speaking of it, this bed was amazing !). The room size was average, but in a pleasant way. Cable TV with PPV option available (the latter not for free of course, 16 euros/movie). Decoration and furniture was a bit faded but nice. Air conditioned worked perfectly. The view was so-so, but we still had a nice view of Amsterdam's rooftops and churchs. Toilets and bathtub/shower are like new and clean. Other: The hotel's bar is cosy, think of a 1930 Orient Express trainwagon lookalike. The desk staff was always helpful and polite. They give tourist's information about city's interests, museums and transports. Note: don't forget about the 5% city tax you'll have to pay when you check out. We will certainly return if we are in Amsterdam again !

Reviews.Title: “Best Night's Sleep of my life”
Reviews.Author: europatrotter
Reviews.Content: The bed was the most comfortable bed I've ever slept on- and these words are coming from a flight attendant who has sampled more hotel beds than I care to remember. The room was cozy and quiet, the staff helpful and professional and the service in the bar was friendly. The interior was tasteful for its time, but a warmer, lighter, modern makeover would feel more comfortable. Ideally located near the central station and tram. We didn't use the dining facilities but across the street is a cafe with outdoor seating serving up tasty hot breakfast and coffee for under 10 euros.

Reviews.Title: “Well located, reasonable 4 star hotel”
Reviews.Author: mcoops
Reviews.Content: We'd stayed in an excellent Sofitel in midtown New York a couple of years ago, and found this in Amsterdam for a decent price, so decided to give it a go. Positives/negatives: + Walking distance from Central train station + Close to many key areas including Dam Square + Our room was clean, quiet and comfortable + Attractive public area downstairs + Quirky bar - replica of an Orient Express-type train carriage + Friendly reception and housekeeping staff - Decor on our floor and in room a bit tired - Located on major road from station On the whole, it felt like a good value, low-end 4 star hotel, doing everything pretty well, but not feeling that special.

Reviews.Title: “a wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: richcat
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Sofitel Amsterdam for 8 days.From the time we got there until the time we left,they made you feel like royalty.Any request you had was never too much effort. They were always willing to help you out.Our air conditioner didn"t seem cool enough,so we called the front desk.In a matter of minutes,they were up there and came back later to make sure it was working properly.The beds are one of the most comfortable we have ever slept in.The maids kept the rooms very clean.The hotel is centrally located and they will help you out with restaurants and anywhere you want to go..They have a minibar in the room,but didn't use it. There is a supermarket just up the street,so we brought soda and snacks there and put it in the refrigerator to keep it cold.If we go back to Amsterdam,we will definitely stay at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Mediocre”
Reviews.Author: roberta_nyc
Reviews.Content: Mediocre best describes everything about this hotel. Staff was ok, the rooms were dark, stuffy & somewhat unpleasant (excluding the comfy beds) & the location was convenient enough. There are so many hotels, all with an equally convenient location & priced comparably, that I wouldnâ€™t recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very Good Hotel in Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: RMiowa
Reviews.Content: We wanted a comfortable hotel within walking distance of many of Amsterdam's delights, and the Sofitel Amsterdam fills the bill. It is a painless 10-minute walk from the Central Station train from the airport, and is surrounded by cafes, shops and interesting nightlife. The front desk staff was friendly and efficient and we were in our room in a couple of minutes. Rooms are smaller than American standards, but are extremely comfortable. Great beds, nice bathroom, excellent TV, and our room was very quiet. The breakfast buffet is not worth the 22 euros, but there are many nearby places to get a decent meal. My wife was pleased that there are two quilt shops almost next door, and I was pleased that there are at least two coffeeshops in the block! You can walk west to the Anne Frank House museum, or south to the major art museums, or just have coffee at a sidewalk cafe and enjoy the people watching. Nice place in a nice neighborhood.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful location, excellent service”
Reviews.Author: athenor84
Reviews.Content: I stayed in Sofitel Hotel Amsterdam for two nights during a weekend in June 07. After a lot of searching I found by my travel agent this hotel: great location (a few minutes walking from Dam Square and from Central Station), good price (160 Euros per night with complementary breakfast) and great service. Staff has always been very kind and has always been at disposal for suggestions on visiting Amsterdam and room service was fast, very polite and efficient. I really enjoyed breakfast served in main restaurant (I do suggest you to book it in advance, so you can save up to 10 euros per person per night). Rooms are not very big but they are definitely comfortable (try the legendary Sofitel beds) and furnished with everything you would expect: minibar, soft bathrobes, tons of extra pillows and very fine bathfoams "Sofitel branded". I did really enjoy my short stay, I do really recommend this french style hotel to everyone visiting Amsterdam both for leisure and business (try the internet access on a 28" screen in your room!!).

Reviews.Title: “The best bed .... ever!”
Reviews.Author: Hampshire-resident
Reviews.Content: Spent 3 nights here at the end of May. Got an excellent rate (only about 20 Euros more than the Ibis at the station was charging). The hotel is within easy walking distance of the central station, the Dam Square, and most of the major sights of Amsterdam. Check in was efficient and all of the staff were courteous. There was no real view out of the room - the window overlooked the back of another property, but at night this meant that the room was very quiet. The room was extremely well appointed - I would describe the size as adequate - I was staying alone so the fact that there was only one easy chair wasn't a problem, but had I been sharing, this would have been annoying. I was slightly surprised that there was no room safe. Excellent air conditioning. Breakfast was 22 Euros - expensive but very good and took the place of lunch on the two days that I had it. Try Humphrey's restaurant for an excellent value (3 courses for 19 Euros) dinner - turn right out of the hotel, take the first wide street on the right and it's on the right. The bed was unbelievably comfortable - 3 excellent nights' sleep - and information in the room about where I could have bought one. If you can get a good deal on this hotel, stay at it.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel right in mist of everything.”
Reviews.Author: worldtraveled
Reviews.Content: This was a lovely hotel close to everything. The staff were all delightful and helpful. This hotel has the best showers I have ever seen in a hotel, it was fabulous and the beds were the most comfortable with all the down pillows and comforters, it was had to get up in the morning. The breakfast which was included had evertyhing you could want and was excellent. We faced the street and did not hear anything very quiet. I would love to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Beware of a con !”
Reviews.Author: YNS1981
Reviews.Content: Hotel is fine. Rooms as expected. Don't get a room next to the alley, people up drinking til 5 in the morning, then the road sweeper to contend with an hour after that. Booked on-line, the print off gives the impression breakfast is paid for in the room rate. Nothing said when checking in. Explaination where the hotel facilities were etc. 2 of us had a pot of coffee in the morning , charged 44 euro ( Â£30)................ for a pot of coffee !!!!!!!!!! Even the receptionist agreed the booking for breakfast was mis-leading, the hotel director gave the usual company line. Stayed in many Accor chain hotels all across europe , without issue. Never again ! Unless I get a reasonable refund.

Reviews.Title: “excellent city break”
Reviews.Author: strumble
Reviews.Content: This was our 4th visit to the Sofitel. We like the position on a road with tram access that is within easy walking distance of the train station.It is also surprisingly quiet and away from the seedier areas! Our room this time was disappointingly small and faced a narrow alleyway.This did not matter too much as we did not intend to spend time in the hotel.The bed is excellent - so good that they advertise the bed and have a trademark - look up "MyBed" ! The mattress toppper made it so comfy that our lovely bed at home has lost some of its appeal! The hotel is superbly positioned for sightseeing by tram or foot. We would recommend one of the many boat trips that depart every few minutes from just outside the train station.A good introduction to the lovely canals. Do visit a pancake house too! Amsterdam is a great base for day trips either DIY or organised. We have visited Delft, Haarlem,Keukenhof gardens (Spring only), Aalkmaar,the windmills etc etc.All are so easy to reach from Amsterdam. Museums too are excellent. If you want a laugh visit the toilets with transparent doors near the Rijksmuseum.They are down steps by the bar just opposite the museum shop, by the lake. When you lock the doors they become opaque. Never seen anything like it before!!!

Reviews.Title: “Perect home away from home.”
Reviews.Author: karensells
Reviews.Content: This was the perfect first hotel to stay at in Amsterdam. The room was cozy, clean and for us, non smoking. The breakfast which was included was the fabulous buffet with everything from crepes to scrambled eggs, bacon, smoked salmon, fruit and on and on. It was so nice not to have to hunt down somewhere for the breakfast meal, have it there, relax and plan the day. We also ate one dinner meal at the hotel-it also was very good. Nice staff. Excellent location, easy walk to train station, Dam Square, etc.

Reviews.Title: “very nice”
Reviews.Author: lexi35
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a 3 night break in Amsterdam. The Sofitel is very nice, the staff were friendly, the rooms were cleaned every day and it is well located near Dam square and the central station. The breakfast had a choice for everyone.
