The beds were fantastic. We would return tomorrow.

Reviews.Title: “Good location and great bed”
Reviews.Author: sjturner
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a 5 minute walk from central station on a road which has many other large hotel chains on it. The room was reasonable for the price but the bed was very very nice! I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Decent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Granville27
Reviews.Content: A good place to stay in Amsterdam. Staff were friendly and gave us a decent room at the front of the hotel. The bed was amazing! Batchroom was fine but the water wasn't as hot as we are used to. We didn't spend much time in the hotel, but suffice to say it is close to everything. It is worth joining the Sofitel Awards program (free) which allows a late 4pm checkout.

Reviews.Title: “very good beds, great locatrion for tourists”
Reviews.Author: anonymousfromlondon
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here a number of times on business. The staff are exceptionally friendly, the beds amazing and the location is excellent if you were on a weekend break and fancied seeing the centre of Amsterdam on foot On my most recent stay the room was too hot. and a few of the rooms have the odd broken tile in the bathrrom but overall it is a good experience

Reviews.Title: “Good location, excellent staff, very nice bed!”
Reviews.Author: tiger8899
Reviews.Content: My wife and I arrived at Sofitel Amsterdam at 6.00 a.m. in the morninig and they were able to give us a room in an hour. It was a pleasent surprise! The only thing is hotel is a little smaller than other Sofitels we are used to. The room is small but the bed is amazing. Room service was excellent but the buffet was expensive. Overall, I would definitely stay there again. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful staff, all in all a fine experience”
Reviews.Author: haute-epoque
Reviews.Content: The best thing about this hotel was the staff. Every single member of staff I had any interaction with was polite, friendly, and helpful. The next best thing was the bed. Extremely comfortable. The rooms was immaculate and in good order. The gentleman's club look wasn't particularly to my taste, but hey, that's a minor point. Good location, near the railway station, on the edge of the old city with all the attractions within easy reach. My only issue was street noise from an argument at 5am one morning. Other than that, the hotel was a 5, and the staff 5+.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Beds and great location”
Reviews.Author: uklad79
Reviews.Content: Excellent location 5min walk from Central Station. The hotel has a nice bar but the prices are off the scale. The rooms are well furnished with and have a small fridge, loads of TV channels with many shows in English, the beds are so comfy I found it hard to get out of it. We had a room that looks over to some other rooms which was lovely and quite day and night. The only let down was the staff. We opened a can of diet coke from the minibar when we arrived, half way through the drink my partner noticed the expiry on the bottom of the can was May 06! When I took it down to the reception the next day along with a second can I found in the mini bar dated Sept06 I asked to speak to the Hotel manager I got to speak to the assistant F&B manager who was clueless. He said he would look into it and get back to me, which he never did! Very bad service since they were selling out of date products, I will write to their head office since they didn't seem intrested in the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Best jhotel beds I have had for a long time!”
Reviews.Author: JaxM
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 2 nights at the beginning of February. Great location and within walking distance to most attractions. Lovely staff who were very helpful and friendly. We were upgraded free of charge to Exec rooms as we had two rooms booked and wanted to be on the same floor which was very nice of them. The rooms were huge by european standards and very comfortable. We had a room facing the street and while there was a bit of noise from the trams it was quite quiet at night. If you are a light sleeper though you may wish to request a room at the back of the property. Best thing about the rooms was the beds. Lovely, huge, comfortable beds with feather pads on top of the mattresses and lovely feather pillows. Would stay again just for the good night's sleep!

Reviews.Title: “Good location but very poor housekeeping, among others...”
Reviews.Author: ZhengHe
Reviews.Content: First the good part. It's at a good location, near Central station, tram stop and many attractions. That's pretty much where the good part stops. The hotel is small, but not intimiate like a boutique hotel. It claims to be 4-star but more like a 3-star compared to others. Rooms are quite small. Bathroom small and old. No shower curtain. Shower pressure painfully low, almost like a drip, any time of the day. No newspaper delivery to the room in the morning, not even if you ask. The worst part is the quality of the housekeeping. Shower tub filled with human hair of varying lengths and degree of curliness. Lots of hairs on the floor. After complaining to the front desk and return to the room in the evening to find more hair on the floor. Laundry bag (filled with form filled out) left on the bag not picked up (even though the tip underneath was well noticed by housekeeper and taken). I feel when a 4-star hotel can't even keep hair off of floors and bathtubs, and housekeeping staff poorly trained or simply don't care, the hotel has lost its soul and management probably do not care either. The othe Sofitel, the Grand Demeur, is much nicer and service much better.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay in a comfortable hotel”
Reviews.Author: dogsareforlife
Reviews.Content: We liked this hotel very much. 2 night stay booked via the hotelâ€™s website. They upgraded us from a deluxe room to an executive room on arrival - with welcoming chocolate, Evian water, bath pearls and a teddy bear tooâ€¦Voucher for free drinks in the bar was also handed out at reception along with a useful map and some other information. The welcome was warm and sincere - a nice touch. The room was at the front of the hotel (250) and had 3 large windows, a huge blissfully comfortable bed, a bathroom with a double shower and a separate WC. Storage was more than adequate and robes and slippers were also provided. Although the trams run outside, there was hardly any noise and I slept 8 hours without waking once (extremely rare for me). Breakfast was served downstairs (just off the lobby) with a good selection of hot and cold food - all good quality and the service was again cheerful and efficient. We didnâ€™t eat an evening meal at the hotel so I cannot comment on the restaurant menu. The location is superb. Itâ€™s a short walk from the central Station - easy even with medium roll along luggage, although you could get a taxi or a tram if you were feeling lazy or have mobility problems. Dam Sq. is a short walk away, as is the Jordaan area (Anne Frankâ€™s house etc.) and the canal stop to get sightseeing boats. The hotel can give you any information you need. A great stay and we would definitely choose this one again

Reviews.Title: “Third time at the Sofitel”
Reviews.Author: fred2004
Reviews.Content: This was my third stay at this hotel, and this is my second review of it on tripadvisor. My first rating was 4 out of 5, but this time it is only 3 out of 5. I would give 2 out of 5 if my stay had not been so cheap. You can often have a good special offer on the Sofitel website, and I never paid more than 128 euros a night in this hotel (the regular price is 255 euros per night). For comparison, the Ibis hotel (a 2-star hotel owned by the same hotel chain, Accor) near the Sofitel is about 115 euros a night, and offers no promotional rates. At check-in, I was given a voucher for a free drink at the bar because I was a returning customer. The receptionist had a friendly attitude rather than a formal one, but he was very nice. When I entered my room, I saw a smoke detector though I had requested a smoking room. I called the concierge who told me that it was for... marijuana detection, not cigarette. What a shame for a 4-star hotel to lie to their guests as if they were kids! Of course, it was just a desactivated cigarette-smoke detection device. Anyway, I didn't intend to smoke marijuana. But one night, I could cleary smell cannabis in the corridor at my floor, I guess that's the downside of the promotional rates (another one may be this guy I saw yawning extremely loudly at the beautiful hotel bar). That's very disappointing, but there is more. One night, I was out and came back at the hotel at 3 o'clock. There is a nightbell, so I rang it, but no one opened the door. I waited and rang again and again. Then a pizza delivery person came (it seems that you can order a pizza at 3 am in Amsterdam) and told me that there is usually always someone to open the door and that it was the first time that something like that happened to him at this hotel. I tried to look through the window next to the door because it was the location of the reception, and I was (barely) able to see someone sleeping in an armchair through the curtain, in a small office. I couldn't reach the window to knock at it, though. The pizza deliverer had a cellphone and tried several times to call the hotel, but no one answered. At some point, he decided to go to the police station, across the street. While he was there, the door finally opened. I came in, and went to the reception. I explained to the receptionist that I was stuck outside for about half an hour, that a pizza deliverer was at the police station because he was worried something unusual happened, etc. The receptionist's answer was a single word: "ok". He did not tell me that he fell asleep or anything, he acted as if everything was normal. "I got stuck outside for half an hour" - "ok". Can you imagine that? I can understand that he fell asleep because that's the kind of things that can happen to you at least once in your life. But I can't understand that he did not apologize, or that he was the only person in the hotel at the reception. Another disappointment was on my second stay in this hotel. One morning, I was sleeping when the maid came to clean the room, so I told her to come back later. The concierge later phoned me to ask me if I wanted the room to be cleaned today or not. I asked if it was possible to have it cleaned at 2 o'clock and the concierge told me that it was ok. I left my room and came back at 3pm (I was ill this day and needed to stay most of the day in my room), and the room had not been cleaned. The maid finally came at 5pm, while I was in the room, which was not very conveniant. All those problems make me think that you can't rely too much on the staff. The room service menu at night is rather limited. Pizzas which are not very tasty, a really good club sandwich, and maybe one or two other options which I have not tested. One night, I had a tiramisu for desert, but unfortunately it was not completely unfrozen. The next night, I ordered the tiramisu again and it was good. On the phone, I was asked "and a bottle of water like yesterday ?", which is a nice attention. The room itself is nice, clean, maybe a bit small if you pay the full price. It was on the 5th floor and was almost identical to the rooms on the 1st floor. You can read my previous review for more information about the room. There was only one bathrobe though it was a double room and we were two. Oh, and I have to say that the beds are incredibly comfortable. So I felt disappointed this time, but I must say that I would return if I can get the same promotional rate. The first time I paid 99 euros/night, the second time I paid 119 euros, and the third time 128 euros. At such rates, this hotel has a really good value. But you will certainly not find the feeling of luxury here, in any way. This is a very comfortable hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Long stay at the Sofitel!”
Reviews.Author: Florida.Girl.2006
Reviews.Content: My work brought me to Amsterdam for an extended stay and I really enjoyed the Sofitel! During my various stays, I was booked in a couple of different rooms, which gave me a good overview of the hotel. First, the rooms in the 500's are on the front of the building and they are very spacious. I believe I stayed in 502 and it had a lot of room and a big bathroom. Some of the rooms on the back of the building tend to be smaller. I always asked and they would move me once they had room. I would recommend asking for a room with space if you feel cramped. They were really nice about moving rooms. The double and kind beds are really comfortable! I think that when you are away from home, there is nothing more important than a comfortable bed. After staying in other Amsterdam hotels that are in the center of the city, none of those beds even compare to the Sofitel. Location: You cannot beat this location! First, the train station is only a 5-7 minute walk away. I took the train from the airport to the hotel multiple times. It was quicker than a cab ride and the walk was really easy. Second, it is close to Dam Square and backs up to a ton of great shopping. Third, it is close to the Singel canal that was a lot of great places to eat. Complaints -- I think that the room service menu could be updated. I do, however, recommend the pizza and the burger selection. Their wine selection for room service is also pretty good. My second complaint is the fitness center. There is hardly anything down there (only a rowing machine and a bike). That being said, most of the hotels in Amsterdam are lacking on the fitness center. I would not hesitate to stay here again! If you are in Amsterdam for an extended stay, no hotel will be nicer to deal with!

Reviews.Title: “Very comfortable bed”
Reviews.Author: Hallinan
Reviews.Content: I stayed here on my own for a couple of nights in March. I got a good rate. The hotel was very nice. Very conveniently located and the bed was really comfortable! I would definitely recommend it for a stay in Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel”
Reviews.Author: LEDG
Reviews.Content: Excellent stay, hotel is in a great location and the rooms are good, well sized, bathroom was good size. Very clean well kept. The beds are the most comfortable ever, like a massive marshmallow! The breakfast is brilliant, with loads of choice, restaurant, amenities, staff all brilliant. Would recommend. Only downside I can think of is that as stated by others reviews, they do not provide much in the tea/coffee making kit, but the card said that you could have more if

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant Stay”
Reviews.Author: przyk
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I recently stayed 4 nights at the Sofitel Amsterdam. As others have written, the hotel is very conveniently located. I paid euro 119 per night by paying for the room at the time of booking. (There was an extra 5% city tax, which was clearly explained on my reservation confirmation). For the rate I believe it was an excellent value. I may have been a bit disappointed if I had paid much more for the room. The room was very small by American standards. I have stayed in other hotels in Europe, but I expected a little more room in a 4 star hotel. There was barely enough space to hang our clothes. The bed was soft and comfortable. The bathroom was big enough and the shower was okay. The toiletries and towels were great. The curtains were dark and allowed us to sleep late in the mornings. The hotel was also very quiet. We never heard any noise outside of our room. The hotel staff was all friendly and helpful. As mentioned by a few others we were able to get our room upon arrival in the morning. it was great to get a shower and a nap after our transatlantic flight. We did not eat in the the restaurant. We did eat dinner at a small Italian restaurant Napoli(?) next door to the hotel. The food was nothing special, but it was reasonably priced and it was worth going to if you want to stay near the hotel. I would recommend this hotel to anyone visiting Amsterdam for leisure or business travel.

Reviews.Title: “Mediocre”
Reviews.Author: Chezza27
Reviews.Content: Positive points of the hotel were: - the excellent central location; - OK sized room; - the divinely soft bed. However: - the decor was dated (and hideous); - they tried to make me pay a city charge which they had not informed me about when I booked - I was under the impression I had pre-paid for everything (though they did eventually give me the benefit of the doubt which was good); - our key card didn't always work; and - the shower was REALLY pathetic. Service was friendly enough but overall the hotel was probably not quite what I was expecting/hoping for. Overall, a mediocre experience.

Reviews.Title: “A real treat!”
Reviews.Author: Juleschilly
Reviews.Content: Have just returned from a wonderful trip to Amsterdam, made really special by staying at the Sofitel. It was really easy to find as previous posts say, just 5 mins walk from the station - a great location for all the attractions with a tram stop right outside. The reception staff were very friendly and check in was smooth. We were delighted to find our room ready at 11am! The room was pretty much as we had expected from other posts. Our one disappointment was that it was on the side of the hotel with a poor view but other than that it was a lovely room. THE BED is the most luxurious bed I have ever slept in. It truly is like sinking into a fluffy marshmallow & so hard to get out of! We didn't have breakfast in the hotel as at 22euros we thought it a bit steep. We just popped over the road to a little cafe & ate there for less than 5 euros! Another great thing was that we didn't need to vacate the room until 12noon. As others have said the tea/coffee facilities were a bit mean with only 1 tea bag & no fresh milk, just a coffee whitener which tastes just awful in tea. I'm sure you could have asked for more but to be honest we just couldn't be bothered. We would reccomend getting an "I Am Amsterdam" card either from the Tourist Information or pre-pay on Expedia. Depending on how long you are staying you can choose either a 24, 48 or 72 hour pass. We had a 48 hour pass which cost appox Â£28 each. For that you get free entrance into loads of museums & attractions (inc. Rikjsmuseum and Van Gogh), a free trip guided canal boat tour, lots of discounts to many other places and restaurants and free public transport on trams, buses & metro. We certainly got our moneys worth out of it as most museums are approx 10 Euros entrance. The only one which wasn't included was the Anne Frank museum which is an absolute must in our opinion - a very moving experience & worth the 40min queue. There's so much to see in Amsterdam that 2 days wasn't really enough but if we come back we will certainly stay at the Sofitel again.

Reviews.Title: “Dissappointing - not good value”
Reviews.Author: RichJenkins
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a weekend and found the room quite small and the corridor carpet in need of a clean. The tea and coffee facilities were mean - ie. only one teabag, one coffee sachet etc - and were not replenished every day. There was a fair amount of noise from the lift, and from the air conditioning unit outside. One of the front desk staff was fairly unsympathetic when we needed to consult with a doctor - and had an "unfortunate" manner when it came to slapping on the extra 5% city tax at checkout time! The 'mybed' bed, however, was fantastic - big and soft - and all of the other staff we came across were very pleasant and helpful. In the past we've stayed in various Novotels and other hotels in the accor hotel chain, in different European countries, and been impressed with the service, convenience and value we received. This was a special weekend trip (birthday) - so we thought we go 'upmarket' an try out a Sofitel - and it ended up being dissappointing - perhaps we would have been happier in the Ibis...

Reviews.Title: “What a gem”
Reviews.Author: skierlee
Reviews.Content: This is a great place to stay when in Amsterdam. The hotel was clean, quiet and in a great location. The staff was extremely knowledgable and patient with all of our questions. They even helped us figure out the metro schedules. The room had high ceilings and this fabulous down bed that was very hard to get out of in the morning. The bathroom was large and very clean. The morning breakfast was wonderful and had lots of variety. The area was full of restaruants and littel pastry and coffee shops and close enough to Dam square and the train station to get to anything else we wanted to see. I felt like the Sofitel was my little nest that I could then go out and explore knowing it was waiting for me at the end of the day. I would recommend this hotel to everyone.

Reviews.Title: “A nice one in Europe”
Reviews.Author: Cypresscreek
Reviews.Content: We had nice experience with this hotel. Location is convenient, though you still need to walk about 5 minutes from the main train station (not far, but it matters when you have luggages). Room is clean with comfortable bed, not big not reasonable and with AC!

Reviews.Title: “I felt like a queen!”
Reviews.Author: kar_kimba
Reviews.Content: This hotel was an excellent stay! I ended my two week European/African journey with one more night in Amsterdam. I was originally scheduled to stay in a hostel but wanted some luxury so I booked this hotel through tripadvisor.com. The queen sized bed was luxurious, with a beautiful down comfortor and tons of pillows. The bathroom was large and came with some great amenities. The staff were friendly and courteous. The location is great and it is two streets down from Damrak, one of the major streets in downtown Amsterdam! I would highly recommned this hotel to anyone!

Reviews.Title: “Great Place - Highly Recommended”
Reviews.Author: CWilkie74
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Sofitel during a very hot summer weekend in July. The hotel being a welcome (and cool!) retreat after a long days sightseeing. Location - couldn't be better. A ten minute walk from the main station and most of the major sights. Amsterdam is a great city to explore on foot so even the sights a little further away (like the Rijks Museum or Anne Franks house) are but a pleasent stroll away. If you don't fancy walking use the Canal Bus - it offers a hop on - hop off service to all the major sights and leaves from the main staion area just up the road. The hotel is on one of Amsterdam's main shopping streets so if you do need to buy anything you'll be spoilt for choice. There are plenty of bars and restaurants a stones through away but it may be better to pick somewhere a little further away from the main tourist areas. The hotel itself was lovely, the staff friendly and attentive. Check in / out went smoothly and every one concerned worked really hard to make my stay as pleasurable as possible. The room (number 408) was pleasantly decorated and well appointed, and had all the facilites one could possibly need. TV with channels in numerous languages, 'expensive' mini bar, bath robes, tea/coffee making facilites to name but a few. The beds were extremely comfortable, the air con worked well,!!! and the maid service was also of a very high standard. Previous reviews mentioned noise but I can't say I agree, bar the ocassional tram passing (which I felt was quite a pleasent sound) the hotel was really quiet considering its location. You get a complimentary bottle of water on arrival - but this is not replaced! All in all - a great hotel.

HotelInfo.Name: Convent Hotel Amsterdam
HotelInfo.Address: Nieuwezijds Voorburgwal 67, Amsterdam 1012 RE, The Netherlands
